Unfortunately the temple is in a heavy stage of rebuilding with a lot of scaffolding. However, the elephants are still very visible and you can imagine how amazing this place must have been previously. It will be interesting to return in the future and see the progress.

This temple also known as Bishwanath (or on the boards outside of it Visvesvara) is currently going major re-construction. Temple is completely covered in scaffolding and is closed to visitors. The temple has 2 plinths then 2 roofs. You cannot see that much really but you can see the two big elephants with their riders thru the mesh gate. if you walk away you can get an idea of how it used to look. Rated it as average as you cannot really see it. Once completed I am sure it will be very good!
The food and ambiance here is best in patan and I really appreciate there service also, their sukuti here is the best I very had
Found unknown object in coffee. None of the staff knows what it is. My experience says small cockroach. Manager can only say sorry
I liked the setting, it felt like a nice cafe escape, away from the traffic an chaos outside. Service was great, and the food was ok.

We enjoyed 3 meals here as the location is central and although the price is a little higher than most places, the food was consistently delicious and we were happy to pay more knowing we would get great service and scrumptious meals! We went there on trip advisor recommendation and were never disappointed by our experience. Despite the extensive menu my favourite was the bakery treats... yummm!

We had a nice cup of tea and some local dhal curry all of which was really good but not outstanding. The roof top terrace was closed, which we were hoping to utilise, which didn't help our experience.

During my trip to Kathmandu, I was advised that Bhaktapur and Patan were must visit places so on a weekend I decided to visit the Patan Royal Palace, Patan Museum and other sights of Patan. This restaurant came highly recommended and we were not disappointed. The food was expensive but worth the quality.

column7: Reasonably priced nice food and cozy setting
column8: Visited this cafe today for breakfast with some friends. The breakfast menu is varied and the food tasted good and is presented nicely. The staff are warm and smiley. The cafe is tucked away a little from the edges of Dunbar square, and is situated at the back of the guest house it is in, the dining area has cute Nepali decorations and natural light floods in. The cafe felt very clean and I enjoyed a half decent coffee from the espresso machine. It was just 10% tax which is more reasonable than most restaurants surrounding the square. I'd like to visit again for lunch or dinner.  Wifi avaliable. Clean western restrooms.

column7: Average food, ok atmosphere, ok staff
column8: In spite of references in a few travelbooks we did not experience anything special at Cafe de Patan. The tastes of our Newari traditional vegetarian dish (a set menu composed of several snacks in the menu) did not blend, the food did not seem to be prepared with care and presentation does not look in anyway like the photo's presented by management on their site.Not worth visiting again.
Have taken my tour groups from experience outdoors Nepal many times.the restaurant is very quiet.the ambient is authentic. Good food ,friendly staff.

We had a very good experience of this restaurant. The setting was beautifull and the staff was very friendly. For food we had the mo-mo and the ceasar salade, both really good. According to us, this is one of Nepal’s best restaurants!

column7: Rajesh is amazing and so is the food
column8: We have nothing but positive things to say about our experience here. Rajesh, our server, was really top notch.  We just stopped for a quick bite because or kids were hungry and ended up eating. Really good coffee and great pasta.  Got to eat while the monkeys fought!

column7: A True Breakout Space in a Garden
column8: This wonderful open air garden cafe, sits within trees, bushes and flowers. There are pergolas and pavilions allowing dining under shade. The food is simple, tasty and healthy! I enjoyed the traditional Nepali thali with rice, dal, vegetables and mutton! When you visit the Patan Darbaar Square, end your visit the Museum Cafe. The photo image on the back page of my book LETTERS TO A YOUNG ARCHITECT was taken in this garden restaurant! See amazon -

I like the food quality of this restaurant. We went there in group and their services were professional. The sitting places and the surrounding area was really nice. I appreciate this place. Good for foodies in Patan.

column7: A letdown after an enjoyable visit to the Patan Museum
column8: After 2 hours at the Patan Museum, we were in the mood for a round of hot coffee and stepped across to the attached Patan Museum Cafe for some snacks & coffee. It is an open air café in a garden setting. A point to note before ordering is that tea/coffee/ cocoa orders are provided in pots, not cups - a pot fills nearly 3 cups. Fairly pricey place which I guess is partly to do with its location in the museum complex. After a great experience at the Patan Museum, the Cafe was a letdown, apart from the garden setting.

We loved eating in this nice garden, which was originally a part of the royal palace. The food was not extraordinary but good and the setting was interesting and fascinating. There was an open buffet but we also ordered momo's, the special dumplings of Nepal....More

The museum was shut for the day, but a group of us had dinner after local cultural entertainment by a dancing group. Dancing really interesting. So buffet style meal which was fine. They had passed around some nibbles ... The best being the spicy cubed potatoes. The courtyard setting, with tables and some covered area is an oasis in durbar square.

Visited this cafe at the beginning of April. Looked like a pleasant spot to have a drink and some cake but our experience was ruined by the rudest waiter that I have ever encountered.Was ignored for twenty minutes after arriving. Admittedly he was busy with a group but 20 mins is a long time to wait. When he finally came over I asked for a menu only for him to shout "beer, yes, no??" and walk away without bringing a menu. Another waitress (who was much friendlier) eventually brought us a menu. When we went to pay the waiter, there was no thank you. This cafe is clearly meant to be upmarket but the shockingly bad service we got clearly doesn't reflect this.....

column7: Beautiful and quiet place in the middle of Durbar Square
column8: Well, I was surprised to see the picture of Museum Cafe here on TA because it seems there were many people enjoying the place. When we went there, there were only a couple of us so I loved that it seemed so peaceful and quiet compared to the noise at the Durbar Square. The cafe is inside the Royal Palace and it is very interesting to find a modern garden setting in the middle of everything that's of Newari architecture.  The cafe is operated by the Summit Hotel so the service is expectedly very "hotelish" -- white napkins, well-dressed waiters, etc. It's not a complaint though but I've always liked to dine in places where it's more local and authentic. Nevertheless, the cafe is a very welcome break from all the walking around temples and red-brick houses. I loved that it was quiet and peaceful and of course, service was very prompt and very attentive.  There was very good food presentation, expectedly again! But I wouldn't say it's extraordinary. But it's not bad. :) We ordered Nepali food so just by that alone is already a big thing for us. Naturally, it's a bit pricey compared to the other ones. But if you're looking for a relaxing lunch hour, then maybe you should choose this one.

column7: Great Breakfasts, This cafe is SO Special.
column8: One of my favorites in Patan Durbar Sq area. Great breakfasts, good coffee, enjoyed the specials board. Everything was made with care. This cafe became my morning breakfast hangout. I enjoyed several mornings of omelette with mushrooms & cheese with a little salad of fresh...More

My partner and I visited here for both breakfast and lunch and were happy each time, enjoying some of the various vegetarian options. A slightly more formal dining experience than what we have experienced thus far.

column7: Impeccably decent and clean eatery just off of the mayhem
column8: Our expedition around the UNESCO region of Patan was chaotic and total bombarded our senses ... we were exhausted from batting off beggars and Con-artists seeing us walking through and seeing dollar signs. We turned a corner and found this little place twinkling in white fairy lights. The familiarity of the fairy lights enticed me in. I was on guard Incase it was another lure under false pretences, but I was pleasantly surprised. Kind hospitable waiters attentively serving each table and making every one of the guests feel welcomed and appreciated. Their level of English was impeccable and their class of service. The restaurant had traditional music piping through at optimum level. Table spacing was decent too with the bustle of the restaurant thriving the atmosphere yet, impossible to over hear conversations as they haven’t greedily packed out the venue. Fresh carnations upon every table, with clean table cloths laid neatly and considerately. The place is a dream and totally transformed our day! The food was beautifully presented and well portioned. Prices are more than fair and printed on the menu (so no need for the tiresome bartering!) come here when you come to Patan. It will make your entire trip feel more calm and beautiful. It will also make you realise that not all Nepalese are out to make money off of you without giving back! Really. The most memorable dining experience of Patan.

I ordered some gnocchi that were not very good, but with it we were given some water. I asked if it was filtered water and they said it was...I just spend a night with fever and was not able to do my sightseeing.  Also the prices posted outside are lower than the actual menu. The just say “those are the old prices”
Well located, good service, very good food. I’ve tasted local dishes and it was s nice experience. Prices are okay, except beers (too expensive).
Limited menu but nice location and interesting space. Food was OK but not special. Staff were quite nice.

I go there again and again since over 5 years. The staff is really professional and extremely nice. The food is just perfect. I enjoy specifically their carbonara pasta and vegetarian burger, and indulge occasionally in the special dark chocolate mousse ! I strongly recommend this place, perfect for a small group to enjoy, calm and quiet, a must in Patan.

column7: My favorite place for Western-style breakfast
column8: Before I came to Nepal, I told myself I would only eat local food. But I came to find this was a bit difficult for me, and sometimes eating at restaurants catered to foreigners was nice because it provided a little comfort away from home. I only tried the breakfast here and it was perfect and delicious.. I thought better than most breakfast restaurants in America. I liked eating in the outside patio.. very peaceful and cute cafe.

If you're looking for some peace and quiet combined with great food, then Swotha is the place for you. Stylish surroundings, a tiny garden and great service add to the experience. My menu favorites were the paneer burger, veggie breakfast, cheese cake and nutella crepes. The price-quality ratio is excellent.

Cafe Swotha is a small, bright, quiet, and attractive restaurant on a side street a block away from Patan Durbar Square. The food is delicious, healthy, and varied. After two weeks of the Nepali dal baht staple on a trek, it was refreshing to eat...More

column7: My rating is for the quality of service, obviously.
column8: Cafe Swotha is just at the edge of Patan Durbar Square. I walked in, was seated, and handed the menu, and looked through it while the waiter adjusted the radiant heater. It's a meager menu. I liked the looks of the Nepali thali except for the dessert, which was yogurt. I asked if I could substitute a dessert from their list for the yogurt and the waiter gave me a direct "No". I asked questions about two other options which could have appealed to me, got unhelpful answers, got up and left. My rating is for the quality of service, obviously.
Had a pleasant dinner with my wife. The food is really nice. Highly recommended. The cafe itself is a renovated old style Newari house, which gives you an authentic Experience

column7: Nice variety in a serene location
column8: This restaurant has a good variety of menu items and some delicious cheesecake! We ate an early dinner here while in Patan and both my husband and I enjoyed our selections. I had a walnut feta salad and he had a burger and fries. The restaurant is set kind of back in an alley so it was nice and quiet, and the service was great. The prices were reasonable too!

What a haven. This was one of our favorite places to eat. Interesting menu with mostly Western food - like pasta and gnocchi. Great salads. Also very good breakfast as well as Nepali Thali Set. Beautiful looking place with the loveliest staff.

This is an exceptionally good place in this neighborhood!! It is a nicely decorated, light space with only a few tables and an interesting menu. I have not found a comparably good place to eat and hang out around Patan Durbar square. Not all mains are a hit, though. Stay away from the gnocchi and choose the paneer burger or the veggie sandwich instead! Service is good too.

After wondering into Patan in search of some sort of food for breakfast we found this lovely little cafe. The mood was relaxed and the service was prompt. I liked the look of the outside seating but as it was winter we sat inside. I had the not so English breakfast and my wife had a stuffed pita with grilled vegetables and salad. The potion sizes were generous and we left feeling very happy. Planning our next trip back already!

I enjoyed both breakfast and dinner at this cafe. I was staying at a very nice guest house across the road, Cosy House and they recommended this cafe on there places to go. I was not steered wrong. The breakfast, while a limited selection was very fresh and best ingredients were used, along with french press coffee. Dineer was very good and tasty. I ordered the Nepalese special and had several tastes of several of the local cuisines. I used their wi-fi system that worked very well since I was having to keep up with business back in the US.

column7: Wow! Best meals we've had in Nepal
column8: This is an exceptional experience and not to be missed. Husband and I stayed at the B&B which is associated with the cafe. We were ten days in Kathmandu attending a family wedding and found many reasons to escape the festivities just to eat at the cafe. So did the wedding party. Ahhh, the pasta tagliatelle, the salads and the CHEESECAKE. From breakfast to dinner, every meal was a delight with friendly service, lovely atmosphere and with indoor or outdoor dining. Camille insures that the experience is just right. Lively place in the evening with cocktails, wine and good selection of beers. We will return.
small hidden temple in Patan which is nice to visit. There are a lot of interesting things to see inside and outside..
I did a private guided tour visiting the Golden Temple. It made the experience more memorable, rather than doibg it by myself. A moment of serenity in the midst of the chaos going on outside.
Beautiful temple. There is lots to see, many details. The first floor is very interesting too. Definitely worth it!
Really worth to throw an eye into this Golden Temple. A lot of big and small things can be observed, fringed with gold.

I found this Temple excellent but others may not be so interested. I noticed a guy gave a 'poor' review, commenting on its run-down state. I believe he was unfair and totally missed the point regarding this amazing place. Like many temples in Nepal, it is a living temple, people worship here. Monks hang about. Candles are lit. The architecture is wonderful and brass work amazing. Although I did not see any, this temple is known for feeding rats
We visited the Golden Temple in late afternoon sunshine! Unique atmosphere! Don't miss when you are in Patan.

Easy to find temple grounds close to Durbar Square in Patan. 100 rupee entrance. We were given a guided tour of the temple with explanations of the many statues and paintings that adorned the walls, our guide even showed us the best view point to take a photo of the golden temple itself. We also were allowed into a room upstairs that housed statues and artwork and where several nuns had just finished their chanting. It was a truly magical experience.

column7: More to see than I thought
column8: This is a small Buddhist temple, but I was surprised that there was actually quite a bit to see. We had a guide who gave us the history and made the visit more interesting. There were many gold items that were very beautiful. We stood in one place for awhile to absorb it all. Watch your head as you go through doorways. Doorways are for very short people!  We went in the afternoon, and it wasn’t very crowded. Don’t know if the mornings are busier. If in Patan, this is worth a visit.

when you learn about the history of the Kathmandu valley and the kingdoms that existed within it - it makes all the visits that more interesting. the Golden temple is very impressive and a great visit

Wow. I am so glad I was able to see this temple. the carvings are wonderful as well as the wood work. I loved the interesting use of space - kind of crowded but everywhere you turn you see carvings, metal work, woodwork, and candles burning. Loved it

A visit to this place really worth. Full of ancient architecture and statues makes you feel like you are in different era. Very carefully crafted statues looks like they are living. I really enjoyed visiting this place and Patan town itself.
We hard really good time visiting here. The finest metal craft which inspire me lots and will definitely back again when i come to Nepal.

column7: Very interesting temple in walking distance from Durbar square.
column8: Very interesting temple - I loved the atmosphere there as it was quiet, peaceful and full of authentic character. I enjoyed making my rounds through the temple and listening to the prayer. Wonderful place.

As a Westerner, I found it interesting to experience many of the temples in Nepal, and thought this was worthwhile. I found the art and sculptures to be interesting. This temple was fairly small and seems like it could use a bit of assistance with the upkeep. There is a small fee to enter.

Every time we go to this temple, there's so much to soak in. The premises itself is very beautiful though small but do not forget to take the stairs up to see the beautiful prayer quarters. The sound of prayers made our day.

The Golden Temple is an absolute must visit if you have the opportunity to go to Patan Durbar Square. The energy of this temple fits in with the name. A truly "Golden" experience. The beauty of this temple is simply stunning. Most of my pics from here are on my camera ao unfortunately only have one to share at this time as I am still in Nepal.
a lot of history. peace and calm, excellent paintings and idols. would have been better if people can clean this holy place a bit.
Absolutely stunning and unforgetable experience. Beautiful temple with magic vibes. I could recommend everybody to go, see and smell the Golden Temple in Patan.

This temple offers a very sacred feel for me. Every little details of the architecture brings me to the past time when the temple was builded. I enjoy this temple for an hour after I went sight seeing around the Patan Durbar Square and feeding the pigeons. Nepal offers us a very sacred Hindu touch and feeling. The entrance of the Golden Temple is very "captureable" and it is a very nice place to come.
My favorite temple. Really glad I saw it. Most interesting of all of them in the square. You can go in and walk around.
This is a real gem in the middle of Patan. The temple is fascinating with some amazing architecture and temple ornaments

This is a gorgeous temple. Well even that is an understatement. Might be one of my favourites in Nepal. It is easy to miss and is about a 10 min walk. Look around carefully whilst walking we almost walked past! The carvings and statues are beyond magical. When we visited there was chanting and people sitting together in a corner accompanied by the bells. Beautiful experience

column7: Excellent place. Don't miss it while in Patan
column8: Probably about 10 minutes walk from Durbar Square, the Golden Temple is for sure worth a visit. There are beautiful golden decorations at the main courtyard, but also the whole story about a boy and a monk staying together for 6 months and praying in the temple is very interesting. A must while in Patan!

column7: Enchanting experience in middle of Patan
column8: Walking through the narrow streets of Patan we suddenly stood in front of the Golden Temple. For a minimal charge we visited the gold shining and beautifully ornamented temple. From the firtst floor you have a nice view over the temple and courtyard. The main entrance is guarded by two large lions, one male and one female. Really wordt a visit!

Hindu telex can seem busy and solicited to foreigners but this one has a simple elegance that is entrancing. The architecture is stunning with details that fascinate at every level. Surrounded by interesting lanes and fair trade shopping to provide additional reason to venture forth to thwart, and only a short taxi ride from the neighbouring Kathmandu

column7: Walk A Few Minutes North of Durbar Square
column8: Also known as Kwa Bahal, the Golden Temple is part of a small monastery complex. Once inside, you'll discover a courtyard filled with shrines and statues of deities. The temple itself is three roofs high and made of gilded copper with carved lions guarding the entrance. the metal work on this ancient building and in its artifacts is particularly interesting. See my photos for details.  There was a tremendous amount of activity at this temple with the faithful turning prayer wheels and leaving offerings. This was one of the more exciting visits we made in Patan.

Well, I have to say there's not much to see in Patan aside from Durbar Square and this temple. It's a Tibetan Buddhist temple covered in gold color. The best thing about this temple I have to say, is the craftsmanship (someone also said this somewhere in among the comments). Whenever I see wood-carving works here in Nepal, I do very much appreciate the effort and time that the craft man put in to create such details. This is a fine example for such excellent work. Obviously, when you're already in Patan, you shouldn't skip this temple.

This living/breathing temple is a real gem in Patan and maybe on e of the most interesting in Kathmandu Valley. Also you have opportunity to stay in Hira Guest House which is located on the Temple Property. You won't be disappointed.

It's one of the smaller temples around, but it sure has its beauty from the golden roof to the interesting craving on the smaller windows that's housing the statues of worships, I would recommend a trip if you are in Patan Durbar Square! Be sure to find the "secret passage" and go up to the top!

This is a small beautiful place. If you are not careful enough to look for this, there is a good chance of missing it because the guidelines are not clear as to what road you should follow to get there. My husband and I almost missed it! Once you go inside, you feel as if you need to stay a little longer than you expected because the place is so calm and welcoming. You are not supposed to wear leather shoes inside the premises. That is not a strange practice because in Sri Lanka you are not supposed to wear any type of footwear into a temple as a mark of respect.  You will hear Tibetan Buddhist chantings when you are in the Golden temple and if you feel the need to buy one, do not hesitate as you will never regret buying the music which has the ability of calming your stressed out nerves!  Almost all the statues and the roof are gold plated. And it is quite shiny and beautiful and adds a heavenly touch the whole experience. This is most definitely a must see in Nepal.

column7: A Rare Jewel of a Temple!
column8: Be sure to visit this superb jewel of a temple in Patan. The temple artwork is simply exquisite. It's different here than most other temples in Nepal. This place has a special quality, a special energy. Maybe that is because of the many centuries of devotion.  The people at the temple were very welcoming to us, and we had a wonderful experience making butter lamp offerings. Please don't miss this rare temple if you visit Patan! This is one of my top 10 places in the world to visit just because of its exquisite quality of artwork, Buddhist space and living culture.  Tourist Advice: You cannot wear leather/leather soled shoes in the temple. Plastic or cloth shoes--like flip flops--seem to be ok. Modest casual dress is a good idea.

The temple -still in use- is probably the most interesting temple in Patan. Do not forget to visit the praying room in the second floor to your right. Out of the temple is the famous artisan that produce the "singing bowls".

column7: Small temple outside of Durbar Square
column8: First we didn't want do go to the "Golden Temple" (another one???), but I was glad that we changed our mind. This is very nice, peaceful and interesting place. It is believed that this temple is there from 12th century. Whilst we visited, there was renovation in progress .  It wasn't that crowded like other places and I found it very pretty. Ticket fee is only 50 NPR (0,45 EUR) and it is allowed to take photos.
I went early in the morning and it was busy with locals, it was very interesting to observe the traditions inside this temple, I found it more interesting than Durbar Square.
I liked the momo when i went there for the first time. But gradually the taste of Momo was not that delicious liked before.

column7: Great mo mos and a varied atmosphere
column8: We enjoy this restaurant. They have their own style of mo mo - they are open on the top. The sauce with them is delicious and unique. We have had egg rolls, chicken cordon blue, fried rice, spring rolls, mutton, fish and chips. Other than the fish we have enjoyed the flavor of everything.  Seating can be outside at tables and chairs. Inside upstairs sitting on cushions at a low table, downstairs at regular tables or a semi open area with couches and tables.  Service is good and each persons dishes come out quite close together.

column7: Italian sandwich and the fries is to die for I never had that experience of a big size sandwich
column8: Its a heaven if you can afford 2 thousand bucks for a single person lunch .The ambience and the silent atmosphere is a boon to have in a noisy bustling Ktown with drinks of your choice available at the bar . Its a restaurant with...More
Fantastic, authentic Spanish cuisine and more! Great service and ambiente. Bibhushan is a fantastic chef and also very happy to give cooking classes and share his knowledge. Would recommend 10/10 (:

the place is awesomely great and lunch was a perfect food for the starving people like me, i love the food and the service. the food was on time and i really appreciate the food and service and the place is awesome already.

column7: Good in terms of quality, not quantiry
column8: After having a city tour, we went for lunch there based on google restaurant suggestion. The restaurant images and name seemed quite interesting so we choose that. We order grilled chicken and some sort of meat pasta (forgot the exact name). As this is the 1st time I tried any Spanish food, I cannot comment about the authenticity. The taste was great, everything was fresh and well balanced. We ordered it for lunch but the amount was not enough. Also the amount seemed quite insufficient compared to the price. We had to go to other place to fulfil our appetite. If you're not so hungry and want to taste some good food, then this restaurant should be your choice, otherwise not.

I have to honestly appreciate the way chef Bibhushan has came out with such a wonderful concept of Spanish tapas in place like Nepal.....amazing tidy place with with nice ambience and service....hats off to the chef Bibhushan.
one of the best dining experience in such a small elegant place with exquisite collection of desserts and tapas, service was simply flawless with trained staffs...highly recommend

Amazing elections, great dish choices, good meat plates. Kindly atended by the owners, cosy place to have long talks and taste good wines options, mediterranean food, and local as well. Totaly recomended!

column7: Delicious food, nice wine, great music
column8: Had such a lovely experience here, the owner is incredibly friendly and the ambiance is really nice. Food was awesome, can not fault any of it. Will definitely be back

We brought 9 Nepalese young adults who had never had tapas, paella or any Spanish food. They were all very impressed. The service was excellent and the food also. We had a variety of tapas and a vegetarian and mixed paella. It was a perfect dining experience.

My visit to Nepal has been awesome after trying spicy local food for few days I started to crave for my mediterranean food and planned a visit to el mediterraneo . I was extremely blown away with the food experience which I had along with amazing collection of desserts. Definitely recommended..
Simply outstanding collection of cuisine with sublime dessert. Staffs were well trained who knew when to sequence the course one after another....without delay
One of the best meals we have out had in Kathmandu. Nice wait staff, good food, real attempt to make this a more "Spanish" experience.

We had the tapas menu here which was incredbile. Really authentic, super tasty Spanish food. The staff and owners are also very friendly and up for a chat. Hands down the best dining experience we had in the whole of Nepal...

column7: The best Spanish food in Kathmandu
column8: Having eaten in many restaurants in Madrid and Barcelona, I can assure that this restaurant makes very authentic spanish food. I went with my family yesterday and had a wonderful experience - the food is made to perfection and the service is fabulous.  I'd highly recommend their set menu for special tapas - which includes spanish delights like gaspacho, tortilla, paella, croquette and many more. They have the best Sangria and the desert is to die for.

As told by my collegues I made a visit to find and experince amazing range of spanish cuisine with cozy and elegant ambience, staffs were very well trained and not to forget the highlight of the visit the collection of best desserts...memorable royal exclusive dining experience I should say....

The atmosphere at El Mediterrano is excellent. My wife and I stopped in for lunch one afternoon, and the staff immediately welcomed us. We ordered tapas, a Spanish dish in which small portions come out one after the other. Each dish was delightful, and we enjoyed the leisurely style that allowed us to linger and enjoy the experience. The staff went above and beyond to make us happy, even bringing a extra dessert to sample and offering suggestions of places to visit. If you are looking for good Spanish food with friendly staff, then I highly recommend El Mediterrano.
Just back after a 12 tapas session. Very good and enought food. We also had a good Rioja with the food. I felt like being in San Sebastian :-) Staff was perfect. Friendly and helpfull

column7: Great place to be. Must visit
column8: Great food and great friendly people. Owner Bibhushan is just awesome person you would like to interact and know interesting facts about food..
The food was unique with creative plating. I tried the dessert(Natillas).The custard was very light and rich in flavour. Great service. Great hospitality. Truly excellente..!

column7: Fresh and tasty food with warm staff and ambience-.
column8: Best dining experience in Nepal thus far. The Tapas were authentic and delicious - each dish offering a fine balance of flavour and texture. It really was a fine dining experience that our whole party enjoyed. The night was topped off with some truly sublime...More

We had a fantastic experience at El Mediterraneo. The food was delicious and fun to get a taste of Spain while in Nepal. The food was delicious, with options to have tapas or larger meals. All the dishes we tried were delicious and made with quality ingredients. The chef was superb - he gave us samples of food he was excited to share, and came and spoke to us several times throughout the meal. He is clearly cooking and managing his restaurant from the heart and is passionate about his work. Truly lovely restaurant and would highly recommend!

Visiting nepal with my friends was itself a wonderful experience and spanish food in a religious country like nepal ia a new experience. The place is lovely and quite with spanish music. The food and service is up to a mark and matches the spanish culture.
During my stay in Nepal I visited many restaurants but I found El mediterraneo very consistent with it's quality. Service staffs are very attentive with very clean and calm atmosphere.
The restaurant is situated in jhumsikhel .You can find variety of tapas. My favorite happens to be stuffed calamari and fish stew because I am a seafood lover. The taste is at it's best level.

Visiting nepal with my friends was itself a wonderful experience and spanish food in a religious country like nepal ia a new experience. The place is lovely and quite with spanish music. The food and service is up to a mark and matches the spanish culture.
During my stay in Nepal I visited many restaurants but I found El mediterraneo very consistent with it's quality. Service staffs are very attentive with very clean and calm atmosphere.
The restaurant is situated in jhumsikhel .You can find variety of tapas. My favorite happens to be stuffed calamari and fish stew because I am a seafood lover. The taste is at it's best level.

Staying at this guesthouse was such an incredible experience. I LOVED the decor, the service, and the location. They do a really incredible job of keeping the space clean, while giving you a good taste of what the traditional Newari style is like. My room had a double bed, an eating area, a private bathroom, and a closet to. hand stuff up. I was nervous about the temperature (I live in Hawaii & the temperature was in the 40's EEK!), but the warm blankets they provided were more than enough. The breakfast they served gave a good variety of foods and had as much tea as you could drink! I sat in one of the window frames looking out on the courtyard. It had. posts on either side that show the beautiful characteristics of the traditional wood carvings. The staff. was

This is an absolutely wonderful, comfortable stay if you are looking for traditional Newari lodging. The people who own and run the house are very welcoming, accommodating and warm. There is also a very nice cafe on the floor level with comfortable seating. The entire house is very open and the courtyard and garden are great because you can keep your windows open without facing the noisy street. The ceilings are quite low though so if you are taller than 5'8" it might be an issue. I'm 6'1'' and got used to it. It makes it feel really cozy. The overall experience of staying here was very relaxing. The breakfast is also top notch!

column7: A vivid reminder of the culture and architecture that is disappearing in Nepal
column8: Drop in for a visit even if you don't stay here, to appreciate what Newari culture has been for the past centuries. The house is impeccably restored (with UNESCO support) and can only make one nostalgic for what has been lost in only a single lifetime. Unbeatable location between Mangal Bazaar and Kumbheswar/Baglamukhi temples, with a great staff, serves a good breakfast, too. Only 8 rooms (all different) so book early. Not particularly inexpensive but worth the price, and be warned, the outside street noise is loud.

column7: Great Place to Experience Living Traditionally
column8: Located right within Patan, Traditional Homes Swotha is an excellent place to stay. As mentioned by others, it is located within walking distance to Patan Durbar Square. The staff was extremely helpful in helping us to arrange for a driver to bring us around Kathmandu, and extending our checkout time until we were ready to leave for the airport in the late evening. The room was spacious and clean, with hot water for shower (very important during winter). It would be nice if the room had a heater as well. Nevertheless, the bed had an electric blanket, which was extremely helpful for us who hail from sunny Singapore.

column7: We truly experienced the awesomeness and hospitality of this awesome place
column8: This must be one of the best places we have stayed in a long time. The food is awesome. The rooms and the view from rooms the best. Shailendra dai and family will ensure you have the best stay. You will experience Kathmandu the way it should be experienced. I would highly recommend this place !!

column7: The perfect place for a home-like, comfortable stay!
column8: I was in Kathmandu for about five weeks, interning at an office 5-minutes away. Mr. Shrestha is an incredible host who made breakfast and laundry arrangements easy, as well as arranging for taxis, walking tours and anything you might need. For example, I was here in December and I changed heaters not once, but twice with ease! The location is stunning - it overlooks a temple on water and is a short walk away from the UNESCO World Heritage Site Patan Durbar Square! Patan/Lalitpur is an ideal place if you want to experience the old city and you can easily get a taxi to Kathmandu and Bhaktapur to visit other heritage landmarks and sites. The guesthouse is also a short walk away from Labim Mall. The guesthouse has great wifi; is a short distance from convenience stores, food

column7: A great long-term or short-term stay in Patan or Kathmandu!
column8: I was in Nepal for a work trip, and I stayed at Tajaa Pha for approximately four months. It was an excellent place to stay! Shilandra and his family were extremely hospitable. As a solo traveler, I felt like part of the family and very comfortable at the Tajaa Pha. My laundry was promptly returned every week, and a great breakfast was always available if I did not feel like cooking that day. The home is centrally located to Patan - close to Patan Durbar Square, many other Newari heritage sites, and only a short taxi ride away from central Kathmandu. This is a must stay location if you are in Patan or want to escape hectic Thamel. The view from the top floor is great; it provides the best view of Patan and the mountains on a clear day.

column7: Magnificent restored family home; managed by descendants. Delicious food, elegantly served. rvice
column8: I can't say enough about this beautiful home. Meals are generous and delicious. The owner share the story of the restoration of this home/hotel. Every detail pleases, from the room appointments to the attentive, very caring staff, to the wonderful meals and friendliness. The atmosphere lends itself to conversations with other travelers or to a solitary stay, whichever one prefers. I felt like a welcomed family member myself.

This Hotel is by far one of the best I have ever been in. It was cozy, comfortable, neat, and very near to major sights such as Darbar Aquare. Staff was very nice and helpful! They were very polite and overall I enjoyed staying in Nepal because of them.

column7: Great Hotel with an excellent service
column8: I had an unforgettable experience of staying at this beautiful place which is located in the heart of a city.I was in Nepal for my business trip but while staying at timila i felt as if i was in my holiday because the surrounding was so peaceful with artistic & historic manifests.Overall i loved the hotel and would recommend to all 🙂

A very beautiful hotel situated near Patan Durbar Square with very silent and friendly environment. All the staffs of the hotel was very kind and provided us with service and breakfast was so good. Even the room was so good with best services. There was small water pond with koi fishes that was quite attractive. In conclusion, my decision to choose Hotel Timila was fruitful and thanks to the entire team of Timila to provide best services.

column7: Excellent property excellent staff and service
column8: This is an outstanding property where the hotel is very close to main attractions. Initially we booked bamboo suit. Room was very spacious and equipped with all the amenities we could think of. I must mention about staff of the hotel. Staff’s are very generous respectful and polite. One of the best services we have seen so far. They were trying to accommodate all our requests and went above and beyond to make our stay comfortable. We were delighted to have the opportunity to choose different locations for our morning breakfast. Fascinating. We were very impressed and delighted with our initial two night stay; therefore we booked another 7 nights. Overall experience was excellent. Kudos to Timila management and staff.

As we say don't judge the book by it's cover, the entrance is not so interesting but then when you get in the place will light you up with it's ambience and homely environment. I was with my friend who was craving for Yommaree and with luck there was the tastiest one called as Sundae Yommaree.  Loved the food and people are very hospitable. I would recommend this place for authentic and healthy place to taste Newari cuisine.

If you would like to experience traditional Newari snacks and meals cooked by women who have mastered their art at home, this is the place. BYOB makes this a good place to visit for after work drinks with colleagues or friends.

column7: This is an interesting little place to have lunch
column8: Run by a NGO I believe (meaning that proceeds go to a good cause) this spot has great authentic Nepali dishes like Bara (an organic pancake of sorts). Great spicy flavors!

column7: The best food experience you would have in KTM.
column8: More than the fact that the food is delicious, eating at a restaurant that combines values as an integral part of their business model made the experience even better. The staff are SO nice and welcoming and the traditional food is the best I've had in KTM. Highly recommended!!  Eliran, ISRAEL

column7: Becoming our favourite place to eat....
column8: My partner and I have eaten here almost every other day since arriving in Lalitpur. We came across it by accident when we were just wandering around on our second day here. The meals are just simply delicious and the staff are just delightful. Very chilled place for just a cold drink, lunch or dinner. I suspect we will be here many times over the coming weeks and months!

column7: Good variety of local dishes, Slow service, Nice atmosphere, Mosquitoes-many
column8: This is nicely tucked away in an alley so relatively quiet and has a nice upper floor patio seating area, very comfortable and nice atmosphere. Felt very relaxed here and the staff are lovely, just very unorganised and very slow. It took about 15 minutes for someone to acknowledge us, but this was ok. The menu is really impressive and looks more like a picture book for a coffee table. I really think it is the nicest menu I have ever seen and it explains the dishes. This is unique and so is the food.  We chose the platters which you can try a variety of the dishes (I do recommend this). Although one of the soups (?) was really terrible but only because it didn't suit our taste buds…it reminded me of sewage unfortunately and was a concoction of several types of beans. Otherwise, the other dishes I thought were impressing and many flavours I have never tried before.  The service didn't get any better and unfortunately I didn't bring mosquito spray and scored many bites, so we had to go inside to ask for the bill which took about 15 minutes more to produce the small piece of paper. Organisation is not there strong point, however if you overlook this, the food & atmosphere are at least worth coming for at least once.

This is the best place I know to savour the best of Newari specialties because it is clean, safe, affordable and very tasty. I'd recommend The Village Cafe to anyone looking for a different kind of lunch experience. And "I'll Be Back!"

It was a great experience. We were there for Lunch, the food was great, great variety and fantastic service. The atmosphere and ambiance was very good and relaxing. Special mention here for Vivek who served us and made our meal a great one.

i was there for dinner with my wife and really love the food. the ambiance is really awesome and the best place to visit in Jhamsikhel. i love the place the food is really awesome and suits the place as per name

column7: Great place for a really nice dinner
column8: I visited this place recently by coincidence and I was very pleased and positively surprised. More than anything I appreciate interior and ambiance of the place, softer lightning and sense for the detail. Food was delicious - my pasta was amazing and my boyfriend's steak was both - super tasty and very well garnished. Wine - lovers should definitely stop by as well. The only thing I noted and did not like was a whatever dressing of servers, which is in my opinion in such a beautiful place pity and proper dressing would uphold the overall ambience even more. Thank you for great experience.

column7: If your looking for the perfect evening..
column8: This is a lovely experience! The atmosphere is so relaxed and warm. The food and wine amazing - altogether a perfect lunch or dinner.... quite exceptional!
The food, place and ambience is great. Just hoping the staff/servers be kinder and more service-oriented. Ate here a number of times already and had similar experience with their serving staff.

I was transported back to Napa Valley one evening when invited to dine here! Refreshing drinks in an al fresco setting which was essentially indoors! We both opted for pork roast! Came with creamy mashed potatoes and medley of spring vegetables! Mmmm delicious!  And yes, California standard washrooms- spacious, clean and bright, dry and modern! Most memorable meal so far!

I was an awesome experience to have delicious and tasty foods at Vesper cafe... sometimes, i visit with my colleagues and friends... environment is excellent... and place is good in terms of location...

Overall a great experience. Quality Italian food for any standard. Reminded me of homestyle Italian cooking. I had the Bruschetta, Zuppa di Pesce and Cannelloni di Spinaci. All dishes were flavorful and the Cannelloni stood out in particular. The wine selection was a welcome sight and I believe they are also a wine retailer as well. They had a number of options for wine by the glass and I tried 2, both of which were good.  The service was good, though could be a tad better. I was 1 of two tables as I came early and I found having to flag down the waiter for things like water, more wine or the bill.  All in all I definitely recommend this place and think it's great value for what you get. Next time I'm in Patan I'll eat here again.

column7: A Retreat At Day's End After Earthquake Relief
column8: Because Vesper Cafe's building was damaged during the April 25 M7.8 massive earthquake, they moved the operation to Vesper House at the corner building. Everything about Vesper Cafe is there- same menu, same friendly and helpful staff. We had been looking forward to eating dinner after a long tiring day of relief work. They were the first restaurant to operate after the earthquake, which is a relief to those giving relief and those doing rescue. Our favorites? Grilled Herb Chicken, Roasted Chicken Salad, their pork dishes, pepperoni pizza, chicken kebab (with complete side dishes), presented well in fine plates. The iced tea is always refreshing. During the first night they opened, we were amazed that they had some staff working (that means their families are ok) although the service took longer than usual which was understandable as they are understaffed. We appreciate Shreejana, their lady staff who was very attentive to our group. Their bosses were also there, chatting with the diners. Dining al fresco was very calming. Fortunately we never experienced aftershocks in the several times we came back.

They have upgraded not only their interiors and restaurant design, including al fresco dining at any time, but also their menu selection. We always go for the Smoked Chicken Jalapeno Pizza whether dine in or take out, our family added to the favorite list: Grilled Herb Chicken, Rissoto Funghi, Chicken Salad (with fresh greens). We feast tasting and sharing each dish and all the texture and flavours just blend in the mouth. We also appreciate the owner, Gagan, who is always welcoming and with arms open wide every time he sees us. The best place to chill on a Friday night, especially. Oh, and one of our favorite areas? The rest room! Fresh flowers everyday, nice smelling, clean, and filled with music. While waiting for the food to be served, my husband and I get to enjoy our "we-time" while our children play in the children's play room. Nice!!!

The atmosphere at Vesper really stands out from other restaurants in Kathmandu. We are a couple from Europe living in Nepal for a year, and coming to Vesper was like going to Europe in 10 minutes. The cuisine I would say is worldwide but with a base of Italian and here and there pieces of mexican, american and south asian which is a good and tasteful combination.  We really enjoyed coming here for dinner and have been back several times for good wines and just enjoying the atmosphere. Both me and my partner said that it really felt like sitting in someone´s backyard having dinner. A must have on the menu is the Swedish truffles for dessert!  Definitely more dinners at Vesper coming up!

column7: Great ambience, Overpriced food, Small portions, Service needs attention
column8: This seems to be one of the nicest restaurants in terms of atmosphere in Lalitpur district. We walked by it several times and finally made the inclination to try it. The staff started out very accommodating and helpful and were always friendly but the service really deteriorated as time went on. The menu is impressive and comprehensive, but I noted the wine list to be very expensive for some of the wines that I knew about, but a decent list all the same. I was very excited to see 'mole poblano', a speciality Mexican dish on the menu. We ordered this and a salad as we were not that hungry. As we waited, the ambience was nice and relaxing. When the food came, it was disappointing to see the size of the salad and the mole, especially given the price. The salad was average and for the price you would have expected something creative at least as a garnish. The mole poblano: firstly look up this dish on Google Images and then go to this restaurant and order it. You will be completely shocked. Not only in terms of presentation but taste and texture as well (if you know mole). It was not remotely similar in any way. It was basically a Nepalese curry with small chunks of poorly cut chicken pieces (with cartilage & some bone fragments). The spices they used were nothing to do with the Mexican equivalent. AFter we received the meal, the waiter no longer came to our table (in which we may have ordered more drinks). He came when we were long finished and asked how it was. I politely told him to share with the chef to take the dish of the menu of for the reasons politely explained above. He made no effort to offer any apology, replacement or take it off the bill. This might also portray then management at Vesper. Ok that is fine. It is just disappointing. I will say the pizza's looked great and asked the table next to us what they thought of them. They said the pizza was good but the minestrone soup they both had was 'very interesting' with a mutual chuckle after overhearing my conversation with the waiter. I still think it is a nice place to visit for a nice evening out with friends but avoid the Mexican menu as they have no clue what they are making, and don't expect high standards of food quality as it does not match the atmosphere. I agree with the review of 21 May below…more realistic with my experience at Vesper.

Not only is it such a diamond in Kathmandu, but the food is just incredible. The wine menu is very extensive and the pairing suggestions with the food were just perfect. The spicy beef dish was my favorite as well as the chicken wrap. I wish they would open one in New York City. They would do fantastic here. The service was very attentive and we were very well taken care off. I recommend this to anybody that goes to Kathmandu and wants an incredible experience for your pallets.

column7: Real Italian touch good food good wine
column8: Arrive in Katmandu our friends suggest to try Vesper Cafe, me and my boyfriend we go for a dinner and immediately i get the real Italian touch in the menu. We start our dinner with a nice white wine and calamari and for the main course we order a good beef steek with a great bottle of Brunello di Montalcino excellent experience !!! I suggest to visit vesper cafe if you want a real Italian touch with a nice service and good hospitality

column7: Great Wine and Food excellent atmosphere
column8: I find vesper cafe for coincidence during my trip in Katmandu and immediately i get a nice hospitality, and warm welcome. We have a dinner with our friends start with a nice glass of Vesper house wines from Italy Orvieto, we sharing a nice pasta e pizza make in the real traditional oven great experience we really surprise for a quality of food and wines and reasonable price. We back again in the last 3 days we stay Katmandu excellent place.
An excellent restaurant with very good food good wine from an interesting menu, not overpriced, in a lovely atmosphere with very pleasant staff and most helpful management.

column7: Best restaurant in Patan/Kathmandu, from far !
column8: Such a cosy place !  We had our 1st wedding anniversary there, it was more than perfect.  You should definately go for a special occasion, or only because you feel like having a nice evening, apart from the busy Kathmandu.  For wine lovers, there is a great cellar ! So good to taste european wines - at the right temperature. We also had the best fresh lime mint we ever had : it almost felt like a mojito without alcohol.  We had nice pizzas, but we didn't try the other meals (except an amazing cheese plate to go along with the wine...).  The service is very attentive to any special need, the place is really clean - definitly deserved the 1st rank.

Every time we come to the Vesper, we are treated like family. We love coming here because of the atmosphere, the food, the drinks and the staff. Every person working is nice, and everything about the Vesper says that they genuinely want to give people a good experience. Also, the road in front of the restaurant has been finished, so it is much nicer to get in and out of than in months past. My wife and I love it here, and have met many good friends!

I visit Vesper Cafe' few times during my trip in Katmandu and always i surprise for the quality of excellent wines selection and food menu. The atmosphere in Vesper is unique creative touch from Gagan & Alex inspired from the Italy and France tradition. I suggest to visit Vesper for taste a glass of wine with good Italian food.

column7: Great food, good wine & a courtyard
column8: We went here with friends on their recommendation & can see why they come back so often.  There's an interesting menu, which between our group with covered pretty well & everyone was really happy with their choice. The presentation of the dishes particularly stood out as it's not very common for restaurants in Nepal to show that kind of attention to detail.  My husband ordered the steak, which he was pleased with. I ordered the fish & chips - the chips were average, but the fish was cooked perfectly. I'd definitely try that again. The brownie is not really a brownie, but sadly when is it in Nepal. The house wine was good - far surpassing what many restaurants serve as their house bottle.  The service was extremely friendly, although slightly slow, but sitting in a nice courtyard with friends, we didn't really notice. We'll definitely be returning here.

Our guide brought us here; we'd already visited Durbar squares in Kathmandu and the excellent Bhaktapur one and he said that there wasn't more to see in this one, but we could look down into it from this restaurant's roof terrace. The views into the square and over the city were very good and our meal was excellent. Our guide ate with us at it was a very pleasant experience.

column7: Most attractive temple in Patan Darbar square
column8: This is the most attractive temple in Patan Darbar square. It is partly damaged due to the earthquake.
It is for those that want to sightsee! It's quite historic and also see the effect after earthquake.... it's quite interesting and beautiful! :) slightly overcrowded but it is still worth it!

Located in the heart of Patan Darbar Square Krishna temple gives unique itoduction. It has great historic value. This temple was built of stone and carving Mahabharat Story in each stone., there are 21 golden gajurs in rhe rptemple.bthis temple shows its unique architecture design and historic importance. I belive it gives everyone specific experience, so i recommend to visit atleast once.

in this mandir the original shape od the indian classical shikara has been modified . in this elegant three floors building the slim pillars give an air of lightness to the gray stone. the decoration is sober and enhances the game of shade and ligh of the porticos . during Krishna Astami,about the end of august ,the temple is surrounded by an immense ,colored crowd of devotees,offering flowers,fruits and religious chanting,a magic experience ,especially by night.

column7: Steep climb for a great view
column8: The Krishna temple is built very similarly to some of the temples in India. There are steep and narrow stairs that lead you to the sanctum. The sanctum itself is not on the ground level which itself is a unique piece of architecture in Hindu temples. Great views of the square await you when you get on the top.
Every body who is in Kathmandu should not to be missed to visit old palce and musium and old type of source of water tape.

A visit to Patan Durbar Square and the great museum inside the old palace is a msut for anyone visiting Kathmandu. Within the square, the Krishna Mandir is unique and special with superb stonework and detail.

This is a very different temple from the usual nepalese pagoda temple made of bricks and wood. It is entirely made of stone and the stone work is just amazing. Again, have some expert in Hindu culture accompany you in your visit and you will enjoy the experience.

I saw very good comment on TripAdvisor and this is the reason why we decided to go to Taza. First the waitress is not very welcoming, no vibe. Just an empty room with TV. Then the menu is interesting but it's not a cheap place at all. The falafel wrap is 300 without price... And the surprise.... It's very very very small. This is ridiculous! So I got this very expensive but tiny hummus and falafel wrap and I order a portion of fries for 200... I got a stupid plate with uncooked ans tasteless fries. You got 2000 times better in Thamel for half price..!

It was such a relieve to find this restaurant in Kathmandu which provides some tasty and halal food. You will get fresh and delicious food here. I liked the shawrma the most. Although the place is small but it has a wonderful interior and its cozy. Plus yeah the owner is a humble and nice person!  Taza! Its fresh! I will recommend people to visit this place.

My husband and I only had the pleasure of eating here once during our stay but it was the one restaurant that I kept talking about our whole trip! The food is amazing, the service was exceptional, and the price was fantastic! I can't say enough good things about Taza and if you like Middle Eastern food, you will not be disappointed. Also, our waiter spoke perfect English which was very much appreciated. Oh how I wish I could have Taza for dinner tonight....

I had a very good chicken shwarma wrap. The owner, who I believe is Syrian originally, was super friendly and warm. The prices were LOOOW, which are nice, too. The decor is very yellow and black, but this experience was all about the food!

column7: Great Middle Eastern food from a Syrian owner!
column8: My wife and I stopped in here for dinner and it was excellent. I ordered way too much but it was all declines and I'd do it all over again. The owner is a super friendly Syrian guy. We ended up talking to him for a while and really enjoyed it Some interesting stories! They don't seem to serve beer but it can be quickly/easily arranged!

column7: Great middle eastern experience in Kathmandu
column8: As a middle eastern guy I found the food very tasty and refreshing. The service was well over top and the all over experience was great. Best Humus in Nepal!
I love zatar and falafel. It's good taste for everyone who want to have different. I highly recommend to visit

I went to Taza on the recommendation of a friend and was happy I did. The Shwarma was the best I've had. Bassel is also very nice and ready to help in any way. For a different taste and good time definitely go here!b

column7: The best Middle Eastern food in Kathmandu
column8: I used to have to go to Or2K in Thamel when I felt like Middle Eastern food (Israeli), but Taza (Syrian) tops it! The vege plates--with hummus, baba ganoush, breads, falafel, etc--is delicious, and a perfect vegetarian choice. The staff/owners are friendly and always remember me when I come back. The location is convenient if you work and live in Patan, although it's on the busy Pulchowk Rd, so it's not the nicest location. But the food and service make up for that!

My local Nepali friends and I went to Taza the other day. It was the second time for me and the first for the other two. We had a medley of dishes - hummus, babaganoush, shwarma, falafal and toshka and we couldn't get enough! For vegetarians and meat-lovers, we found each dish interesting and flavorful. Big thank you to the owners Sangita and Bassel for their great hospitality!
SO great food, first experience with such of food but will go and go more often, affordable price with high quality.

column7: Dont miss to go to this place
column8: If you are tourist and coming to Kathmandu or if you are Nepalese , you should not miss to eat at this place....So great welcome and food is marvelous.....fresh as ¨Taza¨is a reality......Sharwama chicken is the one that I will recommend as the best but other foods are also so attractive and well served.....pls go and enjoy.....
This is totally a unique restaurant which serves middle eastern food. We loved the foods that were served specially the toshka. Simply loving it.

when i enter and it was like where i am and menu was completely new still inner sound was saying why not then I just asked them and I go with them. it was my first experience for Arabic food and it was so good that touch my soul. with reasonable price and friendly environment this place really win my heart.

column7: Awesome and friendly environment to hangout! 👍
column8: Food and prices are much reasonable than other places I found ! Had a great time ! It's my first experience of some Arabic food and it's quite good taste with some Arabic music to enjoy your evening .... People here are friendly too .... One of my favorite place to hangout for some quality time with myself

Tasneem is a wonderful and friendly lady who immediately makes you feel welcome at the restaurant. The menu is plentiful and it often comes with new suggestions to try from Tasneem. The food is absolutely delicious and we have become regular customers over the past...More

column7: A culinary experience in KTM you won't soon forget
column8: Tasneem's has been our family's favorite since moving here 3 years ago. In our experience, most restaurants in Kathmandu serve a bit of everything. Even if there is a regional focus, the menu is expansive and mixed. Tasneem is deliberate with what she cooks in...More

column7: Charming and tasty, with good principals
column8: Tasneem's has a charming environment for a cozy, delicious dinner or a festive birthday party (we sat between two celebrations), and actively demonstrates its positive values around connection, ecology, and culture. A very positive dining experience!

I've been to lot of premium chain of biryani restaurants but TKK's biryani standout well and offers unique flavour. The hospitality is great and the owner leaves no stone unturned for you to have a great experience over here.

I had the pleasure of dining at Tasneem's King Kitchen while on a trip in Nepal. Having lived in New York City for 14 years, I'm quite spoiled when it comes to dining options. I loved my experience at Tasneem's King Kitchen and wish it could be transported to NYC. All the dishes I tried at Tansneem's were delicious! My personal favorites were the mutton platter, butter chicken, and sesame naan.

column7: Authentic Indian food that tastes great, but...
column8: This is the place I'd recommend for anyone looking to try the authentic Indian dishes. The food is great, no doubt about that. But in my experience, the service was really slow. Not a place to be if you're like really hungry...let's say. Had to wait for quite a bit for getting served!

column7: A real gourmet experience at Tasneem's
column8: I live in Bangkok and visited Kathmandu for four days at the end of August. I went to TKK on the recommendation of a friend. I am an Indian but I had to non-Indian friends with me. The experience was amazing, This is no ordinary run of mill Indian Tandoori restaurant. This place showcases Bohra cuisine with recipes passed down through generations. The complexity of flavors and the richness of the dishes showed the TLC put into the cooking. We focused on the kebabs accompanied by Gorkha beer. I have rarely tasted such tender meat. The mutton sigri and chicken cutlet melt in the mouth. The butter chicken is amazing as the gravy is the best that I have tasted. I had the Nihari which was also excellent but the biryani was already finished ( to my deep regret). The restaurant is in an old Nepali house and is spread over three levels. The place was full of groups of friends and family with a really fun vibe. Please go there with a big appetite but I bet you cannot help overeating. The service is amazing and try and get the real cool owners to talk about their food. It makes the food taste even better.

Can’t believe found an amazing Indian restaurant in Kathmandu, the food here are just fantastic. Mutton and chicken biryani are my favorites. Also panner masala, soo good. The foods seem very well prepared with their unique authentic originally from Bhora Muslim, knowned to be originally migrated from Yemen to Gujarat. Ms. Tasneem, the owener, manages this restaurant from the kitchen to ensure all are in high quality. Attached photo of dessert, gajar ka halwa, made from carrot.

column7: What a treat !! Will visit you again soon
column8: Just visited Kathmandu with three accompanying professors from the US. A friend of mine recommended this place for authentic and tasteful cuisine. I am glad that in ten days we visited this place three times. My favorite Chicken Angara, goat Kabsa (takes 16 hours of slow cooking) and the Mutton biryani. All preparations are halal. The best part was Tasneem and Harsh being there and providing personal attention and narrating the history behind preparations. That was priceless. We earned good friends as well. Service is prompt and the staff very courteous. Enjoy the decor on the walls where original bollywood film posters are framed. It was great for a movie buff like me. So the place has a unique ambience. And do pack chocolate bags for your family.

This is my first experience to visit this beautiful place to explore nature adventure and great pleasure in katmandu and we are here for our family dinner we enjoyed here food and atmosphere so delicious food and beautiful people we loved it.
Excellent curries and biryanis -unique flavors - complex flavors beyond traditional Indian food. Servings are small so you may need to order more. Limited vegetarian options.

The food was average! Nothing like how it has been hyped. Went for dinner once for a very disappointing and dry mutton biryani. My overall experience, including the room which our group was put in, was unsatisfactory. Nothing above average. Just another indian food joint serving average food. You can try it out for yourself, but this was my experience twice in a row so now i am done!

column7: A highlight of my time in Kathmandu
column8: For the last 6 years I've been living in Kathmandu, and for the last 6 years I've been eating at Tasneem's Kings Kitchen. It's a place that I constantly to return for comfort, laughs and excellent food.  Tasneem makes you feel at home, feeds you until you're stuffed and sends you off with a smile on your face. And if you're ever at one of her cooking classes, remember to take a notepad!  What more could you ask for from a quality restaurant?

Visited Tasneem’s Kings Kitchen with a friend. Veg Sheekh Kabab was very yummy & fresh. Mutton kabab was equally tasty. Don’t miss the masala tea I am a regular customer of TKk & I appreciate the personalised service extended during every visit. Consistency in food taste & service is their biggest asset

column7: A feast for the eyes and mouth - BECAUSE ITS DELICIOUS !!!
column8: Had gone there with my son (fussy eater) and we both loved the Bohra Thaal - a 12 course meal which traditionally starts from the desserts ( good news to sweet lovers)... A perfect balance of food between sweet and savory and reasonably priced. The huge plate or thaal in nepali, containing 12 delicious variants not only looks tempting but also soul pleasing. This combination not only define the richness of Bohra culture but also the unique way of eating which contains so much of discipline and understanding of your pallet.
The Food is great and the services 👌👌 a must go place in lalitpur. I enjoyed food along with their indian environment. I had A very good indian experience here.

I found this gem of a place looking for halal eats in Kathmandu. I went here the first night i landed and i instantly fell in love with the food and vibe. Aunty Tasneem is one of the warmest kind hearted souls i have come across. I get so homesick when travelling and it seriously felt like having a mum away from home. I have come back every day for a meal or even two ! The food is such comfort food from the simple daals to the delicious biryanis. Except for sunday as its closed,but, yet Aunty Tas still went above and beyond to make me feel at home to organise a personal takeaway order for me on her day off. Her and the team are wonderful. Shes an angel in disguise, i will defs be returning to kathmandu over the years after having the best first experience. Thanks guys !!

I was recommended this place by a friend who had recently eaten here and it didn’t disappoint.  The food tasted amazing, so much flavour and just the right amount of spice - really very good. We had a mixture of meat and veggie dishes; the butter chicken is one of the nicest curries I’ve ever tasted (the chicken is shredded rather than being in “lumps” so the meat is really soft) and the dahl was great too. The mutton dish wasn’t to my taste, but the meat was very soft with a thick rich sauce.  The actual restaurant is very nice too, the beautiful entrance, the terrace and the low tables on the second floor where you sit on chairs resting on the floor. It’s also interesting to read about the culture of the owner and some of the their traditions around food and eating together as a family.  A great evening, will definitely go back if I’m in Kathmandu again!

I would like to say that Tasneem’s King’s Kitchen in Pulchowk, next to the old Patan fire station, does a great job of self-promotion and advertising its unique brand of Bohra food experience. I emphasize the last two words because although this is food with...More

I have visited Tasneem's on several occasions. The food tend to vary . Dinner experience and takeaway by kilo has been good where as lunch has been very disappointing. The food was cold and not fresh! I hope it's improved.

Conveniently located in Jhamiskhel, TKK is a restaurant that will provide food fanatics an interesting dining experience. Furnished with simple decor with seating available indoors and outdoors in an internal courtyard, TKK is a restaurant with no-frills and only authentic finger licking good food.  What makes the entire dining experience at TKK different is how the leading lady Tasneem eloquently explains the whole meal and the significance behind it's origin. Not many restaurants provide you with such a homely service, where you are acknowledged about how the each dish in your meal is prepared.  We pre-ordered the famous Bohra Thaali to celebrate New Year's Eve at TKK. A Bohra meal is a big platter of authentic Bohra Cuisine. The whole meal begins by passing the salt and it is only after each member is seated around and has tasted it that the first course is served. All members from the family dines out of one platter called the thaal. The meal was accommodated for ten people.  Interestingly, the first course is dessert, which was a complete new way of dining for us.The Bohras consider it auspicious to begin their meal with a sweet dish. In the Bohra language, all desserts are called mithaas and the savoury dishes kharaas.  The main course featured lip-smacking Curries for vegetarians and unforgettable Chicken and Mutton dishes for the carnivores teamed with Flavored Rice and Naan Roti. But that’s not all, the meal ended with Gajar Ka Halwa and Paan which is a must for the eaters to cleanse their tongue.  Apart from this, past visits made our family a regular at TKK. The Biryani is legendary here: The meats, herbs and spices are placed in a pot that is then sealed and slow-cooked over a very low flame for hours. The meat cooks in its own juices, taking on the flavors of the seasoning, and resulting in a hearty and aromatic dish that is the specialty of TKK.  All in all, the food is excellent and the servings are very generous. Definitely, worth the value. If you haven't dined at TKK yet then tsk tsk tsk ;)

column7: Excellent Experience with Food, Ambiance and the Best of All the Personalized Service
column8: I am Consultant and a Trainer for Retail Outlet and QSR and Specialize in Customer Service living in Kathmandu. I should say the Dinner I had in Tasneem's on the 26th Dec 2017 was an amazing experience. Every Sunday they are closed for the Public, but this Sunday due to Christmas Eve and the Demand of their Clients they were open. Since they had opened on the Sunday they had declared that Tuesday would be closed. One of our friends not releasing that it was closed called the owner Tasneem to order their Famous Kabssa for the dinner that day. But was little disappointed that it was closed. Has my friend hung up the phone she got a call within 5 mins from Tasneem and confirming the order for the same night though they were closed.  We were altogether 10 of us. We reached the restaurant and were greeted by both Tasneem and Harsh her Husband and to our shock we released that they were the only one in the restaurant with one or two assistance. I was amazed with the Hospitality they had rendered and they had opened the restaurant just for us so that we would not be disappointed. Has we are seated to seats both of them come to us and apologies if there would be any goof up in the service since Tasneem and Harsh both were serving us. The drinks and Soft drinks come and then it was followed by the Famous Kabssa and Seriously my Jaw dropped down seeing this in Actual...OMG......This was is another 5 Star ..... This is a meat lovers paradise ...The whole Experience I should say is an Excellence of Service....My Five Star to you Tasneem & Harsh for a memorable Dinner we had…..Cheers to you Both!!!!  I should say to all the people Travelling to Kathmandu do drop by this Wonderful Restaurant and do meet the Tasneem and Harsh for sure. They would really make your day.

The place is a must visit place, if you want to try Biryani in Kathmandu valley. The food is very carefully prepared and taste is very good (and not spicy). The place might be cozy for a big group but is fine with small ones. I liked their label on the wall, that is well deserved for the place - "no wifi, have a break, enjoy your food and talk to each other". Parking might be a challenge, but you can arrange "take aways".

If you wish to enjoy authentic Mughlai food there is no better place in Kathmandu. The starters like the mutton platters were perfect to get your taste buds going. Of note was the mutton sigdi,soft succulent pieces of barbeque meat. Enjoyed the sinfully rich butter chicken with crispy butter naans followed by the Bohra Chicken Dum Biryani. The service is as good as the food. I was there for lunch but will be back for the attractive, extended happy hours some evening soon.

When in Kathmandu recently, one of the highlights of my visit was the meal at Tasneem’s Kings Kitchen (TKK). It was also a reunion of sorts as when living in Kathmandu ten years ago, we were regulars of Tasneem’s home catering, food perfect for house parties – wholesome deliciousness with homey flavours. Tasneem had since then gone on to open her restaurant and my husband and I were keen to see the place and, of course, to meet Tasneem and her family – it had been exactly ten years since we saw them last. Twelve of us were booked for lunch at TKK and to be honest, we were wondering how the restaurant would manage, expecting a Mom and Pop operation. However, on reaching TKK, we were charmed by the lovely and well run restaurant created by Tasneem and her husband, Harshawardhan.  We were also delighted to find that the food served was as wholesome as we remembered from years ago but the flavours had been upped to pack a restaurant dining experience punch. Right from the aam panna and the jal jeera drinks that we ordered to the starters and the main meal to dessert – every thing was fabulous! As we were 12 of us with different preferences, we made our choices there and then, ordering off the menu, so it can be safely said that everyone else in the restaurant, too, was having the same quality of food that we were served.
