I always order an extra bowl of clear broth because it gets finished first before the noodles. Gulping down that soup always makes me feel better afterwards.  Other family favorites are the fried spring rolls (veg), fried chicken wanton (although they appear to have more flour crust than chicken filling, but the children love the crunch anyway). We've tried their steamed fish, curry. The newly introduced BBQs on weekends -- well, they can be overdone. Maybe more training is needed for the one incharge in the grill. We like that they serve fresh coconut juice that comes with the coconut shell. We just wish the coconuts were younger so you could still eat the cocomeat afterwards. They are the only restaurant I guess that serves caramel flan as dessert. Very Asian!  The restaurant interiors need more lighting but nevertheless cozy. Eating al fresco is an option but other client's smoking can bother you especially when children are around. The owners are very friendly and checks on diners occasionally.  We love their mint lemonade, iced tea and of course the vietnamese coffee!

I had heard great reviews of this restaurant. In fact i had been to the old one in Lazimpat and had liked it. I was told its the branch of the same restaurant so i ordered food.  We didn't like it at all. The noodles dish was bland with no flavor or taste. There was very few ingredients on the food and just looked white washed pile of noodles.  The barbecued pork was very dry and tough that i felt like trying to chew and tear leather. Don't know i'll order from there or go there ever.

My friend Niroj, who also is part of the staff, recommended me this place. I was very surprised when I first came into the restaurant. It is hidden in the heart of Patan, a very busy neighbourhood of Kathmandu. Inside you'll find a very peaceful and calm atmosphere. I had lunch outside, in the beautiful and well maintained garden, which was very quiet and relaxing. I ordered Italian spaghetti with chicken ragù and a plate of chicken momo. The spaghetti were simply amazing, well cooked and full of flavours, I was really impressed! Even momos were super deliscious, with a elegant presentation and an awesome pickle as side. Of course it is bit pricey for the Nepalese standard, but I was happy to pay for the good time that I had in that garden, for the high quality of the food and for the cleanliness of the ambience.  Highly reccomended to everyone who wants a relaxing break in the chaotic Kathmandu.

column7: A fabulous way to decompress after visiting Patan Durbar Sq.
column8: First, I know this as Yala Mandala restaurant - and that is what the business card says but it is reviewed here as Yala Cafe. As I live in Kathmandu as an expat, I can say the food and service are consistently very good and it is good value for money. The dish I order most often is the Thali - they call it something different on the menu but ask the waiter or look for the description of various small dishes (cured vegetables, pickle, paneer cheese and rice) served on a platter - vegetarian or meat options available. It is delicious and presentation is super. If you are interested in trying something totally unique drink wise, ask them to demonstrate the pouring of the local Aeyla. The better quality ones Yala serves are actually very smooth to drink - the cheap stuff in other local bars tastes as if it could clean limescale off water pipes. The biggest problem is to find the place. There are no street names and local people don't know it or send you to a different place so here is my recommendation for a wonderful afternoon in Patan which culminates at Yala for dinner! First, visit Patan Durbar Square, a world heritage site of ancient temples and King's palaces. Do stroll around the nearby market - spices, metal items and flowers for temple offerings. After that, use GPS or your tour guide/ local person to get you to the Golden Temple. This is a fantastic temple to visit - one I take all visitors to - it doesn't disappoint. A guide is useful as there is so much crammed into the small courtyard and you could miss and/or misunderstand much of the symbolism. Afterwards, as you exit Golden Temple turn right, stay on this street - and it's a 2 minute walk to Yala. It will be on your left side and there is a freestanding temple structure almost outside it. The sign is easy to miss -- keep a keen eye for the word Yala! Spend your evening enjoying the great food, outdoor candelit dining available, and friendly service. The staff will point you in the direction of the best place to get a taxi. It's easy to get a taxi "from" here but not "to" here.

column7: Great food, lovely garden, and an adjacent art gallery
column8: This place is really great: interesting menu (do try momos, sort of ravioli, or even closer to Russian pelmeni and similar food in Kyrgyzstan, with incredibly sauce. If the weather is good, garden is great. Also excellent srevice. Worth noting you can take cooking classes!

column7: Great food. Got a set named
column8: Great food. Got a set named “food experience across Nepal” and home brewed ginger beer. Food was really good and more than enough for 3 of us for dinner. Really enjoyed the Ginger beer. The set consisted of few exquisite foods you won’t find in...More
This lovely, restful little restaurant has a unique menu with delicious authentic Nepali food. The staff are also extremely friendly.

Truly a hidden gem. This is a unique restaurant that has a seasonally changing menu with ingredients sourced from all over Nepal. Each dish originates from a specific region and ethnic group. A highlight of my time here.
small and charming place with just a few tables and an open kitchen..very interesting menu of drinks and food..starters and main courses from different regions of nepal..well worth a visit

We visited on our last night in Kathmandu. What an amazing experience. 5 of us shared a selection of dishes. Every dish was delicious with fantastic flavours. The decor was simple and modern and the service from Prakash was outstanding. I am so glad we...More

column7: Great interesting food close to Durbar Square
column8: Just went to this understated and sophisticated place for lunch. Great range of interesting Nepal dishes - we had a potato pancake with a green yoghurt type sauce, taruwa (fried vegetables with yummy fresh spicy sauce) - as well as some French crepes (we had...More

column7: Ethnic Nepali cuisine done with style
column8: Raithaane has one of the more interesting menus you're likely to see in Kathmandu. Region/community specific dishes made with seasonal ingredients, alongside french crepes and good quality Nepalese coffee (house roasted) are all presented beautifully on unique ceramic plates and bowls. The courtyard is quiet, but not far from Patan Durbar Square, and the tables upstairs are a nice place to work your way through the very reasonably priced menu. Raithaane won't stay hidden for long.

We were on a good trail in Kathmandu and this was our last stop for the day. It is very close to Patan Durbar square. Also, look for it carefully as the entry is tiny. But once u get there is a lil alcove of joy. We had the pleasure of meeting one of the owners and he was such a fine gentleman. He explained the dishes on the menu, significance and also, the rare ingredients that they are trying to bring to the forefront.  We first had the sea buckthorn juice. Very mildly sweet and yumm and oh so refreshing.  Next was Kachemba.... buckwheat fries and so yummy and crispy. I polished off the plate while chatting and I had claimed as soon as I got in that I was stuffed.  Husband loved the Sargemba. Blood pork sausages, and he seemed like a very very happy man.  Being a pastry chef.... I just had to try the dessert. We had the Raithaane pie.... it’s a yougurt based cheesecake (made using the famous Bhaktapur yogurt) and the crust was with Tsampa flour. I had arrived in paradise.  Then, we got to sample the cookies- thekuwa and tsampa cookies.  We exchanged recipes, ideas and more importantly had some of the best food we did in Nepal so far. Thank you.

column7: There is much more to Nepali cuisine than daal bhat and momos- come here to experience it!
column8: Fresh, clean, delicious and VERY reasonably priced food located in a newly renovated but cozy ancient setting of old Patan. I have tried more than half of the menu, and found everything tasty and nourishing. The partners running the place are chatty and welcoming, which...More
Ive never tasted most things that Raithaane offers, in any other place.. Love the food and the location. This place is a must-visit in Patan !

I enjoyed the food and the ambience in the courtyard garden even though it was very quiet. My latte and chicken burger were excellent as was the service. I enjoyed looking at the flowers: roses, fuschias etc, the statues and watching the prayer flags flutter...More

Cafe Cheeno offers pleasant setting with a beautiful garden and a lovely courtyard. The place is very clean, and beautifully and thoughtfully decorated. The chef is very talented and the staff is genuinely friendly. The menu is well-balanced for every taste. Breakfast in the terrace feeds one's love for Nepal. On the other hand, the grilled chicken, the tofu burger, the momos and the apple crumble definitely worth a visit! I can't image a more enjoyable experience in Patan!

It's a great place to get away to with a lovely garden where they grow their own lettuce bordering the flowering plants. Out door tables under garden umbrellas, a cup of freshly brewed coffee, wi-fi. garden-fresh salads, and a whole assortment of pastas, sandwiches and so on. Very reasonable prices and good portion sizes. The Penne Arabiatta could do with less pepper, though. The chicken Caesar salad has very interesting grilled chicken strips. The fish fingers plate is a meal in itself. No, I did not eat all of this myself! Went on two different occasions with friends. There's a wellness centre as well as a counter selling handicrafts made by local women's groups. The staff are attentive and friendly. Highly recommended as an oasis of peace in a congested city. Peace + good food. What more can a person want from a cafe?

column7: Peaceful and clean place with beautiful garden
column8: Located close to Patan Dhoka, Cafe Cheeno is one of the few good restaurant options when staying in the old town of Patan. They have a large garden and a few tables inside, in a warm and pleasant athmosphere. The inside of the restaurant is shop at the same time, where books aswell as good quality handicrafts are sold - most of them related to a women's project. The food is good - European style. In the evenings, there is usually only very few people around which makes it an peaceful option. During the day tourist groups come which makes the place less interesting.

column7: Delicious place that includes vegan options
column8: My only regret was to have found this place on my last days in Kathmandu. A great atmosphere, music, with many cozy spots within. The menu is terrific and includes many vegan and vegetarian options. Their traditional masala tea was delicious! I enjoyed a generous...More

column7: Relaxing place not to be missed!
column8: Very warm and pleasant atmosphere. The menu really portrays the cultural journey that the owners (Anne and Jerome) have been on and the marriage of that experience and Nepal gave birth to Of Silk and Salt - a real gem hidden in the heart of Patan. If you want to sample a taste of their world, and at the same time enjoying the excellent service of the staff this place is a must go. Highly recommended for the curious traveller!
Delicious and original fusion food. Very large selection of cocktails and international wines. Nice experience!

Anne, her husband and her staff were amazing. They were so friendly and very loving people. We loved being there. We were vegetarians and whatever we ordered was amazing. Looking forward to keep visiting the people soon. There Pani puri platter is a must have.

column7: ❤️ Best restaurant I visited in Kathmandu
column8: Just perfect 👌🏼 Great food ❤️ the place is so clean you could eat of the floor! The staff is just lovely, they are so friendly!! The restaurant also has a shop where you can find the most unique treasures. The owners are very interesting...More

column7: Amazing fusion cuisine in a cozy setting
column8: The French/Swiss owners make you feel as if you were at diner with friends and loved ones. Their years of working with the International Red Cross allowed them to travel all over the world and pick out the best culinary secrets of the countries that inspired them. The menu takes you on on journey on the famous silk road with a twist of inovation. Your taste buds will be solicited in a way that will make you want to discover more for sure....And they have a good European wine selection. You will love it! - Canadian globe trotter

column7: Nice fresh food in a clean, stylish setting with a great shop next door
column8: I had heard a lot about this place (mixed reviews) so finally tried for lunch recently. The beetroot falafel was quite tasty, as were the chicken skewers. The service was quick and the place is very thoughtfully decorated. The shop next door sells very unique clothing made from fabrics from along the silk road. Not the cheapest, but if you are not on a tight budget, definitely stop by for a meal and a browse.

column7: Superb, fusion flavours with a clever theme
column8: I love trying new food and wasn't disappointed to discover this restaurant. The difficult part was deciding what to try, so a few meals there resolved that issue! The Burmese Fermented Tea Leaf Salad was a new flavour experience for much enjoyed. I make and...More

column7: A good find: Stylish cozy place with interesting food
column8: I went for dinner and was impressed. Tried 3 vegetarian dishes and all were tasty; I'm looking forward to trying some of the other items on my next visit. The food was creative, unique and delicious. Drinks (cocktails) were also good. I love the "silk road reimagined" concept.

Good ambience and quality food but, the quantity was quite less. The menu full of errors. The breakfast not served as promised in the menu (i.e. toast was missing, substituted with different not toasted bread)  I liked the wait staff's service, however, one of the other staff started sweeping as soon as we reached there (little after the opening hour).  Haven't tried the lunch so can't make a comment on that, For breakfast, I would not recommend it.
this cafe as unique atmosphere and decoration. Its menu is a mix of asian and European recipe! delicious!

Delicious café/restaurant near Durbar Square in Patan. Owners are from France and Switzerland but have lived all over the world and created a very unique café. I had breakfast everyday and dinner a couple times. I loved the vegetarian mezze. I highly recommended!

I was recently in Nepal for 3 weeks for work. I was fortunate to discover Silk & Salt early in my stay, and quickly became a regular during my time in Kathmandu. I worked my way through the majority of the menu, and did not have a bad dish. Silk & Salt has an innovative and tasty menu, a nice selection of cocktails, a very nice space with an outdoor garden, and above all a fantastic and welcoming staff. The only place nearby that can compete is Yala, which I did visit occasionally for their pasta. I preferred Silk & Salt.  Food: Small but interesting menu made up of dishes inspired by destinations along the classic silk road, all with a Nepali twist and adapted to the available ingredients. Many dishes are inspired from Thai, Pakistani, Myanmar cuisines. My personal favorites were the tea leaf salad, the chapli kebab burger, and the cashew chicken. The breakfasts were also fantastic and were a welcome start to the day.  Space: The indoor area is a nice cross between a trendy coffee bar and french bistro, with plenty of good spaces to sit and read a book. They always had a good soundtrack playing as well. There is also a large outdoor space with a nice Nepali garden area. Overall the space was very chill, relaxing, and was a welcome break from the daily chaos of Kathmandu.  Staff: Saving the best for last, the staff at Silk & Salt were all fantastic. The owners recently settled in Kathmandu and opened the restaurant, and are intimately involved in the daily business. They have a extremely and inspiring story that ultimately led them to Kathmandu, but I'll let them share that with you themselves. The rest of the staff are young, extremely kind, and eager. I was always greeted with a sincere smile when I walked in. They were attentive and were fantastic at their jobs.  At the end of the day, if you're near Patan this is definitely a place you should check out. I highly doubt you'll be disappointed.

column7: Good and peaceful location, good service
column8: The hotel is beautiful and decorated with amazing Tibetan style bronze statues. Situated at the end of a small lane, no traffic noise with the exception of the airplanes taking off from the nearby Kathmandu airport. We visited in the beginning of September, when it was still low season - it was very quiet. I enjoyed the pool with the children of my Nepalese friend. We had super friendly service at breakfast by the bar tender Prakash Rokka.

I liked the apartment from the first moment. It’s a lovely, cozy place , you will find everything to make yourself comfortable. Special thanks to Rabi who was always ready to fulfill my wishes and to the landlord couple, very friendly and helpful persons! Whenever I return to Patan, I will definitly stay at that place

column7: A Taste of Luxury Before and After your Trek / Expedition
column8: The Summit Hotel provides a luxurious experience whilst you are visiting Kathmandu / Nepal. You are greeted by attentive concierge staff and so the experience continues throughout your stay. The rooms have an old world charm whilst having modern amenities eg WiFi. The breakfast is buffet style with plenty of choice. There is an evening menu and on occasion, a tasty BBQ. There are a number of bars and restaurants in close proximity if you fancy a change. Taxis are easily and relatively cheaply procured to the airport / cultural attractions. NB The traffic in Kathmandu can be very heavy at times. Luggage and valuables can be stored by the hotel whilst out on trek.

Having been disappointed by the mess and squalor that greeted one while driving from Kathmandu it was a delight to enter the grounds of the Summit Hotel. In contrast to the rest of the city the hotel is charming with beautifully landscaped gardens. The accommodation is in two-storey blocks of buildings with earth coloured walls, carved wooden bannisters and reddish roofs. The restaurant has attractive seating areas outside where one can admire the view of the hills while enjoying one’s food or drink while lounging under shady trees. The food is excellent with buffets for lunch and dinner offering local and western dishes, one can also order from a menu which has reassuring basics for westerners such as sandwiches and grilled meats, fish, mash and vegetables. The hotel is popular

The hotel was perfectly comfortable: bed, warm shower and airco. The staff of the hotel was so very kind and especially the owner of the hotel gave us an incredibly interesting complementary tour around the old city of Patan! I definately recommand!

Love every moment.Excellence accommodation right in the center of old part I made the right choice to stay here. Staff super friendly the owner gave me a private tour to the old town I learn a lot. He is very very knowledgeable.

Stayed here end of 2019 for a few days at the end of the holiday. Sarita was very warm and welcoming, and a wonderful hostess. When during dinner she starts telling stories, you are guaranteed to stay longer then you had planned, and before you know it your whole itinerary for the next few days is filled with interesting new locations to explore. She is also a wonderful cook, and likes to bring all kind of people together. A few notes about the location: + Very well reachable by (public) transport and taxi, as it is next to the ringroad. + Easy walk down the street to the historic centre + Close to all necessary shops and services. - The rooms at the front of the house are noisy, day and night, due to the ringroad.

Stay here!!! Sarita is the most wonderful hostess, and makes you feel so incredibly welcome. As soon as we arrived we were welcomed into the kitchen and sat with other guests helping to make momos. Very comfortable beds, clean rooms, and hot water in the shower.

We came to Kathmandu for a tennis tournament and spent 7 nights at Sanu’s House. We simply felt like home. Sarita our host is a stream of kindness. She cooks great, too! You’ll enjoy the many cups of Chiya and the daily made fresh bread, together with a delicious honey. You’ll also enjoy vegetables from their garden, seasoned perfectly. We made momos together, one of the highlights of the stay 😋 It is a very good value for money. The rooms are basic but very clean. The ring road is noisy, so avoid if you have sensible ears. But we didn’t mind it at all - we slept well 😴 You have a very basic momo stall at the corner where you can enjoy world class momos, 10 pcs for 80 $cents. She will come with you to catch the right tuktuk or bus, she’s so nice! It’s a 10 minutes walk to

column7: your hair is in good hands!!!
column8: I went for the hair cut n color...And i have short curly hair.....The lady took care of my curls really well....the best thing i liked about this place was instead of trying to sell me the products, she just suggested me to forget all the products and go for The coconut oil.. her tips for the hair were too genuine as if she actually cared for my hair instead of those irritatnig people i had met who just would tell me my hair is really bad need to straighten it or use this conditioner or this Hair mousse...i think i would like to visit this place again in future...

column7: Its not about the model you have, but how fresh you feel after a hair cut
column8: After a bad experience some place else in thamel letting cut my hair, i found this salon. Took a cab and dove into the new creation experience. And really it was. The ladies are very sweet and gifted. My hair was washed and treated with beautiful products. I recommend this place to everyone who want to relax, feel pretty (and support a company with a beautiful mission!). I really feel new and fresh. Thank you!

I went with a friend to get a haircut. Even though we came a bit late the hairdresser was super friendly and talkative. The woman who washed my hair was also incredible and even gave a short face massage, which was greatly appreciated. Both our haircuts ended up looking great and the prices were very reasonable. All in all, a good experience.

column7: Lovely atmosphere and super nice stuff!
column8: As a women-travel company we really appreciate places like that. New Creation Salon is providing professional beauty service for ladies and the atmosphere is lovely. Property is nicely located and ladies who work there are very kind, they speak nepali, hindi and english. Empowered women empower other women and we were very happy to visit this lovely place.

I’ve gotten pedicures here twice now, and both times it has been the most relaxing and wonderful experience. The staff are incredibly friendly and kind. They really take time to do an excellent job. Also the environment is so peaceful. I always feel so well rested as I leave.

I went to this salon and asked for Tanuja based on the Trip advisor reviews. My hair was long down to the middle of my back and I wanted a change so got it cut to chin level (and I have curly hair). I felt at ease doing it there and loved my new look. Highly recommend it!

Tanuja really knows what she's doing (esp with blonde hair)! My boyfriend said he likes my hair color better than both of my previous haircuts - she achieved an ash blonde that is not yellow. The color is from Germany/the US so the extra price is worth it.  great haircut experience in Kathmandu!

column7: The place where change your life!!
column8: I have been Moksha in June 2019. I had 3weeks of Panchakarma treatment. It was my first time treatment of Ayurveda. In conclusion, it was a great experience! It changed my life!  Specifically… Menstrual problems were disappear.(PMS, Prolonged etc.) Pain in low back, headache are gone. I got into the habit of observing myself and gained mental calm that I want most!(I'm Pitta-Vata) I continue to do yoga what I learned here. Even after returning to Japan, I continue to experience the fact that mental and physical purification occurs in relation to each other.  The staff here are all kindness. They welcome with a smile anytime. Technique of treatment, meal, cleanliness etc. great facility in all. I recommended all of the people who is seeking a better life! I will definitely come back here again♡  私はここで、3週間のパンチャカルマ治療を受けました。それは、私にとって初めてのアーユルヴェーダの治療でした。 結論から申し上げますと、それは素晴らしい経験でした。人生が変わりました。 具体的には、生理に関する悩み（PMS、だらだらと続く等）は解消しました。 腰の痛み、頭痛がなくなりました。自分自身を観察する習慣が身に付き、精神的な穏やかさが手に入りました。それは、私が最も求めているものです。（私はpitta‐vataです） ここで教わったヨガを帰国してからも続けています。心身の浄化は、相互に関連して起こることを体験し続けています。  Mokshaのスタッフは、みなとても親切です。いつも笑顔で迎えてくれます。 施術の技術、食事、衛生管理など、全てにおいてすばらしい施設です。 よりよい人生を求める全ての人に、Mokshaをおすすめします。 私は、必ずまたここを訪れます！！

from my first treatment day i had realized that i were returned to my dear ones good family; absolutely friendly atmosphere. perfect Ayurveda maintenance with complete information on handling procedures. excellent yoga classes with magic mentor Sanjay. Holly Doc Padma. massage therapists Sabina, Sadina.... Administrators Nirajan and Kriss.. I love you all guys ! and will remember my first (hope not last) experience at Moksha forever!

Rarely have I been in the presence of such genuine love, care, and concern. It went into everything they did here, even the minor details. It was a truly wonderful rejuvenating experience doing a 10 day panchakarma; in many ways it was a rebirth. I plan to visit again.
I had v nice experience Friendly sraff Nice veg meals variety Nice rooms n clean I lost 4 kgs in 5 days with blissful pack Recommended

The Moksha Ayurveda Massages are outstanding and first class delivered by highly professional massage personnel. I felt like new-born after my first treatment in Jan 2020. Staff is extremely friendly and supportive and treatments are at very good price - you get great value for your rupees. Highly recommended!!

I have a long-standing interest in Ayurvedic studies and treatment; I deeply appreciate the “regular influence over dramatic crisis-driven intervention” perspective. An important part of the wellness system is periodic panchakarma, an intense 28-day journey to restore your whole person to your original self (physical, energetic, spiritual, mental, emotional). I have previously completed full panchakarma in northern India (28-days) and small periods in Kerala (5 to 14 days); so, I have some perspective for comparison.  Moksha Ayurveda and Panchakarma Center is an amazing place! The treatments are authentic to the historic model and the facilities are a great holding space to do the work you come to do. The staff, however, is what makes this Center a profoundly healing womb. To a person, they are knowledgeable, compassionate, and deeply caring. They are clearly family to each other and support you in your journey of restoration.  For a single treatment, a short-term stay, or full panchakarma, Moksha Ayurveda has my highest recommendation. I am so very grateful for their nurture and support.

column7: I would give more stars if I could!
column8: Let me start at the end. If you’ve never had an Ayurvedic oil bath, you have not fully lived! This exceptional treatment, which is their end-of-panchakarma ritual, is unlike anything I have ever experienced, and I am still walking on air, enjoying a lightness of body, mind and spirit that was my intention and desire when I initially booked the program.  I simply cannot say enough good things about Moksha. A few years ago I’d had a panchakarma elsewhere, but it was not a residential program and this time around I wanted a place to stay where I could fully immerse myself in the experience… and Moksha exceeded all expectations. The first and final word to describe my experience here is “nurturing”. Because Moksha is a small, intimate place (currently only 2 rooms for residential programs although they have plans to expand just slightly to 4 rooms, and many people just come in for day treatments) you are nurtured on every possible level… body, mind, emotion and spirit… and this is the true purpose of a panchakarma, to connect with, purify and heal every aspect of your being.  In retrospect, I really wish I had made more time to do a longer course of treatment, as 7 days really just begins to graze the surface. Regardless, Dr. Padma did a beautiful job of discerning through our consultation what my primary goals and concerns were and addressing them during my week.  The treatments themselves were incredible. They have a staff of practitioners whose caring hearts and hands make sure you are being maximally nurtured during each massage (so many different types!) scrub, cleansing process, chakra healing etc. Even the necessary but more unpleasant treatments were done with ultimate care and there was nothing that felt routine about any of it. Each moment felt as if it was being done and given to me for my specific needs and particular specifications. I felt deeply cared for.  And then there was Sanjay. Each morning I had two hours of personalized yoga and pranayama as well as some beautiful discussion time about philosophy (yoga and life) and as a yoga instructor back home, this was particularly impactful for me. He is an incredible teacher with a wealth of knowledge, but perhaps more importantly, his energy is as warm and pure as it gets. My time with him in conjunction with the cleansing and purifying treatments themselves was exactly what I needed at that moment in time, as I had just come to the center after a particularly impactful spiritual journey and needed the appropriate space and support to help me integrate the experience.  The food… what can I say. It is authentic Ayurvedic food cooked with love, specifically for your needs to nurture you from the inside out. Delicious.  The center itself (treatment rooms, residence, reception, dining area etc) is impeccably clean and the rest of the support staff was also exceptional, helping in any way possible to make my stay more pleasant. On the morning of my departure Sanjay made sure I had food before my early morning flight and some extra apples for me to take on my journey… so sweet. The whole experience was incredibly personal and touching and I can’t remember ever being so attentively cared for in this way.  Leaving the center and in the days following, I feel so incredibly good. The Ayurvedic system of treating and caring for the entire human system… mind, body and spirit… is highly effective if done right. If you are thinking about doing a panchakarma or getting any sort of Ayurvedic care, it is well worth your while to come to Kathmandu and spend your time and money at Moksha, and after being there, I wouldn’t dream of getting Ayurvedic therapy anywhere else. There is absolutely no question that I will be back, and I look forward to it. Thank you Moksha team… you are all a real blessing.

I stumbled upon Moksha Aryuveda & Panchakarma Center when I was living in Patan, and it was one of the best things that happened to me while there. Everyone who works there is kind, thoughtful and attentive. The doctor is very knowledgeable, and designs the wellness programs to serve each individual's unique needs. The massages are fantastic -- I highly recommend one with singing bowl therapy. I did a seven-day panchakarma program, and found it to be healing and eye-opening -- physically, mentally and emotionally. I've done aryuvedic treatments in the U.S. before, and found these to be so much more helpful. No matter how much or how little time you spend here, you're guaranteed to leave feeling renewed -- and like you've found a new family :)

We had yoga lessons and a whole body massage here (which was perfect after the trekking tour in the mountains!) and it was simply perfect! The team is great! Doing yoga with director Sanjy was a deep and unforgettable experience! Thank you all!

Moksha Ayurveda Centre is run with such tremendous amounts of love and dedication to helping and healing people. I stumbled upon the centre by chance, but it turned out to be such an important experience to me. In fact I postponed my return flight so that I could schedule one more healing session, and I am already thinking of when I can go back. I can highly recommend Moksha to anyone looking for inner peace, balance and wisdom. Thank you to all wonderful Doctors and staff at Moksha. I wish all of you strong health and happiness.

The 10 days panchakarma programme still resonate with me now. The healing energy from this Center was gone far than I expected. I had quitted smoking and becoming a vegetarian now. Thank you for my Ayurveda doctor, my yoga teacher, my massage therapist and my vegan meal chef. I felt love from everyone of you. And most remarkable I had learned from all of you, is about the respect of life, the nature and the mystery of the universe. Love and light! Metta
The personnel is extremely professional and kind. T'he location is quiet and clean. Food is excellent.

column7: Best place in Nepal for Ayurveda!
column8: I just completed a 10 day Panchakarma at Moksha Ayurveda & they completely exceeded my expectations. I came in to treat my chronic back pain and nasal congestion, and I came out 10 days later with both of these illnesses cured as well as feeling completely relaxed and ready to conquer the world. Each day, they checked in with me about my progress and did everything they could to make me feel happy and relaxed. They treat you like family at Moksha. Dr Padma is a very kind, knowledgeable doctor and she answered all of my questions with ease and non judgment. The yoga and pranayama exercises in the morning with Sanjay worked very well with my treatments. The massage therapists gave the absolute BEST massages I've ever had. The food was extremely delicious, healthy, and made specifically for my dosha. The treatments I received were all hygienically prepared, using only fresh herbs. Dr Padma did an excellent job explaining all the procedures, describing my dosha, and giving me advice for the future. I highly recommend Moksha Ayurveda for anyone considering Panchakarma. Even if you come in for just a massage, you will not be disappointed. They offer many different packages to suit your needs. I will definitely be back once more before I leave Nepal.

Our accomodation recommended this place for a massage and we were able to book last minute for two 90 massages. They greeted us with herbal tea and spoke to us about any problems we may have that they need to work on in the massage. They were very friendly, thorough and professional with some beautiful spiritual advice. Overall it was a great experience, lovely people and the massage left us feeling very relaxed. I would definitely come back here again and highly recommend to anyone!
Really knowledgeable therapists committed to find the best way to help you feel better. Fully recommended

After visiting so many places more than a month and half for the treatment of my back pain. I got to know this amazing place where they make my back feel better. Wonderful service, highly recommended it’s truly “journey to blissful health “

I may have started as a sceptic UK medical doctor initially but I was won over by the pleasant, welcoming and intelligent staff at Moksha Ayurveda. Dr Padme consulted with me and was astute in her assessment, suggesting an appropriate treatment program. They were flexible in accommodating my busy day work schedule. I even had to cancel at short notice and rearrange which was done effortlessly, with no fuss by reception manager. I was very impressed with the level of anatomical knowledge and mental/ emotional understanding by the exceptional Yoga instructor Sanjay. He is has phenomenal insight into a clients personality. They are generous with their time and good advice which is all important towards healing experience. Therapy lead massage Ram is strong and sensitive to the areas that need more attention - in my case head, neck and shoulders benefitted from Mr Ram. Overall fantastic experience and would recommend to everyone. Dr V Naidoo MBBCH , currrent full UK GMC registered GP

In September I've been there for two Werks Panchakarma. It was just wonderful and I can warmly recommend this Moksha Ayurveda Center. I knew the team already before from a short trip to Nepal. 3/4 years ago the massages were already great, but now they improved again and it is just wonderful. Never experienced such good massages and I'm therapist too. The different therapies are given in a gentle way with enough rest and time for yourself. Body can relax and mind and soul get calm. The whole Team is really friendly and all take care on you. You are Welcome! Thank you very much!

How can a small center be a worldclass experience? When all the staff are higly trained and passionate about ayurveda. Over a long period of time, I have done 14 times of panchakarma in 5 different countries in Europe and the far East, and this center is just the best place to go if you are serious about your health. Dr. Padma creates a personal panchakarma-program to your individual needs, make quick changes if nessesary. The therapist are higly trained, supervised by Ram and make sure you are always very comfortable. High quality in massagetables, oils etc At the reception Nirajan welcomes everybody and helps in all matters. Sanjay teach yoga, pranyama, meditation and chakratreatment with such a special insight and healing power I have never tried before. It is a true gem. Do not miss the opportunity to visit this amazing place

Moksha Ayurveda and panchakarma centre is truly a Authentic ayurveda centre,which is very clean and peaceful place. I was there for my treatment for 15 days and it was a unique experience of my life. The doctor attending me was Padma mam. She is very open to discussion on all issues and explained therapies well on predictable course. She even taught me yoga and pranayam and am used to it these days. She is available there from morning to evening ,she really took care of me and of course she does to everyone else who is there for treatment. The atmosphere at moksha ayurveda is very homely. The medicines are bitter in taste but worth it for cure. I had stomach related problems. The staff -medical and non medical are very good ,friendly and sincere towards every clients. I have almost cured myself there at the moksha Ayurveda centre. I will definitely recommend to my friends and families. God bless !! 👍😍

I spent 14 days in Moksha for Panchakarma treatment and I can say just that - I wished to stay longer. Everyone was loving and caring, it felt like home. I enjoyed the little and comfortable room and the rooftop, food was great and healthy, just the way I like it. I found new friends and I will always visit anytime I'm back in Kathmandu. You are doing an amazing work, guys!:)

column7: Lovely visit and human changing experience!
column8: I visited in Moksha Ayurveda and Panchakarma Center last November. First I met the doctor and it was very good meeting. I got lifestyle advices plus yoga and pranayama teaching. In December I spent 10 days there with classical panchakarma treatments. It was once in a lifetime experience and I felt so much better after the panchakarma program. People in the center were lovely and they treated me very well. I got pure and healthy Ayurveda meals plus clean and homey private room (with a comfortable bed) next to the rooftop. All the treatments were very relaxing. I also got yoga and pranayama teaching during the panchakarma program. Now, 4 months later, I'm still continuing the practices because they help me to feel energetic and peaceful.  It was a gift from me to myself that I walked into Moksha Ayurveda and Panchakarma Center. I learned a lot about my body, mind and soul and I had an opportunity to meet genuine people who are like family to me now. They helped me to love myself and share the love with other beings. This place offers healing environment, treatments and meetings for the people who's willing to feel more alive. I'm happy that I went there and I can warmly recommend it for everyone. Go and experience ღ  See you again in full panchakarma session!

My partner and I attended a week-long panchakarma at Moksha in March and what we received was way beyond any of our expectations. It is very rare for one to find people so honestly dedicated to helping one's health holistically, so in love with life and with such warm hearts. The team is competent, friendly and genuinely caring. Both of us have never experienced better massages. My boyfriend is in owe of Ram's skills, for example, but this knowledge applies to all other therapists too. The therapies and food are pure healing for the spirit, body and mind with very strong positive effects. They are both individualized, after a thorough consultation, and are adjusted based on the experience of the guest. The place itself is a small island of peace, perfect for contemplation, relaxation and internal silence. We enjoyed absolutely everything and would love to go back there as soon as possible. Thank you, Moksha team, you are all very special people running a very special place :) Big hugs, Denitsa and Denis

column7: Highly professional and great value ayurveda
column8: Premises are set back from a quiet road, clean and beautiful. Treatments fantastic. I have had lots of massages, including ayurvedic. I even trained and worked as a masseur in my youth. Without a doubt, Ram delivers the best massage I have ever had..I had 5 in one week, they were so good! and hope to have more. I also had a couple of sessions with the Singing Bowls. Frankly I was a bit sceptical at first, but was amazed with how profound and transforming the experience is; also will have more next trip. Sanjay and Dr Padma are charming and genuinely caring and make you feel very welcome. I have been sticking to the ayurvedic prescription that Dr Padma gave me and notice positive changes in my condition.

I was booked into Moksha Ayurveda and Panchakarma Center for a week through my work and had no idea what to expect. Having zero experience of Ayurveda, meditation techniques or yoga I was a little apprehensive as to whether it would be a beneficial experience for me. After one week I'm very happy to say that my anxiety was completely misplaced. I did the full spectrum treatment, detoxification diet, daily yoga and meditation, massages and healing therapies. For someone who was initially sceptical about the benefits of Ayurveda I am now fully converted!!! The simple techniques I learnt during my week will bring huge benefits to my life in terms of managing my stress and bringing overall balance to my daily routine. The accommodation was very comfortable, providing a quiet stress free environment in which I could focus on some quality 'me time'. I would definitely recommend this to my friends and I will be returning within the year. Great works guys! Keep it up!!

the treatment, healing massages and introduction to yoga at Moksha Ayurveda and Panchakarma Center healed my shoulder. after years of pain and not being able to move my arm and shoulder the way I wanted, it's almost like having a new shoulder. the friendliness of the team and the atmosphere truly provided for a blissful experience. looking forward to be back

This cooking lesson was one of the top attractions we ended up doing in our 10-days travel in Kathmandu and surroundings. This hands on cooking course is ideal to learn the tricks, spend a joyful time with nepali-food enthusiastics and get inspired by the lovely project Sushma is leading. The course is well organized and the material is great. Learners alternate between kitchen and balcony spaces, both very cosy environments. Sushma is incredibly nice. Great experience indeed!

My husband and I took this cooking class together with Shusma, a really kind and informative teacher. The class was well designed and the food was very fresh and delicious! It was fun to be completely hands-on for the entire class and to learn about food and Nepali culture.
Nepal is fantastic with all different cultures and Sushma, the owner, is both competent and sweet and a very good teacher and chef. Now we know how to make dal bhat when we come home.

column7: Highlight of our stay in Patan and Kathmandu
column8: We booked our 2Sisters Nepal Cooking School class at the last minute at the end of a month long stay in Nepal and it was the best decision we made. There are three times offered for the class, which is very flexible, and we opted for 9am. At the start of the class we were offered the menu choices, and opted for chatamari, daal bhat and chocolate momo.  The location is great - the corner of an interesting complex in a quiet part of Patan, with a courtyard just outside where you can enjoy each dish as you cook it. We were staying in Patan and enjoyed the walk there, but 2Sisters also offers free pickup from Thamel.  The food we cooked with Shusma's help was super delicious! I was surprised at how quick and easy the chatamari was to cook. After eating lots of daal bhat during our travels, it was great learn how to make it ourselves, and the daal was sooo tasty and lovely and thick - no watery half-cooked version here! I didn't think we had room for chocolate momos but the high quality chocolate and ratio of pastry to chocolate to butter was perfect, we had no problems at all scoffing them down. :)  Shusma is a lovely host, we felt comfortable in an instant with her, and she is very kind and supportive. You really don't need to know 'how' to cook as she will guide you through the whole process. The time passed so quickly, just chatting away, making funny shaped momos and exchanging thoughts about our lives and travels. It was great to get more insight into Nepal from a local.  Shusma's kitchen is very clean, and all the ingredients are organic and high quality. There is purified water for drinking and preparing the ingredients, lots of soap and water for your hands, hand sanitiser, and aprons and hats for everyone cooking.  Finally, I need to mention the delicious masala tea we made and enjoyed at the start of the class. It was so warming, great on a chilly November morning. I am dreaming about that tea back home!  This is a great activity for anyone who loves food, whether you are an experienced cook or a complete beginner. All you need is a positive attitude and an empty stomach! Thank you Shusma for such a memorable experience.

I would highly recommend 2 Sisters Nepal Cooking School! My partner and I booked in for the morning session and it ended up only being us two in the group. Shusma had a driver pick us up from Thamel and it was a fairly quick drive to the school. The kitchen was lovely to be in, felt safe and very clean. We made momos and they turned out amazing! Shusma was such a pleasure. She told us beautiful stories about the food, where it comes from and the Nepalese culture. Make sure you go on an empty stomach so that you have room for all the amazing offerings!

column7: Great cooking class experience, knowledgeable teacher. Highly recommended.
column8: From a personal Thamel pickup, to adapting the menu for my gluten-free requirements, 2Sisters cooking school was an immensely enjoyable experience from beginning to end. We learned not only about cooking Nepalese food, but about the culture. Highly recommended. Come and give it a go.

After eating a lot of Daal Bhat during my trekking it was a grat experience to cook it myself. Also learning to make Mo:Mo's myself was fun! Shusma did a great job in teaching us and it was lots of fun with her!

My husband and I did the cooking class during our stay in Kathmandu in October 2019. We really enjoyed the cooking lesson and it was very well organized. The recipes are easy to replicate at home as well. It's really nice that the cooking school is located a bit outside of Kathmandu in a quiet and more beautiful area with a nice garden where you can enjoy the food. Afterwards we walked to Patan which is close and a very nice town and spent the afternoon there.
Excellent cooking class! Highly recommended. Both were really nice and did a good job teaching and explaining about the food of Nepal! It was indeed a very good experience

column7: Fun morning learning how to prepare Nepalese dishes
column8: A really great experience meeting Shusma and learning how to cook authentic Nepalese dishes in nice surroundings. I was collected on time at Thamel and thoroughly enjoyed this unique experience. It greatly added to my memories of Nepal. I can highly recommend this fun way to get a taste of the real Nepal

column7: Excellent experience in cooking Nepali food
column8: The owner of the school is super nice and sweet. We first made a booking, however, we could not make it because of traffic jam. Owner soon rescheduled the class for us. Also, transportation is provided from Thamel which saves us from wasting time finding the school. The food is very nice and exotic. Cooking steps are clear and easy to follow. I highly recommend you to go if you are interested in cooking!

column7: A very enjoyable experience in a calming and friendly environment
column8: Shusma was very helpful in arranging an after-work class at convenient time. The kitchen is conveniently located in peaceful Sanepa, spacious and well equipped.  Shusma's knowledge of the ingredients and and recipes was fantastic, making for an engaging experience. The class progressed at a good pace and there was no feeling of being rushed or pushed for time.  All the food we prepared was delicious and the Nepali tea a welcome accompaniment. I recommend choosing the Carrot Pudding for dessert and don't hold back on adding lots of ground Cardamom!

A friend and I attended a cooking session here and it was fantastic. Shusma, the teacher is, as everyone says, fantastic and has had an incredibly interesting life. 2 Sisters will pick you up and ferry you off to the school which is in a lovely suburb of Kathmandu. Nestled behind a villa, is the school with a perfect set up. We were not interested in going to someone's house to learn to cook and this is an actual set up where everyone has their own cooking station.  As mentioned, there are a variety of menus to choose from and I found Shusma to be helpful, encouraging, and very patient. Making the very popular Momos is not as easy as one would think.  I definitely had a fun afternoon and would highly recommend this experience. It makes me want to do this everywhere I go, but I suspect this is a hard act to follow. Do yourself a favor and sign up for a class. Shusma really is fantastic and has a down a great job with the school. The fact she is donating some of the funds to programs for Nepali women and children is inspiriting. Truly a must do experience in Kathmandu!

column7: A fantastic evening cooking delicious food!
column8: Shusma worked really hard to make sure all of the group had a fantastic experience! We had a choice of different dishes to make for each course, all of which looked delicious! They can easily cater for different food requirements e.g. veggie or vegan. All the things we made we got to eat and they were delicious! The recipes are easy to follow can easily be recreated at home, especially as Shusma sends the recipe book to you via email. Would highly recommend as a half day fun activity for tourists or expats living in the Kathmandu!

column7: A very complete, pleasant and delicious experience!!
column8: I had a wonderful experience at 2Sisters Nepal Cooking School. Shusma the teacher is a lovely person! I enjoyed every minute of my time there. I learned about new ingredients, new ways of doing things and the results of the three dishes we cooked were incredibly delicious! The place is clean, quiet, friendly and far from the chaos of downtown Kathmandu.  I was very impressed with the cause supported by 2Sisters Nepal Cooking School! It is an impressive social work that seeks to empower the marginalized women and provide funding for the children in rural village in eastern Nepal.  Highly recommended!!

column7: Must do, - a gem which could beautify Your any Himalaya experience!!!
column8: Our group get there very accidentally, - having a dinner in one of Kathmandu cafes we found a leaflet on the table and just decided, - why not?:) And it was wonderful decision. There is a saying, - through stomach to the heart, so I could say - it was through kitchen to the heart of Nepalese culture and our hearts as well:) Together with sisters we were selecting products in the local market and then amazingly emotionally preparing and cooking with songs and even dances:) If You will find before or after Your trip to the mountains just a glimpse of time, - it's a must do, - it's a gem which could beautify Your any Himalaya experience!!!

column7: An intimate, genuine taste of Nepal
column8: For me, our cooking class was the highlight of an epic and eye-opening trip. We got in touch with Shusma because we wanted to do something different for the birthday of my travelling companion. Shusma was warm, enthusiastic and completely accommodating of a very severe peanut allergy. We both found the class to be fun, authentic and we learned more than Nepali cooking. We found a kindred spirit in Shusma, and we were fascinated with her drive and sense as a business owner. Whether you are a feminist and aspiring chef, a tourist looking for a deeper Nepal experience or a trekker recovering from a stomach flu, 2Sisters cooking classes will deliver more than you expect. Can't reccommend enough!

Had an amazing time in Nepal learning about amazing vegetarian and vegan dishes with these beautiful ladies. They taught me a lot about the background of the Nepali culture, and food. Their hospitality was amazing and I really connected with their purpose of their class. I highly recommend taking this course to learn about Nepali food and culture!

column7: Make time for this amazing experience
column8: What a wonderful way to spend an afternoon in Kathmandu! After finishing our trek to EBC we had a week in Kathmandu. Cooking a traditional Newari meal away from the chaos of Thamel was a welcome break. The owner, I’m sorry I forgot her name, was a pleasure. She took time to explain the ingredients and their importance within the the culture and was great to talk to. The meal was outstanding despite my poor attempt at folding momos. Speaking of which make sure to make the chocolate-coconut ones! They’re amazing!!

My afternoon with Shusma and 2Sisters Nepal cooking school was one of the highlights of my month on Nepal! I have taken other cooking classes across SE Asia during my 3 month travels and this was by far the best. You get to learn the main Nepalese dishes, and, for me, even as someone who doesn’t cook much, it is taught in a way that I feel confident I can repeat at home. Shusma is fun and a great teacher, and her passion for women’s rights and the work she is doing to empower Nepalese women is inspiring. This class is a perfect and fun opportunity to learn about Nepalese cuisine and culture while contributing to the lasting social impact work of 2Sisters Nepal Cooking school!
Lovely place, amazing chef, I really had a pleasant and interesting with you. The food was so tasty, very well explained and so nice. Thank you so much 2 sisters for this class

The place is very nice in a little kitchen open in a restaurant garden. I spend a really good time with my sister and brother to learn about amazing tipical nepali food, the taste were fabulous and now I can do my own momos !!! So happy ! Thank you very I recommande +++

column7: Delicious Nepali food that I can now cook!
column8: I would recommend to anyone who wants to do something unique in Kathmandu and really experience the Nepali culture! Shusma is a great teacher and goes through every step to make the perfect Nepali dishes. We even went to the local grocery shop to buy the ingredients before, where Shusma showed and explained to me the different vegetables and what they're used for. This gave me a real insight into Nepalese cooking. You are also given so much flexibility to choose the dishes you want to make (starter, main and desert). Finally a percentage of money she makes at the cookery classes goes into Women's empowerment- so definitely talk to Shusma about this as she gave me so much insight into the caste system, gender equality and what it means to be a women in Nepal.

We had the most wonderful afternoon cooking with Shusma and her Sister Saloni - it was one of the many highlights of our trip to Nepal. The class was an insight into how the Nepalese cook at home! We started off by making masala chai and enjoyed drinking the tea whist Shusma explained our menu choice for the afternoon. We made chatamari (Nepalese breakfast pizza!) which was delicious. This was followed by a master class on momo's. They are both so welcoming and friendly. An amazing way to spend a relaxed afternoon in Kathmandu. Highly recommended!

Recommend to anyone looking for something different to do. great food,Shusma the chef was great,funny,easy to understand and great atmosphere of the class. You can take friends, family or your partner. I did the 3 course meal which I really enjoyed.A great insight into Nepali cooking with a friendly and knowledgeable cook. I would recommend this to anyone visiting Kathmandu!! And ofcourse the best Momo ever.

Best cooking class I ever had! Lovely, knowledgable and social involved Nepalese cook/host. Great setting and clear and easy instructions to help you cook a 3 course tasty Nepalese meal. Great value for money.

I just had a great cooking class. The dishes wre delicious, the staff is patient and very relaxed. It is with a great personal touch and you support school childeren in Nepal with the profit they make. What's not to love?

We had a great experience with Two Sisters Cooking School. We were met in Thamel and taken by taxi to the school, about 15 minutes away by car (in late afternoon traffic). The location and setting are lovely and serene, set in a courtyard with a relaxed open air restaurant/bar, away from the street. The kitchen is nicely set up. Our instructir was great, very experienced and capable, plus an effervescent personality which kept everything moving with good planning and humor. The students in our session jointly chose a dish from each of 3 categories and it was tailored to dietary restrictions: 2 vegetarians and 1 vegan in the mix. The food was delicious and we looo forward to trying some of the recipes at home. I’ve done all sorts of cooking classes in all sorts of places, from idyllic test kitchens in southeast Asian jungle settings to small home kitchens in the Andes, and this ranks with the best I’ve seen.
Had a great class! Pick up by taxi was on time. Very friendly and funny day during cooking class. Good choice of dishes. Highly recommended. Thank you!

Last week I did a cooking class at the 2Sisters Nepal Cooking School. It was a great experience, Shusma was really nice, she makes the class a lot of fun and I learned a lot as well. The dishes to choose from are all nice and a variation of different Nepali food. The kitchen is clean and there is a beautiful garden. Highly recommended!

Definitely a highlight of my visit to Kathmandu was the afternoon I spent cooking and chatting with Shusma! The class was great - such good food and a warm welcome. From the pickup in Thamel to making sure I got back to my hotel afterwards, Shusma made sure everything went smoothly and made it a really relaxing, interesting, and fun experience. I would absolutely recommend this class to anyone wanting to do more than the usual temple sightseeing when they’re in Kathmandu.

My friend and I chose to do a cooking class at 2Sisters to kick-off our Nepal trip and we are so glad we did! The food was amazing and Shusma, our host/instructor, was very professional in teaching us how to make authentic Nepalese food and really made us feel welcome and relaxed with her fun personality and great stories. As per other reviews, it really is like you're cooking with a friend! Definitely worth trying!

After eating Daal Bhat for the entire trip (especailly while trekking), learning how to cook it was the perfect ending to my trip in Nepal. Shusma was so nice, helpful, and interesting in answering all our questions about cooking and Nepal.

What an absolutely wonderful evening I spent with Shusma! Genuinely one of the highlights of my trip to Nepal! I booked fairly last minute and ended up being the only participant but the class still went ahead, just for me! It was a lovely, personal experience; it was more like cooking at home with a good friend; just really relaxed conversation and casually cooking and eating amazing Nepalese dishes. It was a truly touching experience and I left well-fed but also so sad to say goodbye. I have already, and will continue to recommend the sisters to anyone and everyone with a few hours spare in Kathmandu.

What a fantastic experience; I would recommend 2sisters to anyone looking for an authentic Nepali cooking experience while in Kathmandu. Not only was the food fantastic, Sushila and her enthusiasm took the whole experience to another level. She was clear and easy to understand, and certainly taught very well. Her joy for cooking was infectious. I can't say enough to recommend this experience, say yes if you are even thinking about it!

Where to begin with this incredible experience! We met Suchila, our leader for the night, at 5 pm and were immediately made to feel comfortable. Her exuberance about cooking and Nepali food carried us through the night! After deciding which menu to make, we went to the local market to pick out vegetables. Back in the kitchen, we were shown how to make a full Nepali meal including milk tea, an appetizer, entree, and dessert. Suchila is a patient and fun teacher and had us laughing our way through cutting vegetables, sautéing onions, and finally folding momos. This is an opportunity not to be missed and one that my friend and I enjoyed so much, that we are going back for another session!

My friend who came to the cooking school last year recommended me to do the cooking class with 2sisters when I come to Kathmandu. So I did! I landed in Nepal for the first time around midday day and booked for the 5pm class on the same day! I learnt how to make Thukpa, veg mo mo and carrot pudding from scratch and I was shown the Nepali way of cooking. Sushila and Shusma are super lovely people! I enjoyed the experience and what a special way to Valentine’s Day and my first day in Nepal!

I had an amazing time at the cooking school! That day I was the only participant and so it was actually just me and one of the sisters, but we honestly had such a good time! Although it felt like cooking with a friend, the session was really informative and I learned a lot of different tips on how to make nepalese food. It started with choosing a menu made of three dishes, after that we went to a local market buying the products that we needed and then the fun began. First I got to learn how to make the traditional Masala Tea and after our cup of tea, the preparation of the dishes started. We had a lot of fun making Chatamari, Aloo Chop and chocolate Mo:Mo, talking, joking around and laughing. After each dish you can eat the foods outside in the beautiful garden and just be amazed by how good it tastes! Finally, they send you all the recipes of the day and more, so that you can cook them again at home. The place is really clean and I love that they put a lot of emphasize on not trying to waste any food. I left the class with a full belly, good memories and a new friend! I can 100% recommend the place!

column7: Best cooking class and nicest, most interesting people
column8: My sister and I completed the cooking class on our last day in Nepal and it was one of the most incredible experiences we had. The teachers were happy, super helpful and patient and had no problem answering any questions that we had about Nepal. The location is beautiful and we loved being able to contribute to the mission of this cooking skill. Also, they send you the recipes after so that you can cook the meals for yourself at home. 100% highly recommend to everyone.

My friends and I (a group of four) had an absolutely delightful time at our cooking class. Sushma and Sabitha are hilarious, patient, and kind. Our food was absolutely delicious and the whole experience was very enjoyable. I would highly recommend 2Sisters Nepal during a visit to Kathmandu!

I attended the 2 sisters Nepal cooking class with my family and a friend and we all enjoyed the 3.5 hour experience immensely. A choice of three menus are offered, and after choosing, we headed to a nearby store to buy the ingredients. The menu consisted of three courses and after cooking each we sat down and ate our creations. The school in run by a lovely young Nepali woman who speaks perfect English after a decade living in Europe. Her two bubbly assistants make the class fun with their infectious laughter. I absolutely recommend the class to anyone interested in Nepali food and culture.

We had a lovely time at the 2 Sisters Cooking School. The kitchen was very clean, the produce was fresh and most of all the ladies were absolutely lovely. A big thank you to Shusma, Sabitha and Sushila for greeting us so warmly, taking us to the market and teaching us Chatamari and Mo:mo!

Amazing and unique experience not to be missed. During our travels, the food we had was so delicious, the opportunity to learn how to cook it was not to be passed up.  Staff were helpful, friendly, patient and did the preparation so we could just concentrate on cooking and enjoying the meals (we cooked) in the pleasant  The idea of using the cooking school to facilitate empowering women is definitely worthwhile.  I would highly recommend the class and it was great to see both women and men of all ages participate and enjoy the afternoon.  Can’t wait to try out the new recipes when we get home.

2Sisters cooking school was a really fun and enjoyable experience. Shusma and Sushila were lovely, patient and excellent at sharing their knowledge of cooking local cuisine. We got to choose between 3 menus and ate the 3 course meal we made throughout the class in a beautiful court yard garden. We learnt more about Nepal than just food, and their English was excellent. It was a really relaxed and genuine experience that I would highly reccomend to anyone looking to understand the Nepali food and culture better!

We learned to cook 3 Nepali dishes, which was already a great experience! On top of that we enjoyed lots of interesting and inspiring talks with the cook and the founder of this cooking school and learned a lot about life in Nepal. I loved every minute in this place with its beautiful garden. If you would like to participate in a cooking class - book this one! Not the least because with your participation you support projects that try to empower marginalized women in this country!

The cooking class in Patan was exactly what I was hoping for and more. We cooked 3 Nepali dishes but received the entire recipe book of all dishes. The instructors were knowledgeable, patient, clear and also hilariously funny! The kitchen was clean and stocked with all the equipment we needed to cook delicious Nepali dishes. Overall I would highly recommend this cooking school to anyone visiting or living in Kathmandu area. Also, some of the proceeds help support women and children in the area. A wonderful initiative!
Had a wonderful learning experience. Was in Nepal for holiday and got a chance to learn some authentic Nepali dishes. Cooking lessons with lots of fun and friendly atmosphere. Highly recommended .

For someone who wasn't quite interested in cooking class & got talked into joining by friends, it turned out to be a great surprise for me. The instructors were super friendly & fun & you can surely see their enthusiasm in what they are doing. We were taken to local market, explained about the local cuisine and later creating & enjoying food in such a beautiful garden under the sun together. This is definitely a unique experience for me during my time in Nepal. Would absolutely recommend the school to friends & family.

So, I was one of lucky guys who was visited cooking school 2sisters. I was a chef in my country, so I am judging this course like a professional. Room is very clean, sanitariness friendly. Good and clean modern equipment. Each participant have access to his own cooking equipment.  In the beginning we have great experience buying ingredients for dishes. We going together to local market and buy all that we need. Also got an information about new fruits and vegetables that we doesn't have in Europe.  We cooked 3 dishes + masala tea. After each dish we eating and resting. So, you can spend great time in great company all day and it's wonderful!!!  Courses totally vegan and vegetarian friendly. So, you can choose between dishes with meat, eggs and pur veg.  Team is friendly, funny and very active. You will never be border with two sisters.  They teach every detail, so they know their work very well. Dishes was delicious. I so proud of sisters. I wish them good luck and success.  BRAVO!!!! AND THNX FOR GREAT TIME.

column7: So pleasant and useful time spending!
column8: We are what we eat, so It was very nice to meet with nepalian culture by that way. The whole journey was so interesting, now I know the whole process from buying products to making awesome food. Feeling myself very grateful to wonderful sisters it was a real magic. Best way to spend a day in Katmandu that way! Definitely recommend!

I always try to take a cooking class when I visit a new country, and I really enjoyed this one. I contacted the school via Facebook and was picked up for free near the garden of dreams/himilayan java. After a quick taxi ride, I arrived at the hotel they host the class at. I was allowed to mix and match the appetizer/desert from the menu so I ended up cooking chatamari, veg momo, and carrot pudding. Making nicely shaped momos is very hard if you’re not used to making dumplings or tortellini, but the sisters kept it entertaining. They have a good sense of humor and make the class feel relaxed.

column7: Great experience with inspirational women and delicious food
column8: Wonderful cooking school in a beautiful setting with fun and inspirational women. We were 5 people in the class and chose to cook the Chatamari / Daal Bhat / Chocolate Momo menu - apparently the most popular one.  You start off by visiting the local store to buy the fresh produce to cook with, and then move between cooking in the well-equipped and immaculate kitchen to enjoying the fruits of your labours outside in a beautiful sunny garden.  The food is delicious and plentiful, the teachers are full of energy and laughter, and it is a wonderful and uplifting way to spend a morning or afternoon in Kathmandu. I highly recommend it!
It was a great experience and a lot of fun with 2 Sisters Nepal Cooking School. Highly recommend visiting it at least once for the best cooking class in the best way possible !!

column7: Authentic Culinary Adventures and Great Hospitality
column8: Genuinely, it was one of the most wonderful and memorable experience with 2Sisters Nepal Cooking School. We had an opportunity to discover the real taste of Nepalese cuisine and their ethnic meals. The ladies out there were extremely friendly and helpful. We felt very much comfortable learning and eating with them. Highly recommended.

Excellent Way to know nepali food Better. It was a great learning experience with some really kind and friendly employees. I am very glad that i chose your School. Keep up the good Work guys 👍🏼👍🏼. Will surely do a visit again:)

I highly recommend the cooking class with 2 sisters. The class is in Sanepa, set in a beautiful and calm garden. I cooked chatamari (rice pancake) momos and carrot pudding and it was delicious. Thank you so much for the incredible experience!

We did the cooking class end of October, 2 days before leaving Nepal and we made the tastiest Dal Bhat we had the whole trip!!! (2 weeks of Nepal). The girls were full of energy and humor, which took the lesson to the next level. They were very helpful as well in the explaining the spices and where it's better to buy them from. In a few days we ll have a friends get together back home so I am very excited to see show my Nepalese cooking skills :)

Such a nice plan! You will learn and have fun with these girls, who by the way are amazing teachers. Cooking tipical nepalí food is another great way to approach to this amazing culture. Strongly recommend this experience.

We used the pick up service from Thamel - everything went smoothly and the two ladies of 2sisters found us ahead of time.  The new cooking school is a oasis in busy Kathmandu - I would recommend everyone to go there and to see that there is more to discover than just Thamel ;-)  With the help of our master chefs we chose a menue, went shopping together and started cooking. To put it in a nutshell: much fun, very interesting, super clean and YUMMY!!  To me, this is by far the best way to get to know other cultures - a must do in Kathmandu!

This is something everyone should do when they're here. The two sisters are so passionate re what they do with personalised shopping trip to get the vegetables, traditional secrets and of course learning to make the momos! You get a choice of 3 menus, the carrot pudding Amazing!!! This school is the one to support as it the finance helps to empower women in employment. Loved every part of this experience!

I loved learning how to cook Nepalese dishes. The kitchen was really well setup with individual cooktops for each participant. The learning was fun and we could ask lots of questions on ingredient variations. The Sisters made the experience super funny, dancing and singing. I had just got back from trekking EBC and it was one of my favourite holiday highlights in Nepal.
The owner and instructors were knowledgeable, friendly and energetic! We all really enjoyed ourselves-even the men! The food was delicious!

column7: The Two Sisters cooking class, what a joy!
column8: The cooking class was the highlight of my Kathmandu experience! I had just completed the trek to Mt. Everest base camp and ate many of the dishes on the trail that we made in class. The kitchen was clean and organized and the garden area that we ate in was beautiful.

column7: An excellent cultural event - very original experience
column8: We visited this place for a fun day with friends. We enjoyed to cook with nepali sisters, the food was fresh and tasty and the sisters taught us about food and culture. A definite must if you enjoy cooking!

A wonderful cooking experience! Very easy to organise, the girls enthusiastically met us to take us to our cooking oasis complete with an organised and clean kitchen next to a beautiful outdoor garden. The menu options offer something for everyone's taste and skill level. Would definitely recommend!

column7: Beautiful Experience in a Beautiful area with some Beautiful people
column8: I found this cooking school on a flyer in my hotel and thought it would be a great thing to do before i left Nepal. I had been in Kathmandu for a few days and had tried Momos and eaten Dahl Bhat, so it was great to learn how to make these delicious food items along with three other delicious meal at this cooking school. The cooking teachers we fun, knowledgeable and patient with us as we made poor replicas of the food they were teaching us to make. This has to be one of the funnest things I have done in ages, singing, dancing, cooking and eating in a beautiful courtyard. 2 Sisters Nepal Cooking School is a great addition to anyone trip to Nepal ...... ........ and the food was just so yummy :-) :-) :-) :-) :-) Thanks guys for a wonderful experience

column7: The best Cooking experience and class ever
column8: A friend recommended this place, 2 Sisters Nepal Cooking School. booked a class without informing im a chef.  Picked up in Thamel in morning and a short taxi ride to Patan where a beautiful location, fresh and professional kitchen was awaiting us. The girls running it are so sweet and funny, while i learnt lots about Nepali food and society and enjoyed a great meal with other travellers in the sunny garden.  Really well Done to these girls who are trying to do something good for their country and empowering women.

Lots of radhuni & lots school now a days but best is 2Sisters Cooking school their recipes are simple and yet the outcome is outstanding. learning here is a fun and Sushila is very friendly. I recommend 2Sisters Cooking school.
Amazing place, amazing vibes, amazing service and staff. I would love to come back again and again. Felt like home. Coming back home 😊

It was an amazing experience in utopia. I went with my friends to was worldcup match and to have dinner. I had chicken florentine which was delicious and it was well plated and served well whereas, my friends had burgers. Overall me and my friends...More

Utopia has good food, good ambience, amazing hospitality. Its a happy environment place to be. I have always had a great time. Cocktails are amazing, food category's absolute favorite is Mustang Aloo, dessert favorite is Lemon cheese cake.
Me and my 6 year old son had a great time having lunch today. The food was delicious, drinks were great..Mostly my son enjoyed the whole eating experience..

A-la-carte! One of the best places around Patan. The restaurant is located in a calm atmosphere with really soothing decors, artistic set-up and the positive vibe you get as soon as you enter. Order your taste bud- Italian, Nepali or Continental, you would savor and would visit again. Bon appetit! The warm service is quite unique (I would be a spoilsport if I tell everything). Bonne Chance! You can really make things happen if you believe it and you would never miss to visit such an Utopian world. Bon voyage!

Almost on our door step this place is awesome. Great during the day as the outside court yard is extremely pleasant and cozy during the evenings. Customer service is very good Not the norm in Nepal and the food is served in good time again not always the norm in Nepal. A variety of dishes that meets a mixture of taste buds definitely recommend this place I just hope they keep up the good work as it only opened recently.
Elegant ambience and friendly service..A must visit restaurant to experience exquisite food and an awesome atmosphere with good music...

column7: A magical budget friendly place to stay
column8: We just can’t say enough about how much we loved our stay at Peacock Guesthouse patan. The service was amazing (we felt like staying at a friend’s house), the breakfast was the definition of tasty and BIG, the rooms are very luxurious.
