Only downside in that the roof is a little low (too low for tall people) but hey you are in Asia (they do not have the Caucasian issue of being tall) so the house is perfect! I am 1.67 meters and I had not issue at all, but others taller than that might have.

column7: Great stay at a traditional Nepali house
column8: What I liked best about the Peacock Guest House in Patan, the bed. It was the best bed I slept in during my entire stay in Nepal. Very comfortable! Peacock is a stylish Nepali house. Decorated in traditional style which I loved. Ceilings are low, so mind your head. It was a bit chilly, but the bed was warm and the shower is hot. Located just a few minutes from the Golden Temple and a few minutes more from Durbar Square. Staff is friendly and will help out. Breakfast was good and there was plenty to eat. I booked my airport drop off thru the hotel and it was organised as it should. Taxi was 500 rupees. I enjoyed my stay very much at the Peacock chain (also Bhaktapur) and I would recommend this place.

This has been my favorite place in Jhamsikhel area. This place serves as a hangout place, working place and eater. Whats interesting is that, the staffs know you as a person not just a customer. They know that a customer is a Human being and not just a money source. Waiters come and talk nicely. They go beyond in making customers happy. There is no rigid disciplinary and mandatory hospitality, rather its from the heart. I really like this pace.

Me and my husband love this place. The Indian and newari food here is very delicious, mildly spiced and cooked just right. We come here almost every week. The place is also not heavy on your pocket. The staff here are very attentive, i think they are the star attraction of this place. They would greet you and make you feel comfortable right away. The restaurant has mithila arts all over its wall. The art is a unique form of paining from southern part of Nepal, and always made by women.

This place is filled with lots of people and liveliness. The music is good and the service is also fast. Sometimes this place can be too crammed with people. However, the overall experience is amazing and the coffee is also very good. They also serve...More

One of the best and cozy place to have coffee with organic taste with loved ones, friends and family. With beautiful incraved paintings and peace environment is another attraction. Unique and variation of coffee with phenomenonal taste. While checked in into sanepa Rock Beans Coffee hub can be the best place to spent the time.once is not enough to be @rockbeanscoffee

column7: An Alternative Venue for a Unique Experience
column8: As the name suggests, this art cafe offers multi-cultural choices for the visitors from the art corner to outdoor seating to the lounge bar. Besides hanging out in this community hub, they also provide networking opportunities through events and their co-working space. The prices at...More
Nice ambiance, lots of interesting events worth checking out to see what is on. Good food (Caesar salad was v tasty). Has character, but bit of a yard

I went along to BACs after hearing about the great creative vibe of this place and I wasn't disappointed. It has a lovely garden and I enjoyed some of the fresh guavas just fallen from the tree in the garden on my visit! Its a great place to hang out and get inspired. I went for a few drinks, and really enjoyed the guava cocktail! Some talented artists work here too so you can meet some fellow creatives or just enjoy the artwork all around. Thoroughly recommend!
The staff are excellent. The biryani was very good, they could provide more raita and pickle with it, but overall very good. Nice and clean place in a new and modern mall. Recommended.

The restaurant is one of the best in Kathmandu for Indian food. Especially I love biryani and taste is consistence. Presentation of food is attractive. Ambiance is good for fine dine. Recommended for spicy North Indian Food.

column7: Best innovative Indian food in town!
column8: A must visit for food lovers. A different take on Indian food and simply loved it. Wonderful ambience , went for dinner with family and friends. Non smoking zone is separate on the balcony, so taking kids to dine out was fun. Staff are very welcoming and friendly. Thumbs up to Asmita, who served us. She was very friendly, suggested us the specialities ( keeping kids in mind) and always smiling. She made our experience worth writing about. Will definitely visit again. A bit pricey than the regular restaurant, but worth it.

Well we were out for a movie on a Sunday at Labim mall. Saw a new Indian cuisine restaurant, the name was catchy and boasted about having only 2 restaurants one in Washington DC and the other in Kathmandu. So this place seemed nice from the outside hence we went in. Well i am still regretting why did we go in there ? Well when you go to a fine dinning restaurant especially Indian Cuisine there are a few expectations. They did not meet any of them. Starting with their veg menu did not have any spicy paneer item. That is still bearable. We ordered our food. In the mean while we were expecting papads which are usually given prior to your meal. We got them but we had to ask for the same. Then any indian restaurant does give you a main course plate with a side plate as well. The shocking thing was that their main plate was the size of the side plate and no side plate was provided. We ordered rotis as 3 plus 3 so that we get hot rotis but the service was so poor that we were left lingering for about 15 mins after the first round of rotis were finished. The food was average nothing great. Then when we asked for the cheque in any indian restaurant you do get a finger bowl or there are tissues on the table. No finger bowl was provided neither was any kind of mouth freshener .  The overall experience of dinning was extremely disappointing and would not go again or recommend any one unless they make drastic changes.

column7: great burger and delicious gourmet donuts
column8: I stepped into workshop eatery randomly because it was the nearest restaurant. it was awesome!! i had their cheeseburger which had buffalo patties and it was really good. i also had their donut and was blown away by the effort they put in making these magical donuts. however their space was a little small and it could get crowded during lunchtime. but my overall experience was very good. will visit soon.

column7: Average - not as good as we'd hoped
column8: The place looks nice, and the menu looks interesting - but we ordered 2 dishes and they were very average. Veggie burger was very plain and unimaginative - dry patty, slice of tomato, piece of lettuce - and that's it! Fries (separate order) were OK, but again not very exciting. Glad to have tried it - but won't rush back.

column7: Definitely need a visit to this place
column8: We went to this little gem after reading the reviews on tripadvisor and it didn't disappoint. My husband had a spicy chicken burger which is one of the best burger in town. And it was my first time having a burrito in Nepal. The flavour of the burrito and the texture of the tortilla wrap was very authentic. The service and the cosy ambience made the eating in experience all better. It's a shame we didn't have enough time to go back for their other items in the menu. But will definitely go next time when we are in Nepal.

column7: Excellent Service, Hygienic Food & Scrumptious Mexican and American Food in Lalitpur, Nepal
column8: I have visited The Workshop Eatery quite a few times and every time I visit, I like their limited but specialized cuisines appalling to the palate and the belly, minimalist but elegant and simplistic ambiance, quick and friendly staffs and service delivery. Most of all, it reminds me of the movie "Kungu Panda," as one can feel that they never forget to add the secret and special ingredient of love thoroughly in everything they offer and they do. I would certainly recommend everybody to visit and feel the experience for themselves at least once before getting addicted to their yummy and delicious authentic Burgers, wide range of coffee, mouth-watering Nutella doughnuts, tempting Fajitas and utterly tasty Burritos and many more. If you believe in honoring your belly, do pay a visit to experience the delight.

Conveniently located and quick service this place makes lunchtimes so easy!!! A wide menu (although not everything is AlwAys available as somethings are sold out due to popularity) and a very handy loyalty card that can get you some good freebies are an added bonus. The burgers are in proper buns and the wraps and burritos are huge! The Nutella donuts really r a must and the familiarity of the staff makes it a pleasant experience.
I enjoyed a lovely dinner of Burritos and Burgers with friends. Good service, delicious food and modern atmosphere. I will go back soon.

I am so dissapointed with everything . I had 9 family member wanting to enjoy our time together . We arrive around 7:50 .i had clearly mentioned that we would be taking starters and drinks first then followed by nepali khana for everyone .They took...More
The best achaars and the best service from those amazing staffs . Couldn’t be more relaxed and excited at the same time . A must recommend place if you’re in k-town!

Went here with the fam, the food isn't very unique - authentic Nepalese but the achar (spicy sauce/pickle) offered with the food takes it to a whole new level. There's also an option to buy your favourite achar from the shop located at the gourd...More
Very nice atmosphere and extremely good service. I would recommend but beware that all food is spicy ( as it should be). Small area to eat outside but the inside is really very well done

If you are looking for authentic tasty Nepali food, look no further!  I am a regular customer coming almost every week and have tried pretty much everything of their very diverse menu. The food has that very authentic taste and offers a very subtle harmony between carefully prepared home-cooked food and delicate gourmet cuisine, with just the right balance of spices. They also serve delicious side achaar (spices) with every meal, my personal favorite being the lapsi (Nepali plum). The quality is always constant, I have never been disappointed a single time. It's probably one of the best Nepali restaurant in town and definitely my personal favorite one!  But it's not only the great food that makes me come back again and again. It is also about the place and its people. The friendly owner and the smiling staff are very attentive and always give me a warm feeling of being taken care of. The restaurant is also decorated with taste and exudes a very pleasant atmosphere. There is a sort of discrete elegance, refinement in simplicity, at Achaar Ghar which makes it a truly special place for a unique culinary experience. A must!

I liked the decor inside the restaurant, and the veg jhol momo was very good. I don't think exceptional though. They give a sample of the achaar they make on the table in small bowls, which is a good sales technique for their achaar shop below the restaurant.

column7: The worst restaurant experience in Nepal.
column8: Had to wait more than half an hour for just one of our dish to arrive. When I asked the waitress how much more time it would take she went to her boss and told him but neither of them cared to respond to our...More

There are number of restaurants in Jhamsikhel area in Lalitpur and one of them is Wicked Spoon which is just next to the Roadhouse Cafe. The entrance is not that great but interiors and sitting areas of the hotel looks very attractive. Three different areas...More

column7: first time experience and a good experience
column8: So the place is mix of fine dining and rock bar, unusual but kind of cool place. We ordered hot lemon, square wrapped in bacon and Speghetti carbonara which was big Dry but all good. Service was good, music and food was good too. The...More

I was here with my friends in the evening and it was crowed already. Nevertheless they had a separate lounge inside which was decently setup and less crowed. The live performance was good but the hauling sound system made it horrible to listen. The staffs were all friendly and the service was reasonably fast. The dinner was excellent, warm, fresh and attractive. The good part of this place is there is a pool table which is fun when you are with friends. A few bottles of chilled beer and cocktails would bring charm for the evening.
From the start service was good. Staff were friendly, order was taken care and came in time. Food was good. They have different international beer with local beer choice. Had good time with friends.

I've been to this restaurant a couple of times and it's a pretty good version of American comfort food. Certainly one of the best in the Kathmandu Valley. The dishes vary from average to nostalgia-inducing goodness. A friendly staff and authentically American ambiance round out the experience.  A must try is their pulled pork sandwich!

I just had dinner at Southern Comfort on my way back from work. I will go back during the remainder of my (short) work time here because the service was perfect - welcoming, quick, attentive...just a really pleasant experience, thanks to the host/waiter. The menu is solidly american - they even have fried chicken with mashed potatoes! Alas, I'm a vegetarian, and was nervous that they wouldn't have options, but indeed they did...including the veggie bbq ribs that I ordered. They were great! I think they were seitan, sauce was very good, served with steamed veggies and mashed potatoes (but I substituted a small salad and they were fine with that). The red wine was also very good. Great value for prices too. All in all, especially due to the lovely service, I highly recommend this restaurant.

The satey is the best I have ever tried I think it can compare with thailands satey. For me the mango rice was really tasty sadly it was hard to get due to the season but the staff went out of their way to get...More

I've been here quite a number of time and it's always a wonderful experience. I've had their Singaporean Malaysian menu a few times and they always please me. One time I randomly decided to try their Dehiwala pizza and it blew my mind. It was...More

I had always wanted to come to Yellow Pomelo after seeing raving reviews of the restaurant by Instagram food bloggers. And boy, was I in for a good treat. Right from the moment my friends and I entered the Yellow Pomelo gate, we were given...More

Stumbled on this restaurant while food hunting around my daughter’s school! Had an amazing dining experience with my choice of being seated in any of the differently themed rooms. Staff were prompt in service and explained the menu in detail. Overall, child-friendly and a menu...More

Hmmm.. Delectable food and drinks.. You have to let your taste buds experience the authenticity of the Asian spread available here. Wide range of beverages.. Vibrant music band keeps you entertained in the evenings. The team is dedicated and very accommodating!! Very spacious and comfortable seating.. Mee goreng is a must have at every visit. Never fails you. The new addition - seaweed chicken is just as yummy as during secondary school days.. Had lovely time with great company over here..

A very good little restaurant with only a couple of tables, Casa de Cass feels like a very intimate dinning experience. The excellent and eclectic menu has a number of terrific eats for any taste buds.

column7: Delicious food and a nice Place
column8: I ordered salmon with risotto and a rocket salad. My friends and I enjoyed the food and the cozy well lit place. PS:the toilet was very clean.

column7: Pleasant Ambience and a Varied Menu
column8: We enjoyed the light, airy atmosphere of Cibo Bistro. It is clean and attractive (including the bathroom), and the service is very good. We had pasta dishes and the portions were quite adequate. One of us ordered the pumpkin soup and really enjoyed it. The homemade ice cream is good, though we felt the chocolate could be improved with a stronger chocolate flavor. There is parking but it is limited.

My fiancé and I went to this restaurant last night. It's tucked away in an alley off Pulchowk right opp. the UN Habitat office. We had the entire restaurant to ourselves the whole time we were there (7-9pm roughly). It was so shockingly warm and cheerful that we may not have cared if the food was not satisfying. However, our dinner was absolutely delicious. I am a vegetarian and I haven't had a more sumptuous meal in the last week in Nepal than at Cibo Bistro. Their vegetarian lasagne was probably the best I have had anywhere. The bruschetta had so much flavour; grilled slices of eggplant, zucchini and tomato are layered over bread, and splashed with just the right amounts of basil pesto and mozzarella. My fiancé had the gnocchi with the house wine and some apple pie for dessert (I was too full from the lasagne for any dessert). Coffee was pretty good too. Cibo's service is very helpful and quick.  In short, this is a restaurant that offers excellent and varied food in a decent price range and guilt-inducing comfort in a power-starved city.
This was recommended to me for lunch and I enjoyed the soups and sandwiches. It is located a little off the main road so would ask for directions before venturing out.

column7: best place for coffee and working space
column8: I come here to work on my projects and I enjoy the ambience and coffee here. I especially love the fact that Simran and sometimes others always fill water in my glass even before I realize that it is now empty. 10/10 recommend for digital...More

column7: Great coffee, food, clean & friendly service
column8: We visited The Busy Bean several times, including hosting a group of 12 friends from our trek on the roof garden. Nepali & European food available with many interesting beverages on the menu.

column7: Good daytime atmosphere, Good coffee, Tasty food, slow wifi
column8: I've been three times now; twice for lunch and once for dinner. I mainly go to attend to my online business. I really like the atmosphere during the day. There is ample electric plugins however in my experience the wifi is incredibly slow here in comparison to let's say 'Top of the World' cafe.  The coffee is very good, albeit it should be heated more. The food in all three meals was very delicious (Nepali dishes). I haven't tried the western food yet.  During the daytime it would be wonderful if the staff closed the door that is always open on the main street as it creates a lot of noise in a rather peaceful cafe.  Dinner I won't return. Not because of the food or service, but because the lighting is atrocious (not much different than most Nepali restaurants). It would have been nice if they used soft 'warm white' bulbs instead of the horrid aquarium/daylight bulbs and perhaps tall reading lamps for ambiance. Not very romantic when I brought my wife.  The service is always friendly and at one point the manager or maybe owner approached me looking for feedback. That is rare in Nepal, so stars for that. Hopefully he listened!  All in all, for me to return regular, the wifi needs to be improved and perhaps the password changed weekly to avoid others 'hanging' on the system (including perhaps staff?).

We’ve been in Nepal (Kathmandu and Pokhara) for 10 days and eaten at restaurants or hotels for every dinner. Our experience at Umi was the best by far. We were reluctant to try Umi because of so few reviews, but the website looked great so...More

This place is ok for lunch or quick bite. Actually only thing we got annoyed was that service was wery slow. Stuff escorted us for seats and after that we waited over 10mins to get menu. Well to be honest I went to get them....More

A great place to have food in Kathmandu, the place is unique for its team are differently abled. this makes the food and the experience a lot more rewarding and satisfying. the location is a close to the zoo and very easily accessible and provides...More

column7: Nice place to eat and relax
column8: Food was fair and a pretty good selection on the menu. The service was good and what was interesting is the staff waiters are deaf

column7: 今日はどのチーズケーキを食べようかな
column8: ラリットプールのマレーシア・シンガポール料理のお店。昔食べたマレーシアのロティがとても美味しかったので注文したところ、昔の記憶を思い出す美味しさでした。小麦粉を焼いたり揚げたりする「ロティ」と言われるものは世界中にありますが、私はマレーシアのロティチャナイ一番好きです！また、チーズケーキの種類が豊富で、食後のデザートのケーキを何にするのか考えるのも楽しいと思います！ Malaysian and Singaporean restaurant in Lalitpur. I ordered the Malaysian Roti which I ate ago and I liked. There are so-called “roti” that bake and fry flour all over the world, but I like Malaysia's loti chani best! In addition, there are many types of...More

column7: Great way to explore Singaporean and Malaysian food
column8: SingMa is located just a block away from the Safeway supermarket in Patan. It's one of the cleanest restaurants i've ever eaten at. The staff is extremely professional and helpful. For those unfamiliar with Asian cuisine, order a number of dishes that seems interesting, and...More

this is a place to keep in your list for sure. the cuisine is unique, the service very good and fast, the prices are reasonable. we are often coming for lunch there with colleagues. also, they have very good deserts, we may coming there for them only, even...

We went looking for this restaurant after we heard people post good reviews about this place on social media. It took us few attempts before we could find this nice little hidden place on the way to Swotha. I felt like I was in a...More

A great little place, just off Patan Durbar. The atmosphere is relaxed, and the owner is really friendly. I've been several times and the food is always fresh and really well cooked, with the menu changing around to keep things interesting.

It is inspired from the Maha Bodh temple in Gaya India. The temple is unique and beautiful with thousands of Buddha statue made on bricks covering the entire temple. You need to carefully look at the directions as it in a alley. Not very far from Durbar square.

column7: Entrance fee of Rs 50 to two temples!
column8: I admit that this temple was very impressive, especially since it's being renovated currently but it's interesting to see the 9000 Buddhas in the temple monument.  I rate this high because the entrance fee of Rs 50 includes another temple just 2 mins walk from Mahaboudha, the Rudravarna Mahavihar. The second one is a more impressive temple due to its spaciousness and more statues and iconography that you can appreciate there.

The temple of Maha Bouddha is a masterpiece of terracotta. Very nice temple. This temple was built by Abhaya Raj, a priest of Patan. And it is sometimes referred to as the temple of a million Buddhas because every single brick has a small image of Buddha. An extremely interesting temple. This temple is a hidden gem, a little it is difficult to find in the narrow alleys and streets. It is worth visiting.
This temple was in an interesting alley and had many intricately carved/sculpted Buddhas along the temple walls as well as a tiny temple that you could enter.

One of the masterpiece work on terracotta shikara style Buddhist temple in kathmandu valley that build in 14th century AD. Mahaboudha mean many boudha the temple is completely covered by 1000 one thousand statue of boudha. A group of business men who visited India in14th century and thought to introduce unique terracotta to the people of valley. This temple is located in lalitpur about 15 minutes walk from patan Durbar square to east south inside courtyard. Worth to visit for travelers who love artictecture.

When I entered into the area of this temple, I was shocked...really!!! I had never imagined that such temple exist even in Nepal...it is really a unique and beautiful temple. It has 1000 Buddha statues .. A best temple, architecture, design... For me.

Especially to Buddhists, this is a holly place for visiting. If you can accept Buddhism, it had better find one who can know Newar Buddhism. The Newar Buddhism is not Tibetan Buddhism but a unique one. It is quite close to the original Mahayana Buddhism.

column7: Tucked away, difficult to find, but unusual temple
column8: Closely surrounded by courtyard, this temple cannot be seen from the street. It is difficult to find, yet well kept and unique, and worth the effort. There is a small entry fee. The temple is made of terracotta tiles, each a likeness of Buddha -It features candles and windows to the interior (another Buddha), interesting architecture. The surrounding walls have inspirational signs - The temples is an oasis of cool air, and refreshingly calm. The same admittance fee enables entrance to the monestary across the street. Directions to this temple can be found on the Patan Durbur square map.
Good to experience a Nepal local market as there are not too many tourist, though gets crowded. Visit if one has time to spare.

column7: Crowded and scary to drive through
column8: Bronze, "antiques", hardware, clothes, dry food stuffs, etc. all are found here in this main shopping area - mostly for Nepali locals. For tourists it is an interesting trip in the inner life of the people here. There are a few bronze shops with nice things - but watch the prices.

column7: Similar to Asan in Ktm but more laid back, great for shoes
column8: This is a typical local market area where you can buy everything for the household as well as clothing and shoes. Patan is known as the place for shoes so there is a great variety of shoe shops. It is similar to Asan in Kathmandu but there isn't as much traffic which makes for a more relaxing shopping experience. At the entrance of the market there is a bakery where you can buy Nepali style donuts, also there is a shop selling local snacks such as titaura(sweet-spicy dried fruit) and masala potato chips.

In May the touts are elsewhere and life around continues with the same agenda as it has for decades. Very interesting to wander around the lanes and courtyards. The various temples give atmosphere as does the palace complex and the old guys watching the world go by.
I was with my family and have a good experience with hygienic and testy food. They have very nice live music show with family environment .
I would not recommend this establishment based on my experience with incredibly rude and aggressive management.
Good music, atmosphere, pleasant people. Interesting concerts, and rare non smoking place in Kathmandu :)

Visited this restaurant for the first time with a friend and enjoyed the snacks and drinks. Nice place with lots of sitting spaces - great ambience, great service and hospitable staff. Loved their foods.

column7: Very good place and great service.
column8: I enjoyed the service and place but the food was bit above average, personally not very impressed but it tastes Just Good! The drinks were good and the whole environment was enjoyable.

Beautiful decor, charismatic, great food, excellent service and the back ground music, lovely girl genuine hospitality makes you feel more comfortable and Mahesh is the one, he knows what he’s doing, Highly recommended to visit at least once in your life

column7: Best place in Kathmandu to hang out!
column8: Fantastic food, interesting people, good service, acceptable prices and nice music...I loved it! Thank you!
worst ever restaurant experience with highly disappointing taste, price and service with added noisy intervention making it a surely bad decision to go.

Good place to chill with family. Enjoyed the live music with good foods. Property should improve time management for the food delivery. Overall the experience for me and my family was great. Thank you for the hospitality.

the place over here is really good and i have been visiting here for the best food to be served. since last few years ago this place was really awesome but now the food has changed a lot and as well as the service. you...More
Was an awesome dining experience with delicious cuisine mix with adorable service. Thank you for your great assistance.

column7: The food is not the highlight
column8: I am a vegetarian, so my take on this restaurant is coloured almost entirely by that lens.  I think what I liked about Tamarind was that the waiter took my vegetarian tastes seriously, and after talking to the kitchen, let me know that the veg Thai curries are not really vegetarian because some non-plant items are mixed in from the very start into the dish. The kitchen customized a vegetable curry dish, but did not use coconut or tamarind, so it ended up kind of bland. Pity. Oh, and the price they charged for going off-menu for such a bland dish was double the price on the Thai curries, so it was a bit ridiculous.  I also ordered a lemon with honey drink but that was not a hit with me either. The seating is nice - they have comfy pillows on all the booth seats. The non-stop sports highlights on the TV screen and the bar atmosphere don't add anything for me but the noise level was quite bearable.

went there for dinner and drinks... we chose open air seating... this place feels very spacious, they have got some beautiful fairy lights around....drinks menu was extensive and there were quite a few interesting cocktails to choose from.....there weren't many choices on the food menu though for vegetarians.....there is live music which which adds to the ambience.....its a good place for a nice quiet evening........ if you are looking for a cleaner, quieter lounge/bar do add tamarind to your list :) closes by 12:00 am.
it has always been a awesome experience to be in tamarind...yummy.....i m lovin it....food,ambience,people....incredibly fantastic...........

On our walking tour to Patan we found this wonderful little café far away from all the traffic. Lemonade, Ice-tea, cookies with peanut and a unique brownie made our day. Friendly employees. +++ clean restroom.
i really had great experience in Pink Salt Restaurant food was really great!!!! hope to visit again soon.

We have visited here several times over the past 6 months and we have never had a bad experience. Quite the opposite; the staff is very attentive, polite and friendly. The menu just keeps getting better and every dish, from appetizers to main courses to...More

I was stayed 12days at five14. it's really good experience there. good breakfast I enjoyed the breakfast,comfortable bed, good service, hot water for bath,free laundry. and I like their kairos cafe as well.

column7: The place to go for thukpa and momos with an interesting view
column8: Sit on the second floor - overlooking the edge of Patan Durbar square... lots to see. The food is very good... especially the momos and thukpa. Excellent waiters and staff. I highly suggest Casa Pagoda.
A rooftop restaurant in pagan durbar square is a perfect place to sit, eat and feel the time of medieval era looking at the normal local life.

column7: Excellently well staffed, exceptionally clean, fully secured big property in the heart of lalitpur
column8: I live in Chitwan but I frequently visit Kathmandu for work and to meet friends. I have stayed in almost all hotels in Kathmandu built before 2017. My experience in Shaligram started in 2017 when I first happened to stay there when I was told about the property by a friend. I have almost not stayed in any hotel in Kathmandu except Shaligram after 2017

We visited the restaurant for lunch in September 2019 and we greeted with a frosty reception. The nepalese food was bland and the staff unfriendly. I would not recommend this restaurant. There are many alternatives in the area.

column7: Much better option in the neighborhood
column8: My 2 nights at Cafe de patan weren't a nice experience at all! Their cheapest room (870 Npr a night) has a window overlooking the cafe. It was noisy and smelt cigarettes up until in the room. The first night people organised a private party with loud music on and the second night people chatted until past midnight. I was not told about this when I booked my room. There seem to have much better alternative options in the area.

I have many good experience at this resort, that is before the earthquake that destroyed the tower block. It is sad to see the whole tower block leveled after the quake and left empty. The resort is also showing its' age. Frankly it requires refreshing makeover. I was assigned a chalet where its heater/aircon unit was not working. The 7 degree night gave me little rest. Though they supplied a portable heater that blows hot air into the ceiling of a very large room, the room remained cold. I had to go to bed skipping my daily shower! Overall the property is still beautiful. But journey there through broken road is not pleasant and the aged rooms did not make the trip memorable.

column7: Worst experience in godavari village resort
column8: It has been the worst experience... hidden cost too much expensive for the facility they provide disgusting meal out dated n dirty foul smelling room n decor, manager not responding to complains.. highly not recommended to anyone....will give minus star

I'd say only the view was good! Ordered chocolate milkshake, lemon tea with honey and sikarni(wtf name). Had to throw everything. The staff doesnot have any knowledge about what the dish is about, absolute zero knowledge. Milkshake felt like a powdered drink. Sikarni, something I...More

excellent ambience, delicious food and wonderful presentation made our day. The roof top restraunt, gives a good view of the darbar square. Good hospitality. Keep it up, worth visiting again. This made us visit their other outlet at Boudhanath as well for dinner and we had a repeat experience
We went to Seeing Hands in late December 2019. It was small place but the massage was so excellent! Thank you for the detailed full body massage by Kushel! Support social enterprise.

While I can't give it five stars for some of the other reasons mentioned (facilities, bedding, etc.) I must say I had a good experience. Jima was able to diagnose my problem areas better than most other therapists I've had at other locations here and in the states. I love the cause and giving employment to those who in this society might otherwise be an outcast with no way to support themselves or their families.

It was a great experience. But keep in mind that you're not going to a high-end spa and therefor won't encounter the same amenities. Instead you support a project for people with disabilities and in exchange exit the venue completely relaxed.

I injured my lower back and the massage definitely helped. I wanted to give this a 5-star review, but can't for a few reasons.  Although the towels were clean, the cover on the neck pillow and the sheet under the towel felt clammy and weird, both being made of some awful synthetic stretchy stuff with obvious oil residue. No doubt they had been washed, but still. Also, the carpet in the treatment room was oily and awful. Carpets don't belong in massage rooms. The slippers in the bathroom were really oily and dusgusting.  Also, I asked before I came whether the girl giving the massage was experienced with sports injuries and was told that she was. However, she was a student and had only been giving massages for 1 year. She was really sweet and I did feel she did a good job of what she was trained to do, though, and to be fair, it definitely helped, so I can't complain on that level. However, some things she said gave me a strong impression that their training could be more complete. It was surprising that she had trouble understanding that I needed a wet towel to wipe down in order to avoid getting my clothes oily.  But it's a great initiative and I hope they keep expanding.

Two of us turned up just after lunch and got seen straight away. Staff were very professional and accommodating. We'd have preferred to both be massaged by women but there was only one male and one female working so be aware they may not be able to fulfil requests for a male/female masseuse. There is one massage table per room but they left a connecting door open at our request which helped me feel at ease.  Massage was really good and my masseuse checked in with me regularly to see how the pressure was. The price for 60 minutes was 1800 NPR (£13) which I thought was good value for the quality of the massage.

column7: Very good experience, definitely to repeat!
column8: I visited Seeing Hands in Lalitpur yesterday. I had been sick the days before and my body was sore all over, so I thought a massage could help. The place is in a nice neighbourhood and it's quite and clean, isolated from the noise and dust of the city. Ramji gave me a great massage of 60 min, he's a skilled and sensitive masseur and also a very friendly person! I definitely recommend the experience, and I will make it a regular appointment for myself!

I visited today for a 60min sports therapy massage. It was fabulous. I left feeling relaxed, lighter than air and my body felt like it did when I was about 10years younger! Worth every rupee. Swastika my masseuse was profesional, friendly and has the best hands I've encountered in Nepal 😊

I have been a regular customer at Seeing Hands Clinic in Laltipur for a couple of years, but have not been using TripAdvisor recently.  I have had massages from Ram and Swastika, and both are excellent. Ramji truly cares and worries about the state of my back, and his skills at making it feel better are unreal. I usually judge the quality of a massage by whether or not the masseur is able to find out where the pain is without asking - Ramji consistently delivers on this.  I have never had the relaxation massage, but the sports massage is probably the best therapeutic massage in town, and in 10+ visits I am yet to be disappointed.

I went for a sports massage to the Patan Seeing Hands, and Ramji did not disappoint. The clean room, Ramji's therapeutic touch and his friendliness made it a very good experience. I will certainly go back again.

Seeing Hands Clinic in Lalitpur was an excellent experience for me! I received a very good and highly professional massage! I can really recommend this place! And I will certainly enjoy it again! Thanks!
Absolutely wonderful, what an experience. Seeing Hands makes you feel so welcome and they are very good at what they do. thank you Ramji.

column7: Best massage I've ever had - far exceeded expectations!
column8: I visited Seeing Hands on my day off after a tiring few weeks of work, having found them on tripadvisor as I was staying near by. I arrived late at the end of the day, but Ramji held on for me to arrive and the experience was wonderful. I had a 90minute sports remedial massage - the first massage I've ever had that actually felt like it was doing something seriously good to my muscles and body! Ramji was so perceptive and talented. Also really great value. Sadly it was my last day in Kathmandu, otherwise I would be a regular. Thank you Seeing Hands, hope to be back one day - Alexandra, London

I first went to Ramji and Swastika when I was in Nepal a year ago. Their massages were so good that I regularly went to see them. Their proficiency is really remarkable, I haven't had any similar treatment elsewhere. But it is not only their excellent massages but also the people of the Seeing Hands Clinics in Nepal in general who are amazing. The idea of the project itself is really worth supporting! They became really good friends and we had many funny evenings together. A really big thank you and all the best for your future!
Great experience! I enjoyed an excellent massage, relieving me from bad backpains for many days. And Ramji and Swastika are just wonderful people to meet. Thanks again, looking forward to come back!

This was one of the best massages I have ever had! I had a 90 min sports remedial massage, and I feel incredible. Ramji was extremely perceptive and adaptive, making sure my experience was wonderful - thank you soo much!

column7: Great massage for loosening up a knotted back
column8: I had an excellent massage here from Ramji. I chose the Swedish massage for 90 minutes and it was great at un-knotting my back and shoulders. Ramji was careful to adjust the strength of the massage to the right level to combine power and relaxation. The place is clean and, for me, a good point is they don’t bother with the dolphin sounds or ethereal music. Instead we had an interesting chat.  Seeing Hands seems to have a nice model of formally training masseurs with proper skills and then opening up new clinics to employ them in.  The setting for the Patan clinic is peaceful on the top floor of a house set back from the road. The entrance is next to a Toyota showroom and there are some signs along the road.  It’s probably best to phone in advance to make an appointment.

Been going to Seeing Hands for a loooong time, because that is what real massages feel like rather than just rubbing oil all over you. After a stressful week or an intense trek, they just make all the pain go away. The masseurs themselves are genuinely welcoming, witty and interesting, having talked to them is a nice plus for the massages.

Great little spa, very good massage, great cause. If you're looking for a massage look no further. Unique experience. Rode there on my bike, safe area, tough to find at first but the gate has a sign by it.
One of the best massages I ever had. Very good experience. I can recommend 100%. Will arrange another appointment for sure!

Ramjis massage was exactly what i asked for: a deep back and shoulder massage. It was therapeutic, he was working hard to keep my muscle soft again. He is well trained, has a lot of experience and knows clearly what he is doing. He just works very professionally. I can highly suggest to go to seeing hands.This was not my last visit.

Our masseurs, the handsome Ramji and pretty Swastika were simply awesome! My wife, friend Ghaz and I thoroughly enjoyed the experience. My backpain is very much reduced now . We will definitely come back to see them in the future. Thanks guys!!!

After traveling for 2+ weeks, my back was killing me. Try as I might I could not find a chiropractor in Kathmandu. Fortunately, I packed pain killers and muscle relaxers, but they were only temporary fixes. With a day of sightseeing ahead of me, I thought I should start with a massage. Looking on Trip Advisor, Seeing Hands was the most highly recommended. However, that was not the determining factor. The fact that the massage therapists were blind led me to believe that that their other four senses, especially touch, would be particularly heightened, which would only enhance the massage experience. I was not wrong.  Seeing Hands has three locations; one, in Patan, was a five minute walk from the Himalaya Hotel where I was staying (Exit the hotel, cross the street and turn left. Go two blocks and turn right. Walk about 300 feet. The Norwegian Embassy is on the right, Seeing Hands is just up ahead on the left.) It also happened to be the newest location and the least expensive of the three. The facilities were immaculate, cleaner than my hotel.  I was met at the gate by Ramji, my massage therapist. His English was excellent. He asked me if I had any surgery, medical issues or pain that he should be aware of. I told him of my back problems, so he spent a lot of time on my back. He sense of touch was intuitive. He completely hit on the 3 pain points on my back, especially the two really sore ones. When I left, I was virtually pain free. Even now, eight hours after my massage, my back does not hurt.  Back in the U.S. a 90 minute massage is way out of my price range. Here I can not only afford one, I can afford one every other day. I already made an appoint for Tuesday.  I would unequivocally recommend this place for a solid deep tissue massage, especially with Ramji, although I am sure the others are great as well.  One thing that I would recommend for Seeing Hands, as a few others have mentioned, is to keep speaking to a minimum and have some soothing meditative music playing. That would elevate the relaxation experience to another level.

When I knew that I was to visit Nepal again, I immediately started looking forward to another massage with Ramji. And it was just as good as last time when I was there in February! He is skilled, professional, finds the nasty spots and works on them with different techniques. He uses as much pressure as I asked him for and made sure I stayed relaxed all the time and it didn’t hurt. He also didn't rush through some kind of standard treatment, but really did his best to help me relax in any way. I also appreciated that with Ramji you can either chat or enjoy the massage quietly (by the way his English is really good so it is easy to communicate). I have already fixed my next appointment – but you can also ask for a massage very spontaneously. I can very much recommend this experience to everybody.

I came to seeing hands clinic after I was very tired & my neck and shoulders was sored. I took 90 minutes deep tissue Massage. It was really wonderful. It made me fel great & my pain removed. Any body doing wants to be relaxed.  Mr. Ramji is the best for it.

Great time with the expert masseur Ramji. He adapted his massage according to my needs and did put the right pressure on my body, perfect to feel relaxed afetrwards. I went out with the feeling on being on a cloud. Ramji is really interesting and nice. I really recommend this place.

I've had many massages before but this one rates as the best.... I felt welcome from the moment I met my massage therapist- Swasi- as she made me comfortable and adjusted the pressure to my needs. I didn't even have to tell her as she was so intuitive and caring. Not only does she have seeing hands but healing hands- I felt like a new person and will be visiting regularly during my stay in Kathmandu. Come and see for yourself!

column7: I wish I could get this quality massage back home
column8: I had a massage in the Seeing Hands Clinic in Latipur (just opposite of the Royal Norwegian Embassy) with Ranji after working too much in a wrong position and some tiring travelling. When I walked down the road afterwards I felt as if I had grown by some inches and was slightly lifted off the ground, as he had managed to release my tensions by stretching and working hard on many a sore knot. I felt so much better! I would like to point out the professionally of the massage. According to my wishes he focussed on my back and neck during a 90 minutes massage but also found some nasty spots on my legs that I hadn't even been aware of but made a difference. I can confirm the experience that he found the very spot in my back that no other masseur had found before but had required repeated treatment by my physical therapist. He also gave me useful advice on further massages back home – but I doubt that I will find a similar quality and well-feeling there. I also appreciated that Ramji was adapted to all my wishes, whether I wanted to chat or keep quiet (by the way his English is really good so it is easy to communicate), whether I wished a lot of pressure or just little, etc. He didn't rush through some kind of standard treatment, but really did his best to help me relax in any way. I also never felt awkward to be massaged by a male masseur as he was very correct in any way (but usually a female masseur would also be available for females). The place is clean and quiet and there is a heater to keep you warm. So don’t miss this opportunity that is reasonably priced on top of all.

column7: Get ready for the best massage ever.
column8: I first heard of Seeing Hands when I was waiting to bungee jump off a suspension bridge in 2011. I made friends with a couple of German backpackers who had just finished a trek. They told me about this amazing massage they received in Kathmandu. I asked them for the name of the clinic and they told me all about Seeing Hands. I have had the privilege to visit their clinics in Kathmandu and in Pokhara. Both clinics were clean and the massages were incredible. During my last visit to Nepal in 2014 I had a chance to visit the new Lalitpur clinic... WOW. The first thing that I noticed about the new Seeing Hands clinic is how CLEAN it is. Tourists in Nepal resign themselves to spas that are not as clean as we would expect spas at home to be. The Seeing Hands Clinic is comparable in cleanliness to the spas here in Montreal. The only thing that is not comparable is the massage itself.... its even BETTER than the spas here. I have received massages on 5 continents and the massages I had at Seeing Hands are by far the best I ever had. They were supportive to my needs. After a trek, they were there to loosen up the knots. If I wanted a more relaxed massage, the obliged. I cannot recommend Seeing Hands enough. Give them a shot. You'll be back.

Just north of the square you will find this three story temple with some interesting wood carvings. It survived the earthquake but the top floor apparently toppled and has a slight lean. Worth a look.

column7: Heritage temple next to Darbar Square
column8: This is a UNESCO World heritage temple located next to the Darbar. I liked the crocodile faced water taps.

You have to walk through the narrow lanes of the inner old city of Patan to reach this place. You'll get to experience the old culture of Patan. All 3 cities of Kathmandu valley (i.e. Kathmandu, Patan, and Bhaktapur) oozes the old Nepal. A must visit.
Temple is accessible from a narrow lane next to durbar square and best to walk if one plans to visit. Can be seen is 10 minutes.

This kumbheswar Temple is situated in lalitpur 5minute walking distance from Mangalbajar. Temple is Shiv temple witin the compound of Banglamukhi temple the godess shivshakti. While we go around we filled peace of mind. An early celeberation in this temple is in the month of August every year. I really enjoy being around here. I recommend to visit this place to have uniqe experience.
big & impression. better to spend more time & hang around also interesting. must visit temple in Nepal

this is one of the only two 5 floors pagoda of Nepal. it dominates a large courtyard, rising from a not very high row of steps. it is dedicated to Lord Shiva ,silently workshipped as usual by the bull Nandi at the entrance. the woodcarving is impressive and elegant, the pool at the left is filled with water during a special festival (about july),when hundreds of jankris (shamans) gather here for praying and performing devotions during the night. a small shrine is taken in the center of the pool and unique rituals and plays are performed since very old ages. if you continue to turn left,you see a small shrine alwyas filled with water coming,as the legend says,from the holy lake of Gosaikunda. there are other small altars and statues,some very ancient,around the main pagoda ,and a Kali Mandir with a splendid altar with a masterpiece of silver decoration,but unfortunately the walls all around have been covered with white tiles,never cleaned,and the total effect is weird.

good opportunity to see a true religious life of Nepali people. Many saddhus and believers making offerings. Today much more clean, and a much more pleasant experience than a couple of years before. A must-see in Patan!
The temple was full of people carrying out various rituals and pujas. Candles, bells, colour and bustle. Interesting.

The owners are excellent hosts and the home-made food is superb (the fresh bread is a real treat). Room accommodations are comfortable and clean. The location is within walking distance of historical sites in Patan.

column7: Orchid Home for a wonderful stay in busy Kathmandu!
column8: We stayed 9 nights at Orchid Home. Orchid Home B&B is quietly located on short distance by bigger road. About 7 minutes walk from Orchid is a taxi stand and from there you can reach all places in Kathmandu. Every morning enjoy of a wonderful breakfast of eggs, freshly baked pastries and fruit. Owner and family are very guest friendly and helpful. Patan Durban Square, the Kathmandu Zoo and the luxurious Labim shopping mall possibly accessible by foot. Owner helpful with excursions, transportation and available as a guide. Airport shuttle service Orchid also perfect. Our experience is that Orchid is a fantastic place to stay for an attractive price.

Traveled with a group. Room had three beds, and we were two persons in the room. We shared bath and toilet facilities with other guests. Dinesh and family were great hosts, making sure to address any issues or needs that came up. Breakfast bread and coffee were superb! Place is quiet as it is not centrally located. You would have to walk about 5-7 minutes to place where taxis abound -- not too far. There are eating places about 10-15 minute walk away. This is a perfect place if you want quiet and great hosts. Wifi connection is strong. Go rooftop and listen to the morning sounds of birds. This worked very well for me because there were co-travelers to walk with and share the experience of discovery of place and culture with. If traveling alone, I would choose a place much more

column7: The beating heart of peaceful Patan Magic.
column8: Hi to everyone that's reading this! For me, Durbar guesthouse has been like a secret base camp for my Nepal travels. I've been selfishly keeping info of the place to myself & some other travellers with similar kind of interests. My motivation for this has been to do my own share of keeping bigger crowds away from the block. I've always liked peaceful & original places, compared to tourist ghettos in developing countries that ARE (arguably) ALWAYS THE SAME PLACE. Same crammed neon-coloured streets and campy manipulative hawkers in every corner trying to sell that So-Unique thing (shawl, shirt, tea, trekking stuff, drugs, rickshaw-ride, you name it) with the special price Just-For-You. All stuff so-like-back-home (Why your'e traveling in the first place dude??) & comfy to pamper

Well I was so exicted to visit bota momo on kaushaltar brach which is newly opened. I went there with my friends and saw the menu list and found the price way beyond the par but still I was expecting wow taste. I like self...More

This restaurant serves you simplified but various choice of momo. This restaurant creates a great opportunities to have momo experience under one room with all the choices you do required. Sauses with multiple choice and ambience are the key attraction for you to explore a friendly and family environment. I have visited more than 5 times and found very consistancy in taste and service. Very good outlet chain in kathmandu valley.

column7: Simply not a place for momo lovers.
column8: Mo:mo - although a Tibetan cuisine - has found its way deep into Nepali hearts. And, when families go out for lunch, one food that's always on the table is mo:mo. For the typical Nepali, a plate of good mo:mo with tasty 'achar' makes lunch (or even dinner) perfect. Having said all that, Bota - a restaurant specializing in mo:mo disappoints.  1. It is definitely not a quite place to enjoy your lunch, the constant sounds for tokens and all. Really, what's the use of having so many people working there? Pay-first is okay but I'd love to have my lunch (in midst of a hectic day) in a quite place.  2. Where's my achar? Now, Bota interestingly has countless pickles (or achars). Countless. Try this, try that. But, amazingly, the restaurant hasn't found the right achar that should go with the mo:mo. Give me one proper 'achar' and I'll be happy.  3. A bad experience: I ordered and paid for veg bara but I was served chicken bara. Well, if you think I was lucky, I don't eat chicken and it doesn't feel great to find out your bara wasn't veg bara after taking a bite.  4. For a pay-first, self-service, queue-up place with mo:mo and other variety food, the place is pricey. Definitely not worth the money you pay for.  This is all about Kamalpokhari Bota.

column7: The best way to experience Patan!
column8: This was my first time doing a homestay in Nepal, and I count myself very lucky for having made this choice. My stay with the Shakya family made all the difference in my experience of this city. They are a kind and caring family that do everything they can to facilitate your stay with them and your experience of their city. For example, I have some unusual dietary restrictions and was concerned about having them accommodated, but they have had absolutely no problem observing those restrictions (their cooking is fantastic, by the way!). Furthermore, they took account of my interests in Buddhist art and history and connected me to members of the community who could speak to those interests -- needless to say, I learned a lot! If you want to experience contemporary local Patan

column7: Stay here for a more authentic, local experience.
column8: The stay in the homestay is a whole different and unique experience. You get to experience living in a local home, interacting with the local, learning how to cook the dishes and eating the way locals eat, definitely priceless. My host and her family are very accomodating, I can't thank them enough for taking such a good care of me. And, Patan is a great place away from the hustle and bustle of Kathmandu. I truly enjoy my stay in Patan Community Homestay.

Every time when I plan a family trip, I would like my family to experience local livings. There is no exception for this trip to Nepal. And yes, I had this here in Patan Community Homestay. It is no doubt that the Shakyas took us very well whole day long with 3 delicious Newari meals and rooms with cultural characteristics. But the most important is the interactions between children of the two families. I believe it will be an unforgettable experience for both of us!

Great value for money - I can stay there forever! It's simple but it's got everything I needed - spacious room, comfortable bed, effective heater, hot water, a well-equipped shared kitchen, unlimited drinking water supply, etc. My favorite part is the hosts' hospitality! They helped me with taxi arrangements and provided me travel tips. The location is also prime - close to everything but a block away so it's quiet. I liked the lovely balconies as well. The driving route google maps suggest from the airport to the guest house is not very accurate. The last part of the suggested route is actually too narrow for a taxi to pass so my driver had to ask around to find an alternative way. Maybe guide the taxi to Patan Dhoka (a white gate) and go from there.

column7: The people and place both feels like I'm living with my family in my home.
column8: Cozy rooms, good ambience and good people with a cafe. The surrounding is really interesting with typical newari culture, architecture and temples, Walking distance about two hundred meters from Patan durbar square.

I can simply say about this Guest House is, SIMPLE, CLASSIC, ANTIQUE AND HOMELY ENVIRONNMENT. Classic and treditional furniture and the equipment inside the room are the most impressive parts of the Guest Hotel and since this Guest House is situated in the middle of the local community, I felt like I am staying at my relatives not in a hotel.

column7: Great for short or long stay
column8: This is a great place to stay in Kathmandu for either short or longer stays; you can negotiate good rates for longer stays. The area is relatively quiet and clean, plenty of low-cost local food options nearby as well as flasher restaurants. The rooms are very comfortable, competitively priced and MUCH better value for money than places around Thamel and other tourist areas. It only costs ~ $4 for taxi into tourist heart of town, and ~ 10-20cents on buses.So its worth getting away from Thamel. Black Pepper is in Patan which is much more culturally interesting than Kathmandu central anyway. The staff are very friendly and helpful. There is a generator and battery system so the daily 'load shedding' isn't too inconvenient. The guesthouse is in 'Friends Colony' which is sort of

Cannot Recommend Enough. This is a lovely place with very welcoming owners and staff. The rooms are spacious and clean and has got a nice rustic touch. Very reasonably priced given what you get. In addition, there's a lovely cafe on the ground floor that serves delicious food and beverages. Truly felt like a home away from home. I guess that's why the place is named Indsu Home. Once Again, Highly Highly Recommended.

Felt like home and the service is just excellent. People are very welcoming there. The food is too good. And the room interiors out there is just what reminds of Nepali tradition. Will surely visit again!

Here’s my heartfelt appreciation to the team of the patan house. It was my first visit to their newly renovated traditional Newawi house. But actual it was a modish boutique hotel with all (just right) amenities. It was randomly found at the Airbnb, but never thought of their genuine services in these days. I was touched by their authentic hospitality, I feel safe and comfortable with their 24/7 reception, for me that’s really something extra to find in Kathmandu. It was a truly joyous hotel experience. I received a very lovely breakfast every morning, nice gestures from housekeeping, is everyone have good manners from their hearts. Frankly, beautiful house with beautiful spirits! Thank you again to Santosh and Arina for all your thoughtfulness and genuineness during my stays

Comfortable and cosy stay in a very well renovated old traditional house. The property gives you a feeling of living back in time with all modern amenities. This unique place is a perfect location to explore as it's only a stone's throw away from Patan Durbar Square. The house is a traditional Newari house and very beautiful, the staff is friendly and helpful and the rooms clean and spacious.The restrooms are exceptionally big and good, a surprise when you look at the building. If you love to live within a traditional surrounding with local, this is going to be a great place. The hosts are great.

column7: Ring The Bell If You Were Unhappy
column8: The bell sits opposite the palace on two stout pillars and was erected in 1736 to allow the peasants to tell the king, by ringing his bell that they were not happy. An email may have been more private but good on King Vishnu Mala for providing the facility although no one has said whether he listened. He created an interesting relic of the past.

column7: the bell that makes you feel
column8: as soon as you reach patan durbar suare you will see the big bell hanging out. when you see the bell you will know that you have reached patan durbar square to explore more.

Interesting monument in Patan. Opposite the Royal Palace is a huge, ancient bell, hanging between two stout pillars, erected by King Vishnu Malla in 1736. Used to alert the king by general public for their grievances, and for various warnings.

column7: A place to stop for food while shopping
column8: I had a great experience here. Not too wide range of food, which I like and which is a sign for me that they know what they do, they do it good and fast. I had some coconut curry with rice, my boyfriend similar. Both...More

I picked the wrong day for lunch. There was a large group on another table of 10 or so. And very slow service. If you like rice you better order 2 servings as the serving size is small. The Chicken Massaman Curry was almost devoid...More

We went to mango chili last night for dinner and we loved it. We had ordered food from their new family dinner set , which was value for money. It had everything from Starters , salad , soup and mains. It was as our first Thai experience and enjoyed to the fullest. Surprised to see such a fast service as we didn’t had to wait long for our food to arrive. The staffs are well trained and friendly. Will definitely give a second visit

I heard about this restaurant from my friends and went there for dinner.I was blown away by their food. Matches our nepali palate. Been to other Thai restaurants here in the valley but this stand out to be in the top. they have great variety of food to choose. Best part of their menu is that they have indicated the spice level.  As my friend recomended me about this restaurant I would like to recommend this restaurant to every one and try their food and experience their hospitality.

I don't think we can find a retro like mango chill even in Thailand.I bet Ramsay Gordon would rate it 5 star lol. I would highly recommend people to try this place not just once but twice, thrice and more cause it keeps updating. New dish keeps getting added in the menu. All credit to the chef and the crew members.

This is my first visit to the any thai restaurant, coz i am not fond of thai cuisine, i ordered Roasted chicken, panfried fish, red curry with rice and omlette along with tom yom soup. i liked all their foods. their wide variety of non alcoholic beverage is also awesome. mango tango and virgin pain killer is a must try. i am very much please with the quality of their foods and service.

Such an amazing experience at this spa in the heart of Kathmandu. One location of several within Kathmandu we decided upon Thado Dhunga. It was a hidden gem and retreat. The facilities are exceptional, decor immaculate and massage incredible. I had a 60 minute neck, shoulders and back massage, followed by sauna. I can say I have walked away feeling like I am floating on clouds. Being a fussy person about massage, I definitely give this five stars!

My experience was great. I visited Kinjjala Spa in search of an acupuncture specialist. I was having a little pain in my knee from a pre-existing injury. I visited Dr. Kailash for 5 sessions and My knee felt much better! Also, the rest of the staff was great as well. The facility was clean, holistic, and relaxing. There tea is amazing also. I would highly recommend visiting this location while staying in Kathmandu.

column7: Therapeutic experience for soul and body
column8: I had an outstanding experience at Kinjjala Spa. Even though I came in quite late in the evening and without an appointment, I was not refused to take a 90min remedial massage. The spa is just truly peaceful and calming, perfect to let go of the hustle and bustle in the city. The service had been terrific. I was offered herbal tea when I arrived and was given time to just arrive and choose mindfully what I really wanted. I was asked what kind of pressure I'd prefer as well as if there are any pains or injuries they should pay attention to. The massage itself was amazing and the therapeut was definetly very well trained and experienced. She did an excellent job in releasing the stress in my thightend hips and the lower back pain. I felt like I was reborn after this massage. Having had many massages in different places (outside of Nepal though) before, I can actually say that this was so far my best. I also liked that the massage therapist kept on checking in whether or not everything was ok or if she was applying the pressure according to my preference.All in all, this was a truly rejuvenating exprierence and friends complimented me even days after how refreshed I looked. Even though this may be for some a pricier option among other offers in Kathmandu, it's more than worth it!

This was a very nice experience. Somebody picked me up from the hotel to bring me to the Spa. After a short talk about my whishes of the treatment a got a very nice massage and a very good pedicure treatment. I felt totally relaxt afterwards. The Spa is very clean, well designed and everyone is very friendly and a good professional! Really worth going to!!
Highly recommended!! Thoroughly enjoyed the sessions. Therapists are friendly and well trained. Very unique place and we'll kept.

We got a massage in a random spa in thamel, the experience was like being in an Iraqi torture chamber. Then we found this place in a quiet part of Patan (there's actually a quiet part!). It was amazing 👌

column7: Professional World Class Services and Staff
column8: I've been coming and going from Kathmandu for 3 years now and have never found a spa to rival Kinjjala, it will forever more be my one-and-only spa and beauty stop in the city: professional, well-trained staff, exceptional service offerings at a very reasonable price, high-quality products, a beautiful uncommonly well-kept facility that is also very clean and well-equipped. I spent many hours over 2 days there and was amazed at not only how thoroughly I enjoyed it, but how effective the treatments proved. My hair especially has been transformed from the L'Oreal Hair Spa and Herbal Onion Seed Oil they generously gifted me, the brow threading and facial was first-class, the mani/pedi and Aryuvedic massage and waxing (strip wax only) all also excellent.  With experience in beauty spas and massage parlors across the city, I'm confident that Kinjjala is the one of if not the best and competitive with any 5-star hotel in town. You should go.

column7: High class holistic centre in a warm cosy environment!
column8: We loved Kinjala spa and the overall experience! without the noise of big and luxury hotels, but in a warm cosy environment, Kinjala provides everything you need to relax and recharge! The staff is very friendly with experience in holistic therapies, and they make sure you leave rejuvenated with a big smile! Thank you for your wonderful energy!

Kinjjala spa is a calm oasis in the bustle of Jhamsikhel with excellent facilities and services for reasonable prices. Having spent 3 weeks in the villages doing research, what I needed was a deep tissue massage to loosen up my back and Manisha did a great job. I can away feeling lighter and much more relaxed. A warm welcome from Srijana also makes this place really wonderful. I recommend highly.

column7: Super post trekking massage. really nice relaxing experience
column8: Super post trekking massage. really nice relaxing experience in well set up premises. Thanks very much

This spa is incredible and is such a lovely calm, relaxing spot following the noise and chaos of the rest of Kathmandu. Communication was fantastic in advance. The owner offered to pick me up from my hotel but I chose to walk. The spa is very clean and the services are well priced. I was served delicious herbal tea before my treatment. I had the most incredible pedicure (the lady who did it was so meticulous that she focused on every toe for about 10mins each). I was so impressed. Then I had a facial which was lovely. Again, the owners offered to drop me back to my hotel but I opted to walk to find dinner. I can't recommend this spa enough - lovely people, unbelievably clean, beautiful products, quiet and peaceful and good value. Try it!

Spent a total of 2 days at the spa as the service and staff were brilliant. If you are looking for a clean, hygienic and professional spa experience, Kinjjala Spa is the place to visit. Took my parents here as well and they were treated royally. Ended up buying a annual package for them as was sure they would be well taken care of even in my absence.

I did a 90 minute massage and it was an amazing experience. The space is very clean and comfortable and the staff are very nice and professional. They even picked me up and drop me at my hotel. I would recommend this spa to everybody.

A friend recommended the spa when I asked for a recommendation. It was a wonderful experience. Started with a period in the sauna and then a 90-minute trekker's massage. Sometimes intense muscle work coupled with relaxing and soothing oils. Felt very relaxed and refreshed. Recommend it for anyone who's been in the mountains.

If you are in Patan and find yourself in need of relaxation or renewal — or if you just need a break, you owe it to yourself to visit Kinjjala spa. I visited the location on Jhamsikhel road, which I found very easy to locate and access. The grounds are very nice and parking is available. The facilities are nicely designed, very clean, and well maintained. Air conditioning is available for the hot summer months. The massage room was very relaxing with minimal lighting and a very comfortable massage table. The service was fantastic. So much so that I returned for a second visit during my short stay in Patan. I booked a 60-minute aromatherapy massage for the first visit and a 90-minute ayurvedic massage on my second. In both cases, the massage was amazing, but I'd recommend going for at least 90 minutes if you have the time. My wife also booked a facial which she found very enjoyable. The staff was very curteous, professional, and welcoming. Highest recommendation.

column7: One part of a huge site.
column8: This is an amazing site and only one small part of the huge Durbar Marg. To see itall you need several hours but it is really worth it to immerse yourself in the local culture and religion. A truly wonderful experience.

I didn't saw Bhinchhebahal in tourist map of Patan. I was looking for stone carving locals and landed up in this open place surrounded by 60 houses. Clean open area, two water well, Buddha temple on middle, chaityas around, the place was amazing and really felt happy. It was 7 minutes walk from Patan Sundhara. A must visit in Patan.

Machhendranath Temple was largely destroyed by the Earthquake that hit Nepal just over a year ago. We came here to visit and see just what was left, and also to make a side trip to the nearby Karyabnayak Temple as-well. The feeling of being the only two visitors to the large open square, Villagers herding their ducks and goats through the old temple grounds actually added to the experience. I have always been a big archeology fan, so ruins excite me. These are relatively new, caused by a natural disaster, not time, although the original temples were in the 6-700 year old range. Visiting here is more of an exploration into the past. If a bunch of broken stones doesn't excite you much, I would skip this site. There's a lot of history , hundreds of small temples in the Kathmandu valley to explore. Most of the old shops and restaurants are gone, there is still one wood carver left here, turning out some beautiful HIndu and Bhuddist Statuary out of ancient pieces of wood that he imports from the Langtang region of Nepal. Worth the trip just to visit his shop.

The building of the chariot to carry the small red god in is an attraction on it own - taking about 1 month to complete. Rato Machindranath's temple is usually in Bungamati but it was destroyed in the earthquake. Now Rato resides in Patan. The rath, or chariot is pulled to various spots in patan according to tradition and only moves when the priests say it is time. People come every day to worship the god and give presents to him - often for fertility. This is an 800+ year old tradition that makes Nepal such a special place. There is no charge to see the chariot and experience a traditional event.
Rudra Barna Mahavihar is very artistic and unique Vihar in Lalitpur. You will mesmerize by the statue and art made in here. The vihar is very different that other hundreds of vihar in Patan.

We found this to be a stunning Buddhist temple with plenty of golden ornamentation.Pleasant too because it's off the tourist trail. Observed a monk doing a ritual-very interesting.The doorway into the temple of the Bihar type,led our eyes to an amazing image of a highly decorated & dressed Buddah. Located within walking distance of Patan's Durbar Square.

Just a short walk from the Patan Durbar square, the Rudhavarna Mahavihara is an interesting detour. There is an entry fee of NPR 30 (for SAARC nationals). However, this same ticket is valid for the Mahabuddha Temple too. Both these shrines are nearby each other. After visiting the inside of the Rudravarna Mahavihara, do pass through the small doorway at the left and visit the small Stupa behind the Vihara.

column7: So great Temple !! You must visit
column8: This is one where the King supported to build and practiced Buddhism here. Therefore so many beautiful things you must see. After all, a temple supported by King is very unique.

The 4 Ashoka Stupas are a remarkable feature of Buddhist architecture in Patan. Lagan Thura Stupa to the south is the largest. Recently a miniature cenotaph was added. Teta Thura Stupa to the east has fire Vedica with one Tathagata in each direction. The dome is paved with firebrick. There are three stone inscriptions which are severely damaged. Pucho Thura Stupa to the west has firebrick Vedika with one Tathagata in each direction. The dome is also paved with firebrick. The thirteen Cakravalis [rings] are constructed directly over the dome in a square shaped pyramid. An inscription reveals that the Tathagatas were in place in the 14th cent. Ibahi Thura Stupa to the north is nearly circular. It has 5 Buddha in the Vedika with their consorts except the Tathagata Vairocana. A square Harmika is constructed over the dome with 13 steps Cakravali and a parasol.

column7: The Western Stupa is quite interesting.
column8: Started my tour of Patan at the Western Stupa. It is relatively small but the dome is completely grassed over so that it looks like a small hill! Only the top of the stupa can be seen. This is one of 4 stupas (called the Ashokan Stupas) which mark the 4 cardinal points of Patan (which is the oldest city in the Kathmandu Valley). As you walk in to the city towards Durbar Square - you pass the pay point for the city (Rp 1500/person/day - but you can get an extension to cover more than 1 day).

column7: Lovely garden dining experience just off Durbar Square
column8: Exploring Durbar Patan Marg with my friend who lives in Kathmandu and she suggested lunch at Yala which is a place her family loves. Yes it has some galleries with a variety of art and clothing and such but the garden restaurant Is really nice. Had lunch and enjoyed chicken momos (they had run out of veg), some interesting deep fried corn kernels and veggie nachos. Plus a ‘Yala mule’ which is like a margarita but with this homemade booze called ‘aila’ but pronounced ‘oila’. Staff were 100 percent amazing and helpful and overall a great place to enjoy a lazy afternoon lunch!

column7: Quiet garden, great cheesecake and wines!
column8: A great stop while in Patan, this café restaurant will delight you with a beautiful garden, intimate and quiet enough, located two steps away from Patan Durbaf Square. Simple minimalistic design, attentive staff, good food and drink options too. A little pricey but I enjoyed my meal there. I tried the vegan carbonara and the cheesecake. The dessert was creamy, tasty, not overly sweet, reminding me of my mum's Easter cake. However, the pasta was a bit of a disappointment... the pasta was perfectly cooked Al dente but the creative attempt to veganise the sauce was killed by the use of mushroom stock cubes... What a pity! I would have appreciated simple flavours from natural herbs and mushrooms and not powdered flavour, which leaves your mouth dry and makes you terribly thirsty for hours afterwards. Otherwise, all good and the wine by the glass is also very well chosen. I could maybe give it another try, possibly other dishes rely more on natural ingredients.

column7: A secret garden you don’t want to miss
column8: We came here with a large group of friends and brought our young toddler along. Dining at Yala is fun, relaxing, and the food doesn’t disappoint!  First off, the courtyard “garden” is the perfect setting to escape the busy and noisy streets. The thick and lush greeneries will make you forget that a cloud of dust is only a few meters away.
