It’s serene and peaceful.  We ordered the Newari lunch with the chicken curry. The dish came with rice, lentil soup, and a variety of veggies and pickles. Presentation is too notch and the flavors truly delivers. I can not recommend the dish enough!  To top off your experience, the service is great. The owner was very friendly and recommended a few local restaurants around the Patan area. We really appreciated it!  Attached to the restaurant is a small store that sells a variety of locally made craft goods. Everything from pashmina, pottery, and jewelry.  Definitely coming back!

When atmosphere, service and food are excellent, only listening to the imaginative and foresightful Founder's purposeful planning could round off this experience. Indeed knowing the heartfelt and yet scientific labour that went into creating this restaurant cum cultural venue made it a wonderful way to top off our group of 7's final dinner.

After 6 years of living in Nepal we were preparing to leave Nepal. We needed a place to transition. Traditional Stay was perfect, and we were there for three weeks. The hotel rooms were very comfortable and well appointed. The manager, front of staff, Chefs and all other staff, were absolutely fantastic. They were accomodating to our needs, they even put on a special wedding anniversary meal. They made sure our stay was warm, friendly and tried to meet our every need. The chefs are enthusiastic and dedicated to good wholesome food, and one of the meals showcased a fusion of authentic nepali food with a western presentation. We left feeling that we had left behind some of 'our family'. A wonderful experience and would highly recommend this hotel to anyone.

column7: What a wonderful Hotel in a fantastic location.
column8: Arrived at this Hotel in February 2020.Where I was truly greeted by some amazing receptionist staff. This hotel is relatively new and it showed this, with its freshness, all mod cons with its exceptional staff. The manager Rajesh was most helpful and did not mind doing things a little different than others, which was helpful to me. The cleanliness of the hotel was excellent and my room was one of the best that I had ever stayed in. Its location was absolutely the world's best. You are a two minute walk from Patan, where I was given a free entrance pass to the beautiful sights of Patan, courtesy of the Traditional Stay Hotel, with my stay here. The very best goes to the staff, who assist this modern hotel to meet the comforts of this guest .... Thank you.

My overall experience at this hotel was wonderful. From the rooms being so tidy, clean and organised to the staff, who are so helpful and friendly. Always felt so welcome coming in the hotel. Location is good, walking distance to the square. I would definitely recommend this hotel to my friends and family!

It's one of the my best and special hotel experience I've ever had. Great hospitality and warm welcome right from the start. All of the staff are very friendly and helpful. Perfect breakfast at their nice terras, lovely garden (they offer you fresh fruits and juices :) ), very large, clean, well-decorated room in a traditional way, free-pick up service,restful atmosphere, great location and of course an excellent family member's of Panday's Paradise around you. What else does a man expect? :)) We enjoyed our stay in Panday's Guesthouse so much. It's certainly more than a guest-house, it is a sincere family-house. Really you feel yourself like at your own home. Special thanks to owner; dear Tethys and kind receptionist lady; dear Sangila. If you're looking for a nice place in

column7: Fantastic experience as for the first time visiting Nepal!
column8: Amazing small hotel. Very charming and kept in traditional style. Friendly staff and amazing location. Very close to the square, cafes, restaurants and all necessary spots to visit. We had amazing 3 nights, feeling welcomed and comfortable.

This small clean hotel could do with a lick of paint but it is clean comfortable with helpful staff. Don't stay out too late the main gate was locked by 23.30hrs. The food is good but it can be an interesting interpretation of European/American classics.

After a thorough 3-month search through hundreds of hotels/guest houses in the Kathmandu area to host very special adoption family reunion, we finally landed on Summerhill House in Lalitpur. I cannot say enough great things about this peaceful get-away in the heart of such a busy city! Beginning with the warm and wonderful owners of these beautiful Newari style inns, it only gets better with the excellent service, ideal location, added services (touring and transportation as needed) and lovely rooms - including common space for hanging out and relaxing. And, let's not forget the delicious Nepali cooking, the brand new yoga studio and a guarded, gated entrance! It was the perfect place for us, and for anyone looking for a traditional, yet modern, Nepali experience. I highly

I had the pleasure of staying at Summerhill House on three separate occasions in October 2017. The location in Jawalakhel is just perfect - quirt with a beautiful garden and still within 10 minutes walk to all the new restaurants, cafes and shops in Jawalakhel, which is very fast becoming a good alternative to Thamel. Summerhill House is very well managed - the rooms are spacious, comfortable and clean, and the restaurant is serving an excellent breakfast. The management and staff are very helpful and serviceminded. A perfect place to stay in Kathmandu and excellent value for money.

It's a fairly simple budget guest house, though certainly not at the very bottom of the range. Rajinder and Ruth as so friendly, helpful and welcoming, I just didn't want to leave. I feel that they are friends I want to keep in touch with. There's a nice garden, and you can cook for yourself in the kitchen if you like. The guest house is neat and clean and well-maintained. Ruth is Swiss so they have an excellent understanding of what foreigners appreciate in a guest house. I can't say enough good things about them. The location is quiet and away from the hustle and bustle, yet within easy walking distance of some good restaurants.

This hotel is right in Patan Durbar Square, you can almost touch the temples from your window. The rooms were clean and well priced (1000 bargained to 800) for a double room with a shared bathroom. This is such an interesting part of Kathmandu to stay in with less tourists but all the attractions. The best part was sitting in the square at night watching everything going on. Such a good vibe!

Location, location, location ! it is the golden rule of any business and certainly for the Yala Guest House, sitting right in Patan Durbar Square. The only option to be closer to the square is to sleep on its floor. You can almost touch the pagodas from your window. And you are just few steps away from all the other interesting walks around Patan. I climbed to the roof top terrace to get a stunning view of the square and its life. The gust house is an old ordinary building. The recent renovation of the facade could certainly have been less modernist. However, if you like to stay in an ancient house renovated to excellent taste and functionality respecting all the esthetic codes, this is not your fancy place: you got to fork out a bigger wad of cash just few blocks north of the

I have been frequent user of the restaurant for one year specifically lunch. The food is tasty and clean, the service is fast and friendly and the cost is reasonable. I enjoyed very much and wish to visit again if I come back to Kathmandu....More

I was recently at Embers with my friends to watch the France vs Uruguay World Cup match and it was a great experience. As we watched the match on the big screen, we were served really tasty food. Don't miss the pork items here, especially...More

Excellent ambience, food and service. I would recommend Embers to anyone who is looking for something different when planning a dinner, a business meeting or an event. The staff is very well trained and caters to your individual needs consistently. One of the best restaurants in Kathmandu!!

column7: Good food but expensive and lacking service
column8: We've dined at Embers and really enjoyed our meals - the Thali & the Mezze platter as well as desserts from Crave next door. Food was yum and filled us but the service was lacking...they stated their lassi was 150r but on the bill it showed 205r and they wouldn't change this...one dessert was 150r and the other was 250r + service charge + tax even though they are the same price next door at Crave - they would not explain why and would not change the price. We felt like our business was not important. We will return to Crave and possibly to Embers, but we know there are places we are much more respected in the city.

column7: Go once and you'll keep returning!
column8: I have been here multiple times since my first vist earlier this summer. The menu is interesting if a tad bit overpriced (but hey it's worth it!!). The facility is well maintained and neat.The ambience is superb, especially in the evenings. Only issue can be with finding a parking if you are taking your own vehicle.

column7: Cool place to eat and dine
column8: I liked the ambience very much specially when I was there during rainy day. It looked so good and I felt so fresh. A cup of coffee in a rainy day makes your mood.

Good food. A really family place.The atmosphere is pretty nice and clean. Must try taste of Duck breast with Orange and Raisin sauce and Crispy Tangy Potato, delicious cheese cake . If you smoke, try to get experience of different flavors of HOOKAH !!!

Had an amazing experience staying here.The food was amazing and so was the staff and managment,very close to the market and raxi service is also available ,would recomend when travelling to kathmandu.

I have been to this hotel number of times and most recently in December. This is huge property with an extended wing to accommodate more people. They have big conference room and perfect for holding big meetings and events. Rooms are nice and well maintained. Required and good quality of amenities are part of it. However, I see there is enough room for improvement in the food quality, especially for meeting/conference packages.

I lived at Peace Guest House with a friend for eight months in 2015, and by and large had a great time. Kalpa and has family are unspeakably lovely and welcoming: better landlords truly could not be hoped for. Many times we were invited to join them for a meal or brought a snack by "Grandma", and Kalpa was very attentive to any problems we had and usually dealt with them promptly. The second story (which we leased) boasts lots of natural light, there are bathrooms everywhere, the views of Kathmandu are gorgeous (especially from the roof), and there is just enough furniture to live comfortably. The constant traffic noises typical of Kathmandu barely reach the apartment, but it's also worth noting that the windows do not seal well, meaning night time dog barking wars and

I stayed 3 months at Peace Guesthouse. It's more of a homestay, really. Which is a good thing. The family who runs the place is incredibly hospitable, always up for a nice chat in the evenings and exceptionally helpful. The rooms are fairly big and well furnished. There is a communal kitchen, the shower has a gas heater, backup power and wifi. All for a very, very reasonable price. It is a very "Nepal experience", though. So you might occasionally experience some of the annoyments that Nepalese people have to face, say water shortage or a breaking internet connection. Leela and her family will give their best to come up with a solution at any circumstances, though. As we had problems with the well, for example, they brought warm water for a bucket shower up to my bathroom. I

column7: Great place for a long term stay
column8: We stayed at Peace Guest House for two months and it was excellent. Leela and Kalpa are extremely helpful and welcoming. They are respectful of your privacy and personal space, at the same time as they welcome you into their home. The location (close to the Tibetan refugee camp) was great for us, as it was very close to our work, but also walking distance from shops, restaurants and cafes in Kupondole and Pulchowk. If I return to Nepal, I would absolutely stay again at Peace House!

This beautiful handcrafted design store is just few meters away from Patan Durbar Square. They have interesting and unique home decor and accessories with master in details and craftsmanship. A perfect gift for your home. Definitely must visit place to go when you are looking for something beautiful and change in Kathmandu!

column7: Unique, contemporary designs made with traditional craftsmanship
column8: A soothing oasis in a chaotic neighborhood of Patan. One can browse for hours and listen to the story behind each of their beautiful products. Their hammered copper collection is a must see. Charming, friendly people you can enjoy a conversation with over a cup of amazing coffee. Bring a friend to enjoy the Nepali strategy game of Bagchal with. I always leave feeling inspired.

Back in September, I visited this property for my business and academic purpose. The overall environment was peaceful and warm with warm hospitality. Specially Krishna Dai who took care of me throughout my stay without him the stay would not have been smooth. Thank you for the amazing experience.

I had a wonderful experience at Cozy Home Bed and Breakfast. Every staff member I encountered were extremely delightful and happy to help. The rooms were very comfortable and cozy plus the food gave a feeling of love and care. Had a great stay here. Will definitely recommend this place to others.

The hotel is situated in the middle of primaeval city Patan. Patan Durbar Square is one of the three Durbar Squares in the Kathmandu valley all of which are Unesco World Heritage Sites. The hotel is quiet and situated near to numerous local restaurants.The main attraction is the ancient royal palace where the Malla kings of Patan resided. The hotel has roof top restaurant from where you can view the royal palace. The hotel is in great location. Wonderful experience. Good hospitality. Thank you hotel for special " MOMO".

column7: Best thing in the restaurant is the way out
column8: Worst experience in Nepal. Nasty place, very dirty, bad service. Could bare the smell of the food. To be strongly avoided. Seems to be nice at the first glance, but it is bad choice. Not comments on the toilets (OMG)

"A truly exceptional dining experience from start to finish. Every dish was incredibly well executed with precision of presentation and flavor. Everything tastes as it should - at its very best.This visit to Restaurant Divine Taste Restro will live long in my memory just like...More

column7: The place to just take in the sights of a bye gone era
column8: Unfortunately while Kathmandu has interesting sights it is has also become very crowded, congested and polluted. In that regard Patan is undoubtedly one of the nearby cities to getaway from all the dust and noise. You can spend a whole day exploring this medieval city and its heritage architectural sights or just sit back and wath the world go by...

Om handicrafts is different than other places that sell singing bowls. All of their bowls are handcrafted with different precious metals. Their hospitality is the best. They don't just sell their bowls, but also provide a demonstration of a short therapy session, that will resonate with your soul. Highly recommended!

column7: Lovely experience, but remember they are trying to sell you a bowl!
column8: The people here are very nice. They explain how the bowls are made and of course how their's is better than everyone else! The sales pitch is not heavy and I left mum to do all the work. I sat and watched the life going on around the place. But beware, they have jewellery also! Understand, you will end up paying something like $375 for a nice bowl and it is unique, so we went with the flow. Nice place, but you are here to be sold a bowl! Recommend

This fair trade store has an amazing selection of scarves and jewelry but the real stars are the top quality singing bowls. We've purchased several bowls that are far superior to the ones on the street. The demonstration of the singing bowls is interesting and educational.
Purchased a "Full Moon" bowl after an interesting demonstration. Staff was helpful in choosing the right bowl.

We actually stayed in the apartments about the Handicrafts store. But the experience we had in Kathmandu was made better because out this place. We found this apartment on AirBNB.  The Handicrafts store is beautiful. They sell singing bowls and timshels. Manoj and his crew will take all the time that is necessary to ensure you get the proper bowl for your needs. They also instruct on its use.  The employees are all very kind and sincere. The store is clean and nice. Located very near Patan Square, it is a nice escape from the craziness outside.

column7: Western Prices and maybe Western product standard
column8: So I had read about this place on Tripadvisor and decided I wanted to stop in and see what it was about. There are a handful of stores that I believe a Westerner would be interested in stopping by: Dukati (prices were really reasonable), Yala (had some luxury bath products and nice jewelry), Om, Sala (I was most enchanted with their blanket wool rugs as these would sell for over $1k in the US – NYC to be specific.) I’ll say, I found Om Handicrafts to be a bit sterile and at Western-like prices. Now did I buy something, yes, yes I did. I had wanted a 100% pure cashmere blanket and I thought in the United States these could range in the $400-800 price range depending on where you purchased. These at Om are part of a fair trade organization (which I prefer to support) and they had a masculine design to them (and I liked the chevron/herringbone/striped patterns in neutrals.) I paid $247 for a double bed size blanket (more for the couch in my particular opinion) and opted for a 4x4 weave. The less expensive weaves can be 1x1 (super thin) or 2x1 (medium to light weight and not as long or wide.) I will also say that the scarves that they offered are the same price as at Kopan monastery and look identical. And now that I have my blanket home, I'm disappointed to say that the edges are starting to show loose/frayed threads that are coming out of the blanket.

Its a strange experience to visit the palace. it seems like abandoned places, but still with some staff. Its dirty, dusty and the area where the shooting took place, strangely kept. As a backyard with no history.

column7: Wonderful new Hotel in the middle of Patan
column8: During my 3 day-stay I met a lot of new and kind people especially the owner and all who worked there. You can get a fantastic breakfast on a balcony with a wonderful view over Patan and the high Mountains.What a perfect start of the day! It's a very enjoyable Hotel close to the Temple and makes you feel close to Patan, Nepal and all its wonderful people!

Our first time in Nepal, and we stayed at Goathchen. It was such a good experience - the place itself - clean, traditional and cozy, the location right next to Durbar Square, and the hosts - so generous, that we ended up staying there once again when we passed through Katmandu. The low wooden ceilings, the wooden floors, big beautiful windows, the floor seating, and the very cozy low-rise bed, and the economy of the bathroom - very endearing and grounded - hobbit like Breakfast is shared with great generosity, as was the elaborate Newari dinner we were invited to, along with two of our friends who were staying elsewhere. Even more generous was our host Brijender in sharing his stock of the local Nepali Ruksi. We so enjoyed the Ruksi that we carried some back with us. Infact i

Goathchen is a lovely little 300-year old guest house tucked away in a quiet alley literally just around the corner from Patan Durbar square. The rooms are clean and charming with warm running water. Bed was comfortable with spring mattress and synthetic pillows. The owner and his wife are very generous and kind; they looked after us and offered delicious breakfast (local yoghurt, eggs, fresh fruit and coffee/tea) in the lush courtyard. They even took the time and celebrated my birthday with a traditional Newari ceremony with offerings and flowers. So sweet! If you are looking for an authentic home stay experience I would definitely recommend Goathchen.

Simply magical and spiritual. The architecture of the kings Malla is simply elegant and unique. People live around these magnificent place vacting to their usual daily life routine. It is a living museum.

Bhimsen Temple is dedicated to Bhimsen (known as Bhima in India), one of the five Pandavas of the Mahabarata. Bhima was known for his amazing strength, so it's rather fitting that his temple had the strength to survive the earthquake that did a lot of damage to neighboring temples and much of Nepal. Anyway, it's a beautiful temple with an interesting design.

Patan is Nepal's third largest city. Visit Patan is a special experience. Officially called Lalitpur, which translates as the City of Beauty, Patan is known for its rich cultural heritage. Durbar Square ( Main Square ) is interesting, full of magnificent buildings, temples, shops, and always a lot of people. There was a beautiful temple in the square, Char Narayan Temple. But this sixteenth-century temple collapsed completely in the 2015 earthquake. I firmly hope that we will enjoy his beauty again after restoration. We were here a lot of times earlier and we know how beautiful it looked.

column7: Service with heart and a smile
column8: If you want to experience the heart and love of the people of Nepal and give into their economy then go visit Bikram and Preeti. They have the biggest of hearts to make you welcome and serve you as their guest, always going above and beyond to make your stay as comfortable as possible. The accommodation is comfortable and once you get your bearings, it's a fine place away from the hectic and loud places such as Thamel. Please remember that many nations have set up in Nepal and run their own guest houses making it very difficult for the locals to compete. Champion the local beautiful people and support their business.

The water issue noted by chocolate179 below is unfortunately still very much a live and apparently persistent issue at this guesthouse or the room that I happened to stay at. It happened quite frequently during my stay there that there’s simply no tap water, whether hot or cold. When I complained to the owner that the water ran out while I was in the middle of taking a shower, he said that it was only a small issue and reminded me that I was in Nepal. I don’t think that it’s a small issue especially when it happened over and over again, or that it’s a Nepali thing. If you decide to stay there, here’s a tip you may find useful: When wifi isn’t working, just unplug the router and plug it back in again, and repeat these steps if necessary – ask the staff there to show you where

Cora Nepal is truly a home away from home. I had the pleasure of staying here for 6 weeks while I was working in Kathmandu and it was a major highlight of my experience. I was so impressed with their attention to detail in curating this carefully crafted aesthetic space. Both the guest experience and space has been thoughtfully organized to feel an instant sense of ease the second you walk through the door. Kathmandu is a busy rustling space, but I was lucky enough to stay at Cora Nepal where you're close enough to all the festivities, but far enough for some peace and quiet. In addition to a peaceful space, it is an excellent location with lots of great food walking distance. But of course, above all, hospitality and human connection are what ultimately bring spaces alive, and

Cora Nepal is a unique place. In Kathmandu you will rarley find a lot of hoses in a safe neighbourhood with such a heartful and light-flooded interior design, lovely decorations, friendly and flexible hosts who make sure that you feel welcome and comfortable throughout your stay, a lovely Didi who takes care of the rooms every single day, a Roof terrace to enjoy the mild evenings, a green garden filled with fresh vegetables and herbs and delicious and fresh breakfast facilities for the perfect start into the day. From the start I felt like home at Cora Nepal and was able to relax from the hustles of the city. The area of Sanepa is known for the delicious restaurants and cafés in walking distance. Great Yoga and Fitness studios are close by. Definitely my favorite place to stay

column7: incredibly peaceful in the middle of the city chaos
column8: it is surprisingly peaceful to walk around the huge stupa rolling the petitions and watching the religious people enjoy their faith. its surroundings are chaotic, however once you enter the square where the stupa is located, you can visit the monks and learn about the mandala tradition.

column7: Great help if your body is in trouble
column8: Went to Sotai's maybe 10 times in the past year or so. They always managed to fix my problems. Be it shoulders, lower back, legs, you name it. Usually, in my experience it took two sessions to really feel a difference. But that's it usually. Money well worth spent.
Heard a lot about their Jhol Momo and it exceeded my expectation. Staffs were very humble and friendly. Place looked clean with Nice interior. Foods were fresh.. Made my evening memorable..

1. No mineral water in stock so they apparently cannot buy from elsewhere and serve it. 2. Half an hour after taking the food order, the waitor comes and says one of the items not available 3. Medium steak was hard and chewy 4. Salad...More

Visited with friends in May 2017 for evening snacks. Great outdoor dining experience with the evening's cool breeze. Will strongly recommend the achari momo (dumplings in mild hot soup) and steamed momos (standard dumplings).

The ambiance is great, I liked it. The service was good and the food was delicious- Crispy potato and Jhol Momo! The Durbarmarg outlet is a lot better than the one in Pulchowk. I loooveeee their summer drinks though, they have cool ones!

This hidden treasure is in the famous Jhamsikhel (Jhamel) road and can easily go in-noticed among the flurry of much-bigger restaurants on the opposite side of the road. Was a great experience including the best food I've had in a while, good wait-staff and cosy ambience.  Pros: - Best Jhol momo in town - everything ordered was delicious - good place for any time of the day  Cons: - can offer a better assortment of dessert.
Ordered Chicken royal online from foodmandu... received pizza without cheese.. thick base.. not a good experience of pizza for me..

New and exciting environment which is designed with a unique style and decorum, accompanied by great live music on Wednesday and Friday. Complimentary starter by the Chef, good portion and great service.

Just went to evoke with friends had a good time good food service..previously wen i came Raji was my waiter very professional smart and good beverage knowledge.this time he was on on holiday so couldn't meet him..bt we had a good time.

column7: Best breakfast I had for a while
column8: The morning treat breakfast was plenty and delicious. I enjoyed each of the items. Fresh and properly done each of the. The juices were great too and have a wide selection
Nice place to relax at times. Food is decent, although can be temperamental. Live music on and off, so definitely a place with a potential to spend a good time at.

column7: Quint Guesthouse in the middle of Patan Durbar
column8: A newly renovated, small and warm guesthouse just at the back alley of Patan Durbar square. It has all the facilities that your need, A Western style bathroom, with water heater ( not solar) on each floor, there two double room per floor. Clean and comfortable room and bed, one of the best we had in Nepal. The guest house is hard to find as there is no signage and signboard, but once you locate it you will appreciate it location, it just a alley away from the main square, but it quieter than those guesthouse facing the square. You can just sit near the windows of the room and soak in the slow lifestyle of nepal. the only set back is the water heater is electrical, given the erratic electric supply of nepal, you have to time your shower or you might have to take a cold shower

column7: One of the best dining in Kathmandu
column8: The restaurant lives up to its unique feature of "Everything from scratch". The food taste super delicious...you could try all varieties ranging from croquettes, poleko timmur chicken, roasted pork to Gnochii, Saffron Risotto. Unique homely taste with cozy ambience. Perfect place for family dinner, friends...More
Nice little restaurant with great tasting food. I liked the flavor of the food the chef has created. We will be back

Something different would be a nice way to appreciate this restaurant. This is newly started by a Nepali family who's son used to be in restaurant industry in Melbourne Australia for quite some time and upon returning to Nepal decided to open a restaurant. Since...More
the barbecue was pretty good, but what i liked most was the chicken momo, fajita and fried prawns.The service was good, very friendly staffs. A must visit for everyone.

column7: The best BBQ ive ever had!!
column8: You can make your own bbq right on top of your table. Outside seating is very cozy and comfortable good for couple or a group. They have a nice seating inside with a nice bar and have a private rooms for corporate or family gathering. They have mouthwatering multi cuisine bbq and ala carte menu plus a wide selection of wines and spirits. Ive really enjoyed the grilled veggies with organic salad, bread rolls and homemade sauces of bbq, mint, chili and mustard. If you are too lazy to grill your own bbq the chef will do it for you in their glass partitioned see through kitchen where you can be assured of good hygiene and sanitation. Price and service are fantastic. Had a wonderful dining experience. Would visit again next time.
friendly bartenders and interesting people to meet there. Good music, simply an entertaining place to be.

column7: Third visit: Never lets my taste buds down!
column8: Came in for the third time. Absolutely foodgasmic experience. Ordered Chicken tandoori: perfect taste, well cooked, the mint chutney on point! Chicken tikka masala: The best curry dish I've had here. Spices, tenderness, amount perfect! Chicken butter masala: It was really good but Tikka masala...More

If you're looking for a good time, good food and good service, look somewhere else. This is the first and the last time my friends and I will be making a visit. Firstly, half of the items in the menu aren't available. Secondly, in the...More
Best place to have great experience of Japanese food with large varieties of food and great service.

Otafuku has so far 2 places serving platters of yumminess. The first original outlet is a small cosy corner tucked away under Bunker Hill. This diner offers you a live experience and you can watch your sushi being prepared while sipping a Asani beer or...More

smiling staff.....awasome and unique test of food ...specially jhaneko momos...&....peach iced lemon ........very good expireance but service was little bit slow...if they keep more staff than easy for guest and staff too....

column7: Fabulous restaurant, high quality food with very resonable price
column8: Have visited this restaurant several times. The atmosphere of the restaurant is open, clean and very pleasing. Decor is eye-caching. Very relaxing atmosphere. Very friendly staffs. The owner, Terry has several years' experience operating restaurants in Australia and his passion brought him to back to...More

smiling staff.....awasome and unique test of food ...specially jhaneko momos...&....peach iced lemon ........very good expireance but service was little bit slow...if they keep more staff than easy for guest and staff too....

This week I went to Manny's with a colleague for evening dinner. We sat for 15 minutes before getting menu. We ordered a bottle of wine, and steaks. We had just opened the wine and begun our meal when the head waitress came and said...More
The mango smoothie is really awesome! Ambience was really warm and cosy and staff very polite and friendly. Would definitely go back again the next time I come to Nepal!
We only stopped for a while, but the mango smoothie was really awesome! It was thick and authentic. We would recommend it to anyone.
Best in town for all cuisines that are served! Just be here to enjoy . . . Relax . . . To enjoy the food and be here for what you are here for to. . . enjoy the food.

column7: Ill-treatment of the owner. Never going to eat here.
column8: After today’s experience with the owner of this café I have started believing in the quote “Life surprises you when you least expect it.” In Nepali, it goes something like, “बच्नु मात्रै पर्छ के-के देख्नु पर्छ ।“ Since last year, I’ve been frequenting this place...More

It was my great journey with TripAdvisor & I got a great experience with them on the trip they provide us an amazing place which is Located just near the fort in the city(perfect location), the hotel is clean and provides u great hospitality. The...More

column7: Another amazing afternoon at this wonderful spot
column8: We visitied Musicology again and the place is getting better and better. More amazing drinks on the menu and some interesting new tasty treats too. The atmosphere is fantastic, and the crowd here is interesting, welcoming and chilled. Wondering who is curating the music that...More

The place has an incredibly relaxed vibe. The selection of food is unique and you'll always find the perfect beverage to compliment it. It's a miss if you still haven't been here. You'll be raving about the place everywhere! P.S It's always fun to be...More
I have been there several time with friends and family. Every time, I enjoy with the spirit ... it has variety of foods and drinks they serve to the customer...
Typical Japanese taste and very good hospitality.. nice food.... nice service. Good experience of Japanese food

column7: Authentic Japanese with an Interesting Twist
column8: During a recent trip to Kathmandu, I fortunately stumbled onto Otafuku Restaurant and its sister longer established counterpart, Otafuku Okonomiyaki location just up the hill. I ate Okonomiyaki the first night and enjoyed it so much, that I went back the second night to the...More

These people have really amazing tea to serve and pakages to take home. Their service is very impressive. I am their regular customer. Some times I also order espresso which is excellent too. They have parking space and ambience is unique.

I've visited Kaafe Lahsoon a few times now and always enjoy the experience. It's clean and comfortable, service is friendly, and the food is good, though portion sizes are a little bit on the small side so dinner companions often say that they still feel...More

It is one of the best place in Kathmandu if you are passionate about sports. Big are and good projection of English Premier League made this bar more attractive. Few bottles of beer and cocktail rolls will make your time more passionate. I find the...More

column7: Great local goods at reasonable prices
column8: Great souvenirs and interesting things- bags, trinkets, paper goods, jewelry, everything you could want. Good quality and reasonable prices. I bought coffee, tea, handmade notepads, brass hooks, computer bag, and coffee mugs.
Very good service and great masseurs Would recommend to everyone . Very good place to relax your tensed muscles 😉

I have been going to Chaitanya regularly for the past year and all of my experiences have been very welcoming with exceptional service. They even have Dr. Rakshya. for wellness consultation, where I did my first acupuncture session. I even book sessions for my family time & again.  They also give me some special discounts now and then 😉 . Definitely recommend you to try this wellness center once!
It was a relaxing experience I enjoyed every minute.The Massage was excellent & staffs were also very friendly. Would recommend this to anyone here around looking for a massage.

column7: Awesome place to relax body n soul
column8: Genuinely perfect place to relax ur mind and body in affordable price. Really appreciate the way they are giving their service. Thank you Chaitanya & family😊
A divine space where I completely lost myself with pampering rejuvenating and holistic therapy. Felt like place was meant to revive me with full energy.

Beautiful spa. So clean and relaxing. Besides being located in a gorgeous property, Chaitanya offers a pleasant ambiance. This place is awesome! They really understand and make sure that you are pampered and made to feel that you are the MOST important person there. The staff has exceeded our expectations in every interaction and went extra mile to deliver a memorable experience. I feel rejuvenated and recharged. Thank you, Chaitanya. Definitely recommending to my friends!

It was such a heavenly, peaceful, rejuvenating experience. It felt like a heavy burden was lifted from my shoulder and my neck. I could feel my tensions being washed away. Definitely would visit again. Also, I was lucky enough to be treated with a melodious song. Thank you Chaitanya Health & Wellness Spa

column7: absolutely loved it. It could not be more perfect.
column8: All I can say is I enjoyed it all. Loved the services they offers🙂 The entire atmosphere was pleasant. You won't regret for your investment on your health.

Expert was well aware of the job.. and they were not in hurry to completed the spa.. touched each and every important points of body to make you relaxed and rejuvenated..  I strongly recommend everyone to have this experience once u r in kathmandu.

I got a manicure and pedicure here. The spa was very clean, and the service I got was great. I got a full cleaning of my nails, great shaping, massage, and scented water. The ladies attending me were very sweet. The nail painting experience itself, however, was adequate. The nail polish selection was not very good, nor was the quality of the paint excellent. I only got one layer of paint and had to ask to get a topcoat. The painting experience makes me believe that service is slightly overpriced, but the service and cleanliness of the place was very good.

I am a regular at Chaitanya. They have very professional therapists and the ambience is soothing to the senses. Spa amenities could be upgraded for a more satisfying experience. Staff are responsive and courteous. Recommended!
I had Lower back physiotherapy. It was wonderful relief and felt like 1 hr passed so quickly like 0.5 hr while therapy.... i will definetly visit next time.....I

column7: Friendly, professional and clean as well as cosy
column8: I stayed at Shakya House on the recommendation of colleagues who always stay here when in Kathmandu. The owner Saajan and his family are friendly and always ready to help. The place is very clean and tidy and my room has a lovely terrace. The breakfast is simple but all you need (unless you want Nepali breakfast, but then, I never asked for that so maybe they can fix that too!). I also had to change money at quite short notice twice and they were able to help me out. I also recommend staying in Patan area where the guesthouse is (rather than the main Kathmandu tourist area Thamel) as its quieter, cleaner, much less touristy and hectic and also has a beautiful and interesting historical square - Patan Durbar square.

I love to go do my weekly Yoga practice in this spacious studio! It is not only a beautiful and clean space but it also offers a wide variety of practices and teachers that are accessible for people practicing yoga at any stage! The teachers are very kind and respectful and always willing to help or solve any doubts. There are retreats and workshops happening at least monthly so it is always a great opportunity to learn new things! One of the best thing is the location! The whole building is full of interesting Nepali businesses (coffee shop, dance studio, vegetarian restaurant, music school, etc). Overall a great place to hang out and approach yoga and other activities that Kathmandu has to offer!!

I've eaten at this restaurant 3 times in the past 6 months and each time the experience has been great. Twice I've taken my wife and once my nephew, and they both agree. The outside eating space is very nice. There is a small vegetable/herb...More

column7: I can't believe this is EVEN on anyone's list....
column8: Banal.....if you want a meal cooked at home might I suggest that you learn how to cook.

column7: Excellent Stay - Clean, Safe, Relaxing - Great for Solo Female Travelers!
column8: I stayed here for 10 nights in March and it was a wonderful experience. Very clean, cozy, and I felt very safe during my entire stay. There was a nice kitchen to prepare our own food, a rooftop with great views, and the woman who stays at the residence is amazing. I would highly recommend this place if you are looking for something a bit quieter.

It was a lovely and rejuvenating time with the professional and supporting team at the Ajasrika Ayurveda Center. Felt healthier and clearer after spending weeks at the center. Will recommend to friends and family.

I booked a seven day panchakarma therapy at the Ajasrika Ayurveda Center in Nepal. 7 days is a very short time for panchakarma and I' m still spurprised about the benefits of these few days. I feel much more relaxed and light, my skin became like a baby, I lost weight and my digestion work now properly. The team and stuff is very warm, friendly, familar and caring well for their clients. All the treatments and cleansing procedures are on a high level with very good quality. I got consultations with the doctors and they gave me guidance with diet, yogapractise, pranayama and other good tools also for the time after the therapy at home to continue. All working people there are familar, in a good mood and friendly, giving help and advice with all questions I had and helped very

I spent two weeks at Ajasrika center to learn ayurvedic massage and I had an beautiful experience. I learnt much more than expected, Dr Anila is the nicest person and a wonderful teacher in ayurvedic theory and yoga. Dhana is the greatest practical teacher full of amazing advices. Dr Kopila organised my stay very well too. All the staff is absolutly amazing, nice and really carring. (a little family) I was also lucky to experience massages and therapies such as nasya, shidohara, netra tarpana etc. All this treatements are incredible ! The accomodation is also beautiful and the ayurvedic food provide is so tasty ! I highly recommend this place either for training or retreat ! Thank you everyone for this lovely experience

I had the opportunity to stay for two weeks in the center. It was a unique expierience. The quality of the treatment was excellent. I can recommend the massages and the yoga lessons. All staff member are genuine friendly. I really look forward to come back.

Danfe Ghar is a great Guest House/ BB in Kathmandu. The area is called Sanepa and it is a peaceful friendly residential area with some NGOs and international organisations. This is actually a good thing because it means that the local coffee shops, cafés, grocery stores and restaurants are good! The owner and staff was always so nice, genuine, friendly and helpful with anything we needed during our stay in Kathmandu. Do not hesitate to ask for tips about what to see and where to go! It was a really nice experience to feel that the owner really wanted us to like Danfe Ghar, the neighbourhood and Nepal. The rooms are always kept super clean and decorated in a nice welcoming vibe. I loved the balcony. I can highly recommend Danfe Ghar. I will book Danfe Ghar again! However, the

We traveled as a group of students from Norway and were lucky enough to rent rooms at Gracemandu for our stay. The staff and house were excellent! If I ever come back to Katmandu, I will definitely come back to Gracemandu / Norwegian house. Thanks again for our stay.

column7: Best place for work and nice fresh food
column8: Suburb is a clean, modern Guesthouse with big bedrooms and a very good restaurant. The breakfast is fresh and there are a lot of things to choose from. I used this place to work and the WiFi is very good everywhere, even in the garden - what is my favorite place. Also for lunch and diner Suburb is my favorite. The service is perfect and the guy's can tell you many things about the food and the menu. I think Suburb is a special place to stay because of the location, it's unique, clean and very charming.

I stumbled on this absolute gem as I woke up very early, wanted to walk and headed towards the hotel where I was scheduled for a meeting. The menu looked interesting, it was open early, and I spotted the lovely gardens with tables to eat at. The coffee was excellent and Eggs Benedict absolutely fabulous - perfectly done and delicious. I ended up chatting to the only other customer and it was very convivial. They even charged my phone for me while I ate - excellent service! I will definitely be back!

Love the hotel highly recommend .The hotel is 500m from patan durbar square and only 4 km from the international airport.The hotel provides rich local culture and an amazing experience with the comfortable rooms

column7: A great stay, which truly felt like homestay!
column8: We stayed 3 nights at Jon and Eilleen's guesthouse, which was a great way to break from the agitation of Kathmandu. The room was cozy and the house generally felt like home, with a big kitchen to cook and board games in the common living room :) And that is of course not mentionning the rooftop and the sauna, which we unfortunately didn't get time to try. Jon and Eilleen were great hosts, and directly made us feel comfortable in their house. I very much recommand staying there!

The accommodation is very good..we spent our days with peace there. Staffs were very warm and friendly, they greeted and welcomed us in a very well manner. The apartment was provided with balcony and well ventilated room. Air conditioning master bedroom The kitchen was also well maintained and cleaned provided with all the necessary utensils and refrigerator.with 2 toilet in apartment also in good for family.There was also a space where we relaxed, watched TV and enjoyed our time. Overall the facilities were too good and best for family. We felt like we stayed at home as it provides us the secu rity and comfortable environment. We would love to stay there again!

column7: Excellent Location. Top notch team. Very friendly and helpful.
column8: The Apartment was in a superb location. A soon as you come out of the apartment, their were plenty of restaurants to eat at. We were a group of 3 ladies and stayed at the apartment between 2nd March and 6th March 2019 All in all a very good experience. We loved Kathmandu and its people.

Very clean and very good breakfast, the host are very friendly. We felt like a home away from home. Recommended for the people who wants to have quite time. Location is very good. All the famous Restaurant are walkway. I have enjoyed there. I will be on my next trip as well.

This is a shared house experience. They have multiple floors and a clean kitchen downstairs for all to use. They do have single rooms and will try to accommodate you anyway they can. They give keys to come and go as you please. Showers have hot water!

column7: Sweet simple and clean. Wonderful healing experience of massage!
column8: I found out about this gem from Cozy Nepal booklet. Wellness sanctuary is just on top of Cafe Chino ( you need to go to the courtyard through cafe) two mins after you come out from Patan gate.  It’s very simple, quiet and clean. The girls are sweet and well-trained. The whole atmosphere is just relaxing and safe.  I had the signature Wellness massage two days in a roll, because I could sense how my body felt during and after massage. It’s not forceful or too much pressure but deep enough to take care of the tension and fatigue of my body. After the first masssge, I immediately booked the second one next day. And had another wonderful experience. The girl masssged for me was so good. She found the tension stored in my body and helped to release it. I will definitely come back and book appointment everyday when I come to Patan next time. I traveled a lot and knows the value of this kind of masssgs. Thank you!

I had the worst experience of my life at this coffee shop today. My son wanted a cookie and a server(male), who had long, dirty and the most horrible looking nails, used his hand to get the cookie out of the jar. I asked him...More

thanks to a friend, we met Gajendra and Thana. they are so nice, so generous and kind that we felt at ease since the first day. excellent the program made just for the two of us, we enjoyed every single day of our trip! very good organization both for the trekking and the jungle…
It was really well planned and managed by the travel agent. Staffs were very cooperative. One of the best experience ever.

Been to Poon Hill with my friends from workplace recently. Sunrise from this place is just awesome, was worth waking up at 4:30 on the morning after 8 hrs of hike on previous day. One of the finest travel experience I ever had. Highly recommended...

“Wonderful Trip” Great experience! Very less trekkers on this Mardi Himal route. Majestic views when you reach the top. Local People, village, nature, mountains an unforgettable memory of my life. If you are looking for less crowded trekking route, this is a place to go. You…
Amazing fun with amazing people. I highly recommend as a best choice for your trip. I really appreciate for a well organized trip and great service. See you again and again!!

column7: Excellent and Recommended for any traveller
column8: We spent 16 days from Jomsome to Upper Mustang Awesome experience. Staff was fantastic. Mentioning few that made our stay pleasant – Jomsome, Kagbeni, Chelay, Mukthinath, Bhena etc. Thank you ! We will be back !

It was really wonderful trip I ever had.We enjoyed it very much and appreciate being so well taken care of. Nepal is an amazing country. I would not hesitate to recommend Asian Eco journey to any one.
The best and well arranged tour ever, thanks for everyone for managing tour in excellent way. We appreciate your uniqueness and food stuffs in vehicle.

column7: Awesome trek to Everest base camp
column8: Oneal was able to set up a crazy experience trekking to Everest Base Camp for me and a mate! He tailored the itinerary to our ability and paired us with a fantastic guide who shared his infinite wisdom of the Nepali countryside and culture in fantastic English. Alongside the…

column7: Great guide and very well organized trekking trip
column8: My friends and I did a 10-day trekking trip with Oneal around the Khopra Ridge in the Annapurna area. It was a truly unforgettable experience, well organized and executed. When hiring guides, we go for small operators that do not do a cookie cutter approach, but provide a…

column7: The best way to see Kathmandu
column8: I booked with Oneal to see the real Kathmandu and all of the wonderful interesting sites nearby. I went to sites which weren't as touristy and it was amazing. So authentic, even down to the lunch / masala tea stops which were all hidden gems. I was very impressed with Oneal's…

column7: Thoughtful trekking and comfortable home stays
column8: I met Oneal in 2013, he didn't have a company or an agenda. Oneal was just a nice guy who worked at hostel while he was in school. I kept in touch with him for a couple years, that relationship grew into a comfortable friendship. I made my way back to Nepal this year without…
Oneal was willing and happy to help with any requests that I had. He understood what kind of experience I was after and was able to to provide exactly that. Thanks mate. I'll be back one day

The whole trip was an experience for a lifetime! From the pickup in Kathmandu over the trip on astonishing existing and busy roads to the cosy tea houses with overwhelming views on deep valleys and high snowy mountains, all was well prepared and planned. Praksh knows the people…

Everything was fantastic! the tour guide Shree is really helpful, knowledgeable and anxious to make your trip to Nepal unique and wonderful. I really wanted to see the rural areas of Nepal and told him that i am interested to see some schools because of my studies, he organized…

WANT SOMETHING UNIQUE!! SEE NEPAL! We had a really nice and relaxing trip to Nepal. Did tour of Kathmandu - Bandibur - Pokhara. Beautiful landscapes with nice people. We enjoyed with our tourguide Mr Shree and his driver ”Mr Money”. Shree had picked us nice hotels and places…

Chin and his team (shout out to guide Abe and porter Ram!) are incredible. I cannot overstate the professionalism, honesty and safety of our Pristine Trekking experience in Nepal (Manaslu + Poon Hill) Competitive pricing but with clear superior value on the trek (relative to…

column7: The best experience you could have
column8: My wife and I visited Nepal for our honeymoon and were recommended Chin and Pristine Nepal as we really wanted to do some trekking - namely the Annapurna Circuit. We got in touch and arranged to meet up. Chin has worked as a guide for well over 15 years and he’s great at finding…

Straightforward planning and organization of the whole trip! Pick up by the guide worked smoothly and without any problems. Throughout the whole trekking trip the guide supplied us with interesting cultural insights into this very amazing country. Accomodation was simple but…

My first time in Nepal, Ganesh and his family made me feel so at home! I always felt safe and taken care of. I was so happy he organised for me to go on a beautiful hike in the Kathmandu Valley with his daughter and sisters. As a nurse, I feel so happy I was able to volunteer at…

With 4 friends I booked a trip from Nepalgunj to Kathmandu via Lumbini,Chitwan,Salang. We were demanding from Mr Chin a flexibel approach and we got it. He was always very friendly,helpful and competent.As a guide in Kathmandu he knew a lot of interesting stories to tell and we…

In january me and my girlfriend visited Nepal for 3,5 weeks. Contacting Mr. Chin was one of the best decisions. He helped us with everything and invited us to his house. Prefer more freedom with your program? No problem. He is very flexible with arranging things and his main…

Visiting Nepal was indeed a fantastic experience of my lifetime. Thanks to Pristine Nepal for giving me a tour in Patan (Lalitpur) with full of Nepali cultural information. I have a huge interest in arts, culture and history, and I genuinely appreciate Ganesh who took extra…

column7: An amazing Annapurna Circuit solo trekking experience!
column8: In july 2014 a friend and I visited Nepal. While trekking, we met Chin, back then he was guiding another group/person. I remember having learned a lot about Nepal through him at that time, and I got to know him as a very friendly and responsable person. By the time I decided to…

We had an incredible time in Nepal. Pristine Nepal organized a wonderful experience for a friend and I. We started and ended our adventure in Kathmandu with a pickup and drop off at the airport. Ganesh was our tour guide around the city with much knowledge at each site. Then…

column7: Unbelievable, Amazing, Fantastic Trip - Annapurna Base Camp and More!
column8: I just returned from 5 weeks in Nepal and Pristine Nepal did a great job in making it a truly memorable trip! From picking me up at the airport, to their hospitality while staying at their homestay, to treking and volunteering - Pristine Nepal made me feel at ease and at home…

This two month stay in Nepal was just unforgettable...First of all i have to thank Chin and his whole family for their unbelievable hospitality and kindness. Living with them they made me feel like a family member. When i came back to their house after my trips somehow i always…

I had an amazing time in nepal! First of all I had the opportunity to teach english in a women school in kathmandu and visit some projects in the mountains. It was a georgeos experience. And the second thing is that we could make a lot of tours with ganesh and chin :) Amazing…

Thank you and big respect to Chin and his whole family. Nepal was our first trip to Asia and from the beginning on we had their support, so we never felt "lost" there. We learned a lot of interesting stuff and got introduced to the Nepali culture so it was very easy for us to…

My girlfriend and I had such an amazing time with this whole organization. They helped us for everything from our arrival in Nepal. Even before our arrival, they made sure we had everything we needed by asking us if we wanted to get picked up from the airport. They also hosted…

column7: Volunteer + Live with host family! Truly one of a kind experience with Pristine Nepal!
column8: I had first reached out to Ganesh with interest to volunteer during my days off (I live in Dubai, UAE). He was quick to respond with two separate 5-6day itinerary for me to chose from. Many people goto Nepal for hiking mt.Everest, but the experience I had with Pristine Nepal was…

Pristine Nepal helped me and my friend get to the EBC in one of the most amazing hiking tour I’ve had in my life. The team (Chin, Rabin the tour guide and Uyol the porter) were just awesome on the whole 16 days we stayed in Kathmandu and in the Sagarmatha National Park. Can’t be…

I 120 % recommend pristine Nepal to make your adventure to EBC or other region of Nepal. We where really lucky to met Chin, a great person and very helpful man who makes everything perfect for us and for a very good price. From the pick up to the drop off to the airport was…

We chose Pristine Nepal because of the promising recommendation and did't regret the decision at all. Not only we saw the "normal" highlights of Kathmandu like Dubar Sqaure, but also the more hidden on the other side of Kathmandu Patan Durbar Square. Thanks for the good time -…

Chin is a fantastic guide. I trekked to Everest Base Camp with Chin and I couldn’t have asked for a better guide. Chin is likable, informative, and professional. His experience, and guidance will put worries at ease, and he is determined to get you to your destination at your…

About one week ago ,I with my friends had a great experience to going toward ABC Camp . The company along with Subash guided us toward to base camp , Subash was a very committed, kind and thorough person and provided us with many good and economical facilities during our…

Bad food. Price for food exceptionally high even for the location. The food was cold. (i.e. Chips chilly and Veg Pizza.) Service was bad. Overall a bad experience. Do not recommend. Didn't even have a POS machine to use my card.
The food, ambiance, service, everything was on point. I had a great experience dining at Queens. Their burgers are a must! Would definitely recommend it.

It was my great journey with TripAdvisor & I got a great experience with them on the trip they provide us an amazing place which is Located just near the fort in the city(perfect location), the hotel is clean and provides u great hospitality. The...More

My husband, a colleague and I dined at Summit and had a truly memorable evening. Our server Rajeev was a delightful host who not only advised on menu selections but explained much about the history and culture surrounding various dishes. The menu offered many selections,...More

Right at the edge of the square and near the ticket office , the two wooden buildings overlook a water tank. It is believed they were built in 1700 for royal coronations purposes and both suffered damage in April 2015 and are being repaired.They tend to be over-looked by the more interesting buildings in the square.

With amazing food services, panoramic views from terrace and certainly with the best services from team of Shangri-la Homestay. I enjoyed my whole stay in the hotel, And like to surely recommend others.Cheers.

Best place for a quick getaway. It gives you a wholesome Nepal experience in 24 hrs. The breathtaking mountain ranges are visible in all their splendour, quick hiking trails to be explored, mountain biking tracks nearby, a great spa with some exotic sound healing sessions, a mod infinity pool with a jacuzzi and sauna, glittery night view of the valley. Adventure, peace, lounging to perfect beats … it’s all there. When you Are short on time but want it all… this is it

column7: What a pity - good food but terrible atmosphere
column8: When I go to a restaurant I expect to spend some good time with my people, enjoying good food : At Grill Me, you can really enjoy your order as the food is very good...but my god, you can’t have a proper discussion with your...More

column7: Good interior, average food, poor value
column8: This restaurant looks well designed, specially the bar area. However, the atmosphere seems somewhat bland,that might not be very bad though.  The food is average, not something you expect from a pricey restaurant that boasts of serving some of the best grilled meat in town. A plate of grilled prawn was enough for us, not quantity wise though, as the portion was really small. The accompanying salad seemed like something they prepared for their goats and as an afer thought putit on our plate. The only saving grace was their special salad which was quite good and the portion good.  The live band was good with english songs but it was irritating to hear them trash the Nepali classics with hangover of their english songs, their accent to be precise.  It's expensive, very expensive considering the portion. Overall an average experience.

column7: Grill Me? Deafen Me, more like!
column8: I went to Grill Me with friends who had eaten there before and they thought it was worth another try. The restaurant is well laid out, service was fairly good, reasonable menu, etc. It should have been a pleasant experience.  However, all of the good points were drowned out by the extremely loud music of the live band. We literally could not hear each other without shouting. Perhaps it could be accepted in a late-night bar, but in a restaurant it is both ridiculous and a complete insult to the paying customers.  Our first polite request to the waiter to reduce the volume was listened to but not acted on, in hindsight probably because the waiters were intimidated by the players. When we pressed the matter with the waiter and he nervously told the players, they gave us a rude "so you don't like our music?", and then played an even louder song. When they finally took a break, it felt like someone had stopped hitting me about the head.  The food was reasonable by Kathmandu standards, acceptable by international standards. The seafood starter were nice, the other starters OK. I opted for pork chops, they were ordinary and harmless, maybe pork is not their speciality. No complaints about the food, but no great praise either. The meal was by no means cheap, but it was not unreasonable for western-style food.  I've given this restaurant 2 out of 5 as a fair balance between reasonable food, reasonable service, but dreadful customer treatment by the band. I would not visit this place again.

For some relaxation after sightseeing in busy downtown Kathmandu the terrace of Green Hill Restaurant & Bar in a quiet, almost rural neighbourhood of Kathmandu is definitely worth a visit. The view on the valley is beautiful, enjoying a good meal on the terrace is a nice experience. Service is friendly, sanitary facilities are clean. Good value for money!
Utkrista Travel is always responsible for customer requirements as well as quality service during the trips. Simply amazing company ........ Highly Recommended !!!!!!!!!!!!!

Find it difficult to put my experience into words. Came back yesterday from Nepal where I did the Ghorepani Poon Hill trek with UPEVEREST. First words that come to mind are: amazing, humbling and memorable! Nepal is a gorgeous country with the sweetest people! If you are still…

Having injured my arm after a high speed bicycle crashed into me, and after I visited a nearby hospital (excellent treatment) I headed to Koto which was a few hundred meters away...  I ordered a delicious grilled salmon soup with restaurant made superb tofu pls a bowl of rice and grilled chicken skewers with onions. Accompanied by jasmine tea and a restaurant prepared to stay open beyond closing time to serve only me, I was impressed. My uploaded photo also shows an ice pack that the restaurant helped me prepare and fix to my wrist with a napkin and hair tie so I could start looking after my injury while having a nurturing meal.  I cannot fault Koto on my personal specific experience and am grateful for their willingness to assist and look forward to visiting again to try some other dishes..,

Koto is my family's favorite Japanese restaurant in Kathmandu. We go almost every weekend for the delicious gyoza, don buri, tempura, sushi rolls, and soba noodles. We have never had a bad experience with the raw fish, the staff are wonderful, and the prices are very reasonable! Would highly recommend.

this is the first time i had bad experience here.... had ordered udon and teriyaki chicken .... the service was very late and when the udon arrived it had strand of hair in it ...later we saw that the chefs did not have head cap...More

I enjoyed a casual dinner here one evening, stumbling upon the restaurant quite by accident and were surprisingly impressed.The service was excellent, the food was quiet good and looked healthy fresh. They have a Brilliant Menu!!The soup and sushi were delicious. The prawns were also amazing..

I had Tendon and Gomaae, and as a Japanese who lives in Delhi, India, I enjoyed my meal! The staff was also very polite and attentive (e.g. giving tea, offering to change the mug if tea got cold, bringing toothpick after meal, etc). I would...More

This is the only restaurant I found which had jap cuisine that tasted Japanese- without Nepalese touches added to cater to the Nepalese tastebuds. Bonus: they had chawan mushi (love iiiit) I visited the durbar marg branch in the evening. Although the place was set up nicely and we had one of those tatami rooms which I appreciated very much, the restaurant was unfortunately very near another restaurant which were belting out Nepalese folk songs LOUDLY. This killed the ambience. **It might have been better to visit in the daytime.** The waiters were quite attentive, although it almost got to a point where we felt like little daycare children being checked on in case we were doing something naughty- a smile would have been appreciated. Also it is on the pricier side. For 3 people, we spent about 3k but then it's at your own discretion. Inspite of all these, we thoroughly enjoyed the food. They are the most authentic and DELICIOUS Japanese cuisine I have found in nepal so far and that's the biggest point for me. I will be back for sure on my next visit to nepal.

column7: Good, authentic Japanese food but be prepared to spend
column8: To find the experience pleasant, you definitely have to be a Japanese food lover. Just my two-cents for Nepalese first timers to Japanese food, the taste can seem quite "bland" to the Nepalese tongue.  I visited the Pulchowk branch and the service there could be better. Our host for the evening only showed up after about 15 minutes of sitting down. You will have to get their attention quite a number of times if you want fast service.  Laments aside, the food there was absolutely delightful! The menu is quite large and there are a lot of dishes to choose from.   I would set aside visits to Koto for special occasions as it is on the pricey end of places to eat at. But it is definitely worth it!
The food here is really awesome...a must if in Kathmandu and want to eat Japanese...

column7: Go Now! Do not wait to experience this!
column8: Wow!! What an experience! We had the time of our lives during this trip. Trekking team adventure took care of all the necessary permits, booking, guide, porter and so much more! Once we landed in Kathmandu we were completely comfortable with the care this teams staff treated us. Their priority was our health, safety and happiness and it was obvious. Everyone is an absolute joy to be around, very friendly good natured people that treated us like family if not better. We managed to complete the full itinerary for our trip without issue as well as tweak some things we wanted to do(such as staying an extra day in a place we really liked) without any issue. We truly fell in love with Nepal and are already planning our next trip and we without a doubt choose Trekking team adventure! Thank you so much for everything!

I have just returned from the Everest base camp trek and it was best experience ever. Everything went perfectly and according to plan. Our guide Ram was so much fun and clearly managed our expectations in terms of what to expect on the hike. He made us laugh lots and kept our spirits up on the more difficult parts. I couldn’t recommend going through this company enough, everything was planned in advance for us and it made our trip run as smoothly as possible.
It was a fabuleuse trek smith a very good organisation. I appreciate the guide and sherpas vert kind and secure

Trekking Guide Team Adventure provided a good value and well organised travel and trekking experience to Everest Base Camp.  They kept in contact in the lead up to the trip and ensured we had all the documentation and itineraries required. Arrival and transport was smooth and we were grouped with 5 other trekkers.  Our guide during the trek, Shambu, was very friendly and always helpful and organised. He took good care of everyone, engaged with the group on important decisions and was just good fun to trek with. The accommodation and food during the trek was good (noting mountain accommodation will always get more challenging as it gets more remote).  Overall, the trek was fun, challenging and very satisfying.  I would happily recommend Trekking Guide Team Adventure to anyone looking to do the EBC trek.

I did this trek with a friend; Shambu was our guide. What an excellent trip. I cannot fault Shambu, he had a wealth of knowledge and local expertise. The tea houses were all appropriate and we felt that we had benefited from his knowledge. I have gained a great experience that I would recommend to anyone, and, in addition I’ve gained a Nepalese friend!

This trip was amazing, highly recommended. I can't speak more highly of our guide Shambu. From the moment we met him at our hotel in Kathmandu, he made sure all our needs were catered for on the trip, adjusting to suit the group requirements. His local knowledge was outstanding, providing unique cultural insights that added a personal touch to the trip. I would not hesitate to utilise Shambu as my guide on future treks in Nepal.

I booked the EBC & Kala Pathar with a friend, I feel so lucky to have had Shambu as our guide. He was very knowledgeable & friendly, he arranged everything and was keen to help us out where needed. Shambu was able to answer any question I asked. Kabi was always quick to reply (email) to any questions I had prior to the trip commencing. I would recommend this trip to anyone.

What a fantastic, challenging adventure. 12 days of beautiful scenery mixed in with a tough, challenging 8 day walk up to EBC and 4 days back. Our guide Shambu Basnet and Monoj (porter) were instrumental in helping us achieve our goal. I felt safe and confident in Shambu's military expertise in guiding us up to our destination. Due to weather, we opted to helicopter out of Lukla so were in awe of the speed and efficiency this was organised. I cannot speak highly of Shambu Basnet or Monoj, they were both highly professional in their roles, they both went above and beyond there duties to ensure we had an experience to remember. I'd like to think we gained a new friend. A huge thank you to the "Trekking Guide Adventure Team" who worked with us to make this journey an enjoyable one.

We had a fabulous experience with Trekking Guide Team Adventure. Our tour guide Shambu and porter Monoj were very accommodating and experienced. My special dietary requirements were catered for by Shambu as well as our requests for inside flushing toilets when available in the mountain accommodation. Shambu was very knowledgeable and had a very positive encouraging personality that made our trip very enjoyable and fun. We would definitely recommend the company, guide and porter again.

column7: What a fantastic trip to Everest Base Camp
column8: Thank you so much to the team at Trekking Guide Team Adventure! We have had a wonderful trip and ticked off a bucket list item. When booking and arranging everything Kabi was fantastic to communicate with and always came back to me quickly. Once in Kathmandu we met our guide Ram. He was absolutely excellent for the whole trip and had a huge amount of knowledge about the area and what we would see, he made sure we were always having a great time and was such a pleasure to be around. We met up with some other people on the trek and Ram was so good to help them with booking accommodation and also making sure they had a good time too, even though they were not officially part of our group. I can honestly say this had been one of the most amazing experiences of my life and if you get Ram as your guide you will have a fantastic time! He is a legend!! I am very sorry to leave him behind as it feels we have shared so many good times and made a great friendship! Thank you so much!! David Crofton

column7: First time Trekker and we did EBC- Challenging but worth it!
column8: Trekking Guide Team Adventure made the experience unique and unforgettable. Booking was easy and Kabi is very responsive to any queries before arriving to Kathmandu.  We were assigned Kris as our guide (who is very experienced and has been trekking this course for roughly 37 years) and he took great care in making sure we had a great experience during the trek. Any concerns we had were addressed and he made sure that everyone made it to EBC in a very safe and comfortable way. He also made sure we were mentally prepared for each walk and that we ate well (especially for me, as I lost my appetite due to altitude). The accommodation were all booked in tea houses which were comfortable for us trekkers, it added to the experience as most nights we were in the main room playing cards and sharing stories.  We had a few extra days and booked the Chitwan Jungle Safari which added to the fun and wonderful experience in Nepal. I really recommend this if you have a few days to spare.  I'm truly thankful that we booked with the team as it was stress free and they took care of everything that needed to be taken cared of. I'll never forget this experience, it's once in a lifetime. I will be booking through them on my next adventure to Nepal.

column7: EBC Trek - Amazing Experience and very well organised by Trekking Guide Team Adventure
column8: All I can say is that this trip was amazing!  Trekking Guide Team Adventure organised everything and it all went perfectly. All we did was book and pay and Kabi and his team took care of the rest - all accommodation, domestic flight, bus travel, porters, etc. It couldn't have been easier!  When you arrive into Kathmandu, your are picked up and taken to the accommodation right in the heart of the tourist district 'Thamel' with all the shops/bars/food you could ask for.  The trek itself was a once in a lifetime adventure. We felt so well looked after with private rooms in the tea houses and specialist advice along the way regarding food, staying warm, the region, the wildlife and importantly, altitude sickness.  Special mention to our guide - Krishna Nepal aka Kris - Kris was amazing, friendly, informative and funny. He made the trek to EBC so fun and the long days of walking were made easier with his company and jokes. Many a night were spent playing cards - a definite highlight!  I would recommend Trekking Guide Team Adventure without hesitation - the whole trip went so smoothly without a hitch.  Make sure you book with these guys - and ask for Kris to guide you!

column7: Great experience! Best tour and guide ever
column8: Kabi and his team are very experienced in organising such trekking tours. I highly enjoyed the time that I spend in Nepal with my two friends. They were flexible with our schedule and ensured that the itinerary was up to our standards.  Not only do I highly recommend this company, but I highly recommend the guide that we had too - Shambu. He was quite honestly the best guide that we could have asked for. A deeply knowledgeable guide who knew boat loads of the country, its history and its culture. He was also very experienced on the trek, knowing how to tackle certain things, keeping our schedule organised and making sure nothing went wrong. A truly kind and compassionate person - always putting his guests before him. Again, if you do book through this company, I'd recommend requesting for Shambu because he is the best guide ever!

Trekking guide team adventure created an amazing experience for me and my two friends. Kabi is organiser was able to fit our requirements very well. We had a tight schedule but the dates were able to line up perfectly! The guide Shambu made the trip 1000 times better. He is extremely knowledgeable and was able to answer all our questions about the history and culture of the mountains. He was very friendly and well connected with the locals meaning he was able to get us rooms when others were sleeping in tents outside. He also knew airport staff and made sure we were able to get higher priority on flights. His priority is always his guests and made sure to always check if we were comfortable. Shambu is the best possible guide you can get and make sure you ask for him when you do this trek!

We were a little apprehensive in booking this trip and wondered whether we were fit enough, both being in our 50's. We found the company (TGTA) to be very professional and experienced and answered all of our questions promptly before setting off. Our main guide Kris has decades of guiding experience and was able to determine the level of attention and care required for each of the 10 trekkers in our group. The trek is arduous and does require a certain level of stamina and fitness to achieve the end goal. We did very limited pre-trek training and would have benefitted from a few weeks or months in the gym (squats and leg strengthening would have been most helpful), nevertheless we endured and conquered. We thoroughly recommend Karbi, Krishna, and the wonderful porters who helped to make our trip enjoyable and memorable. We should also acknowledge the wonderful Nepalese people who are trustworthy, friendly and helpful and reliant on the tourist dollar for their survival. Keep up the good work guys, we hope we can return to your beautiful country someday soon. Best Regards Stuart and Jacque.

I completed the 12 day Everest Basecamp trek with family members in March / April this year.
